story:
Zig Zag le citron très gentil

(Zig Zag the very nice lemon)

 

Dans une petite ville tranquille du nom de Dontbelle habite un jeune homme nommé Célestin. Célestin demeure dans un appartement, au rez-de-chaussée. Plusieurs voisins et amis l’entourent et vivent tout aussi paisiblement, même s’ils ont chacun une vie très différente. Célestin aime beaucoup la musique, tellement qu’il en a fait son gagne-pain. Un matin, Célestin se rend au supermarché; il fait beau, le ciel est clair et il sourit. Une fois arrivé, il prend, comme à l’habitude, un panier pour y déposer ses achats. Mais en ouvrant la porte du supermarché, il découvre à sa plus grande stupéfaction qu’une énorme montagne de citrons occupe presque tout entier le rayon des fruits et légumes. C’est alors qu’il fait la rencontre de Zig Zag le citron!

Pour les 4 à 11 ans et comme pour les adultes, à la fois éducatif et drôle, Zig Zag le citron emporte avec lui sa magie, et se nourrit des forces semées sur sa route, dans ses voyages avec Merlin le Touta (Marianne Farley) où il fait la rencontre de précieux amis qui feront partie de sa vie, comme Madame Georgette (Maxime Le Flaguais), Richard l’africain (MC Gilles), la vieille grand-maman et d'autres personnages épisodiques qui feront sa rencontre. Les illustrations des personnages sont de la talentueuse April Petchsri.  Certains artistes comme Tristan-Loys Perrot, Niki Lambros et Claudia Laurie prêteront leurs voix à des personnages secondaires hauts en couleurs! D'autres artistes s'ajouteront au fil du temps!


Campagne

Les fonds recueillis par cette campagne serviront pour une partie de la distribution globale de l'album, la mise en marché du produit, les relations publiques, la production, mais également afin d’aider des enfants qui ont des difficultés d'apprentissage. Nous allons prendre le temps nécessaire pour que le produit final soit parfait. Quelques chansons et sketches audio sont déjà terminés et nous sommes actuellement à écrire et composer pour le reste de l'album, qui sera composé d’autres sketches, de chansons, d'ambiances sonores et de musique instrumentale.


Qui est le fondateur du projet?


Célestin Bouchard

 

Célestin Bouchard est un artiste multidisciplinaire. Il est né en Gaspésie mais habite Montréal depuis son adolescence. Violoniste de formation, il fut finaliste au concours Ma première Place des Arts comme auteur-compositeur. Il travailla auprès des enfants comme professeur de théâtre, de musique et d'éducation physique dans des écoles primaires du Québec de 2004 à 2009. Il fut également le maître de cérémonie de la Fête des enfants de Montréal sur la grande scène où il anima les spectacles pendant deux ans. Il a à son actif trois albums dont le succès Entre les abeilles (2010) et la chanson Vendredi avec Patrick Norman. Au fil des ans, il collabore avec plusieurs artistes autant à la radio qu'à la télévision. Pigiste comme chroniqueur, acteur et compositeur, Célestin Bouchard a toujours eu un humour bien à lui. Il a su se développer et se distinguer également avec un côté plus sérieux et pédagogique autant en musique qu'en écriture. Son objectif est de présenter Zig Zag le citron en animation avec les illustrations d'April Petchsri pour faire découvrir un monde fantastique, drôle et éducatif aux enfants du monde entier.


Aide précieuse des contributeurs :

L'aide que vous apporterez au projet sera plus que précieuse, vous deviendrez automatiquement des hôtes qui participerez au départ de cette aventure. Vous pourrez voir l'évolution de Zig Zag le citron, avoir accès à certains privilèges, être mis au courant des futurs spectacles et bénéficier d'éventuels évènements liés au projet. Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif avec cette campagne, nous prioriserons les étapes nécessaires pour que l'album voie le jour et nous continuerons de chercher d'autres moyens pour que nos objectifs soient atteints.  Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer au projet, vous pouvez passer le mot à vos contacts! Cela aidera à faire connaître Zig Zag le citron! 

Pour nous contacter, pour nous envoyer un don, ou pour de plus amples informations, vous pouvez nous joindre par courriel à cosmimusique@gmail.com                  

Merci!

story:
Once Upon a Time...

... there were four girls - Mia, Rose, Marissa and Morgan. The first three girls were from Arizona, USA; Morgan was from Sydney, Australia. They lived together for 4 fantastic months in Tucson, Arizona. They were the best of friends and had brilliant fun together. But then, Morgan's exchange was over and she had to go home to Australia. Everyone was very upset and the girls missed each other very much.

But then! The girls came up with a brilliant plan to save up enough money for the three Americans to travel to Australia. Morgan's 21st birthday is in December and they thought that would be the perfect time to visit. They realised very quickly that it costs a lot of money to travel from the US to Australia though, and that they would need help to get there.

The magnitude of this plan is far beyond us - but it's a dream that's very close to our hearts. The sheer joy that would come out of being able to see each other again is too big for words and we would be unimaginably grateful for any help you can give us.

What We Need

So, here's the deal:

  • Return flights from Phoenix to Sydney = $2,500
  • x 3 for each of the girls
  • = $7,500
  • + Indiegogo fees and the possibility of rising prices
  • = approx. $8000

That's a lot of money. But Indiegogo only allows for 60 day campaigns - and while we're positive, we're not positive enough to assume we can raise $8000 in two months. So we've set a more realistic goal of $4000 (to avoid higher fees from Indiegogo if we don't reach our goal).

If we raise more than that, we will be very, very happy. If we reach $8000, we will be bloody ecstatic. And if not, we take stock of how much we have, how much we have saved ourselves by that point and maybe try a second campaign or other avenues to raise the rest of the money. Of course, we're all working very hard at our own jobs to save as much as we can.

What You Get

Our eternal gratitude and love.

And some lovely perks that we're offering because we know that giving is a two-way street. We can't give you some of the awesome, fantastic perks that other Indiegogo projects offer - but we think they're pretty humbly cool.

We hope that the perks make you feel like you are a part of our journey and each will be picked, made or bought with love and care to show how much we appreciate your gift. Whether it be a handwritten postcard from Australia (it's a pretty cool place!) or a blouse, lovingly sewn by Morgan - we hope you enjoy it as much as we'll enjoy this opportunity to spend time together!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Share this campaign with friends, family, followers, etc. The more people know about this, the more chance we have of reaching our goal.

Also, if you have tips on where to get cheap flights (etc.) that we might not know about - please let us know. Any help is appreciated!

 

 

Thank you again for your help.
All our love,
Morgan, Mia, Marissa and Rose (The Tumblr Bunch)

story:
Help Create MusicianRights.org

This campaign is to help MusicianRights.org get up and running. This social enterprise will unite Musicians to regain their power in contract negotiations, which will establish a more fair system. This translates to more money for Musicians!

  • My name is Davina Amiri and I am an Artists' lawyer as well as a singer-songwriter based in NY. I negotiate contracts on behalf of numerous Artists and was mentioned in Variety Magazine last year for representing a film-maker on his distribution deal.
  • While representing Artists, I have been alarmed by the pervasive use of lopsided contracts businesses expect Artists to sign.
  • After going to SXSW 2013 and listening to many music experts and panelists, I saw the need for a strong and aggressive representative voice for musicians in the Music Industry. 
  • As the Entertainment Industry evolves and adapts to collaborate and use new technologies, now is the time for Musicians to come together.
  • Let's unite Musicians not from the hands of corporations, but from the hands of Musicians and Musician lovers themselves.

I truly believe if all Musicians come together through this organization and agree to certain minimum requirements for contracts, they will establish a new standard and finally have an equal playing field in the Music Industry.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise money!

  • To get started, we need approx. $3,500 for Website, Logo, Intellectual Property Acquisition, and Promotion.
  • All extra money will go towards running the website and expanding the organization (promotion, etc.)
  • We will seek B Corporation certification, which is a new class of companies seeking social impact. Certification will show our commitment to transparency.

Perks

  • "I Care" - $15 Sticker with our Logo
  • "I Care & Can Spare 100" - $100 T-shirt with our Logo
  • "I Care & Can Spare 500" - $500 On the new website you will get; Honorary mention, a quote, and link to your Band or favorite Band.
  • "Celebrity Donation" - $1,000 On the new website you will get; Honorary mention, a quote, link to your Band or favorite Band, and Video post (subject to content approval).

The Impact

WE ARE STARTING A MOVEMENT! BE A PART OF IT!:

It is common knowledge that musicians earn a substantially less percentage of profits as compared to the businesses that profit from their music. This is because musicians have very little bargaining power, especially when first beginning their careers. They are the targets of bad contracts, which sometimes remain with them their entire careers.

MusicianRights.org (MR) wants Musicians to receive their fair share of the profits from their music. There are varying ways to address this, but MR is focusing on the contract itself.

HOW will MusicianRights.org work?

◦                      First Goals:

- Define Musician Rights and Educate musicians about their Rights.

- Every “Musician Member” will sign our Memo stating they will not contract away their Musician Rights. The Memo will define those rights as well as state other affirmations.

- Every “Musician Lover Member” will sign a statement in support of the Memo and also be a member.

- Membership - 1) Signing the memo/affirmation and 2) contributing at least $1 will make you a member. There will be different levels of paid membership, from $1 and up. Using our logo on any social media will be a suggested donation of $20 to support the cause.

◦                       Second Goals:

- Once membership hits critical mass, we will put pressure on key Music Industry players who are taking advantage of musicians. We will also highlight Artist friendly businesses practices.

◦                      Third Goals:

- As Congress gets closer to re-writing the Copyright Act, we will be a voice in any debate on Copyright law.

What Makes Us Different?

Musician Rights is different from any other ogranization advocating for musicians, because 1) it is free of entrenched business interests 2) will define Musician Rights 3) unite all musicians and musician lover's and 4) start a movement where musicians agree to certain contract standards that should be in every contract. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us get the word out! Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like us on social media!
  • Blog about us!

Support Links

You don't have to be a famous artist or deal with a major label to come across unfair contracts, but the below links illustrate a few reported disputes and demonstrates the need for this issue to be addressed and worked on by us.

"Stars lobby over 'unfair' contracts" BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/1779279.stm

"Eminem Lawsuit May Raise Pay for Older Artists" NYT http://www.nytimes.com/2011/03/28/business/media/28eminem.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0

story:
Our Story

The Percussion Music Online project has taken me 5 years to develop and I hope you will consider it a brilliant resource to find percussion music! I hope this will become a great network for percussionists around the World and will give you chance to interact and share ideas with each other about percussion performance and repertoire.

Established in 2006, Percussion Music Online is an online network for percussionists, drummers and teachers of all ages. Our objective is to create a hub for publishers of percussion music to exhibit their latest compositions all in one place. Our extensive research of over 6000 compositions, aims to provide you with the very best in composition research, promote new music and create an online community of musicians specializing in the practical performance of drums and percussion.

The site also gives the opportunity for members to communicate via online message boards, specifically targeted towards the field of drums and percussion. A great deal of information we provide is also accompanied by high quality MP3 clips, member reviews / ratings and a fully integrated search engine to help you find literature most suitable for you.

You can now search thousands of listings provided by various resources, publishers, composers, university lecturers and performers. All music is searchable under any given situation by using the advanced search feature!

"Say you want to find a Solo Snare Drum piece, lasting 5 minutes, with a difficulty rating of 5+, using a piccolo snare drum, written in 2008, with a member rating of 5+. We'l find it for you!"

Please do visit our site to view the operational (BETA) version pre-launch for a more comprehensive overview. www.percussionmusiconline.com.  The site is totally free to anyone who wishes to access the listings. Registration is only required if guests wish to share their thoughts / comments.

The Impact

I am calling upon the Percussion Community to help fund the final stages of the websites development and help revolutionize the way percussionists search for music online. If you are a teacher or student I know that the site will provide an excellent solution and save many hours of laborious research.

What We Need & What You Get


For the next three months Percussion Music Online will run a (BETA) version and will undergo a series of tests to eradicate any bugs found on the new website.  100% of funding will be assigned to the Percussion Music Online project and I have itemized some outgoing expenses below. All expenses are in the next 3 month trial period where all errors will be solved.

Web Designer for a 3 Month Period - $5000
Web Programmer for a 3 Month Period - $5000

Any additional funding beyond our goal will be put towards building on our existing database and proof reading our existing 6000 listings, as many have been transferred from the old site.

*Should our total goal not be reached, we will endeavor to continue providing you with a useful resource in its current condition.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please do spread the word about the website and our campaign. The more people that know about the website and its functionality, the better!

story:
**12/25/11 - Pix added of the band trailer, breakdown for what the donations will be used for added**

**12/27/11 - Updated info about perks, drawing of drum box #1 added to the gallery**


Ok, so here is the short version of what I am doing. This will evolve, but I needed to get this up and going right away. Why, you ask? The end of this campaign will be on April 20th, 2012 Which will be the 3 year anniversary of my younger brother passing.


April 20th 2009, I was woke up by a friend pounding on my door, she told me my mother had been trying to get a hold of me since 6:00 in the morning. After calling her, I heard the worst news anyone could hear. My younger brother was no longer with us. (It is still an open case to this day)


This was the start to a really bad year, by June of that year I lost my job, by July we lost our house and had to move. We were lucky, my parents have some rental properties, one of them happened to be empty, so we had a place to go. We had to move to a small city named Ault, Co. over 90 miles away from our home in Denver. It's a small town, small town life, where everyone knows everyone and everyone's business. Not a bad place, but not a good place for someone who thrives for the big city life. I have lived in Denver, L.A. and Boston, this small town is great for those who like small towns, but it's not for me.


I was working in Denver and had another band going, but the commute and cost of such was just too much, then my job cut my hours back so far, it made it impossible for me to continue to work for them. So, I have been on unemployment since Feb of this year.


Ok, so this all sounds like a sob story, and yes there were several things that have caused many issues for me, but there are some upsides to everything. I have been making all of my payments since Feb and got my student loans out of default, have everything set up and will be going to school again in Jan. I have finished paying off my band trailer, it's a 5x8, black enclosed trailer with a side door and the rear door folds down like a ramp for loading gear. I also came across a new merch stand, this is one of the types you see at conventions, stands 6 feet tall, 8 feet wide in a semi curved shape with velcro walls so anything can hang out it. It folds down into a case about 3 feet tall and about a foot around. And if you can believe it, I found it for FREE on Craig's list.


So yeah, there has been good and bad that has happened. The point of this campaign is to help raise money for a couple of reasons, The trailer needs new tags, I have some gear that has broken down after years of playing and needs replaced, and I need to get back to Denver, CO so I can get back into the scene.


So, I am sure you are wondering, "Why should I help this guy out?" Here is a little background on me. My name is Kelsey, I have been playing music since I was 7, started playing semi-pro ever since I was 16. I've been all over, played a ton of shows, met many many people and have had a great time along the way. Music has been something I have done my whole life, being in this small city has been a drain on my playing and I need to get back to the big city.


Ok, so as promised here is a break down of what this money will be going towards. $300 is for new tags for the band trailer (a few pix of the trailer have been posted), $3600 is for a full years worth of rent at the band rehearsal space, $1000 is going for new gear which includes another ATA case for gear and the last $100 is for gas to get the gear and get everything back to Denver. The perk (on the right hand side of the screen) are pretty self explanatory. I will be posting images of the stickers and shirts shortly.


Impact, that is a funny word, how would this impact me, my family, friends, ect....  Ok, well first of all, this would get me back to a big city and back into a great band. I already have some of the members ready to go, Of course the replacing of gear is huge, it allows me to continue playing. Friends, Family and the such would love to see me on stage again, they all know what it means to me and to my personal life. Not to mention, getting back to the big city allows for better job opportunities, which means more money, which means I can care for my family and band much more so than I can up here.


You can help in other ways as well, tell your friends, family, hell tell strangers. Send the link on your face book account, your twitter, blogs, personal sites, write it on a paper and hand it to someone, every little bit counts and helps, more than you know.
story_txt:
**12/25/11 - Pix added of the band trailer, breakdown for what the donations will be used for added**
**12/27/11 - Updated info about perks, drawing of drum box #1 added to the gallery**

Ok, so here is the short version of what I am doing. This will evolve, but I needed to get this up and going right away. Why, you ask? The end of this campaign will be on April 20th, 2012 Which will be the 3 year anniversary of my younger brother passing.

April 20th 2009, I was woke up by a friend pounding on my door, she told me my mother had been trying to get a hold of me since 6:00 in the morning. After calling her, I heard the worst news anyone could hear. My younger brother was no longer with us. (It is still an open case to this day)

This was the start to a really bad year, by June of that year I lost my job, by July we lost our house and had to move. We were lucky, my parents have some rental properties, one of them happened to be empty, so we had a place to go. We had to move to a small city named Ault, Co. over 90 miles away from our home in Denver. It's a small town, small town life, where everyone knows everyone and everyone's business. Not a bad place, but not a good place for someone who thrives for the big city life. I have lived in Denver, L.A. and Boston, this small town is great for those who like small towns, but it's not for me.

The perk (on the right hand side of the screen) are pretty self explanatory. I will be posting images of the stickers and shirts shortly.


Impact, that is a funny word, how would this impact me, my family, friends, ect....  Ok, well first of all, this would get me back to a big city and back into a great band. I already have some of the members ready to go, Of course the replacing of gear is huge, it allows me to continue playing. Not to mention, getting back to the big city allows for better job opportunities, which means more money, which means I can care for my family and band much more so than I can up here.

story:
What's this all about?

I'm a solo musician on a quest to get my album into the physical world and to find some financial support for my goal. The goal is to advance one step further into getting an album I've build from the ground up as a solo effort into printed physical cases. Once I have enough I will have a printing press make many copies of the album that I will use to distribute. They will be sent out to musical magazines, Pandora and many other similar areas of interest. The physical CD is by far the most crucial step to being recognized as a legitimate musician.

The second half of the goal is to also get some other merchandise created, such as T-shirts and other similar merchandise.

The plus:

With many of the projects you come across on here, you're supporting a vision that hasn't been created yet. You aimlessly go into something with the mere hope that it'll A.) turn out well enough & B.) happen at all. There's no guarantees after you support. The plus to my project is that it's done! It's finished. It already exists. What you're supporting is the printing process and not just a floating vision. If I reach my goal, then it's done that week.  


History:

Ever since I was a child I've found enjoyment in learning new instruments and finding interesting ways to play them. As I got older I found a desire to recording multiple instruments together which eventually lead to the beginning traces of recording. As the years went by I studied how the sounds that instruments make could be captured into computers and compiled with other recorded tracks to make a complete song. In the later years I spent a day with a man who had built his own recording studio and I learned how it all came together professionally. In modern day I have a modest but effective studio that works well for what I do. Here I can record my many instruments and compose songs and albums. It is my biggest passion of interest.    


What you get in return:

In return for supporting me on my goal I will shower you with recognition in both the printed album and on my site. I'm amazed as to how many extremely supportive individuals there are in this community and it's given me strong hope for independent artists to flourish. In addition I will also send you a signed album when it's done being printed. For those who donate higher amounts of money, I will add original ink artwork with the CD, each being one-of-a-kind. I will also send 1-2 items of merchandise to people who donate $35+
And on top of all that, if I play a show that you attend, I will gladly take you out to dinner afterward as a sign of appreciation.

Last thoughts:

If you have any questions what-so-ever, feel free to email me at jom@solotrimono.com

For the meantime, thank you for any support you want to send my way.

This site is an amazing place and you're amazing people. 


Listen:

http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/defragmentatio...

story:
A Little About Me . . .

West Coast singer/songwriter Katie Thompson’s star is most definitely on the rise. This talented Hokitika lass has released two albums in the past three years, was chosen by popular vote to open for Elton John at his only New Zealand show this coming November and she’s been nominated for both Female Artist of the Year and the Horizon Award at the 2011 National Country Music Awards. 

 

Katie’s debut album, Tall Poppy was released in 2009 and the record caught the attention of the international funding website Sellaband, where fans invest in the careers sof their favourite artists, with the aim of helping them hit the US$50,000 needed to record and release an album.


Katie was one of the fastest-ever artists to achieve the funding goal and the resulting album Impossible blends elements of folk, pop and country into a collection of bittersweet and beautiful songs. It was released this year to critical acclaim from even the most hardened music press, who have described her sound as “entrancing.”


What's Next

Righteo - me talking in first person now!!! Well as you can imagine.... opening for Elton John in November is quite a big deal and I want to make the most of it. Thanks to the beautiful people who helped me with my last IndieGoGo project I was able to make my first music video for "Good As Gold". The single made it's way Classic Hits "As Kiwi As" and has enjoyed airplay throughout the world and the music video has had 3,500+ hits on YouTube.

So this time, I would like to make a music video for the next single "Impossible".

The talented Logan McMillan from Gorilla Pictures will be the director - see Mel Parson's latest music video for "I Won't Let You Down" for examples of his work.

We are planning the video at the moment and as soon as the details are finalised I'll let you know exactly what it's going to look like.

At this stage we will be filming it in Christchurch, New Zealand in early November.

The Impact

To make the biggest impact the release of the single & video should happen at the same time and preferably before November 25th - when I'll be opening for Elton John. Impossible is the strongest track on the album and I feel like it is the one that deserves an amazing music video to get the song out there.


What I Need & What You Get

The standard cost in NZ to make a music video is $5,000.

If there is any money left over it will be used to promote the single.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about me, my music and this project!

Share the link with your Facebook friends

story:
Our Story

The band Fevers and myself are looking to garner your support to help make their very first music video. "Passion is Dead (Long Live Fashion)" is their title track of their recent EP release, and also the track we've selected to create a video for.


This is a great track and deserves a great video, help us do it justice and show your support!

You can also download their album FREE via their Bandcamp: www.fevers.bandcamp.com


The Impact

It's kind of ironic when I think about it. The track "Passion is Dead (Long Live Fashion)" talks about how sometimes you can feel like there is no longer passion surrounding bands and music, and people are more concerned with superficial things like fashion and how expensive your jeans are. So it's interesting that this band has somehow managed to attract a small team of creative people committed to see them make an amazing music video. We can all relate to the track, it can be quite discouraging, but this project has already attracted businesses and individuals who are all passionate enough about music to contribute their own time and money to make it successful. Join the team and show Fevers that passion is not dead...entirely.

What We Need & What You Get

We currently have some the necessary pieces to make this video happen. ie. Cameras, editing equipment, volunteers etc. But because of the nature of the song, we really want to represent the true 'essence' of the music, this means having money to rent a space(s) to shoot it in and allow us to rent some of the other pieces of equipment to see our concept through to an actual video. 

At the moment, many other people have graciously offered their services for free or at an extremely reduced cost. i.e. post production/3-D animation, lighting operation/design etc. The money we will raise will go towards renting all the lighting gear ie. rigs, moving lights, boards, dollies etc. as well as the space itself.

We've been fortunate so far that so many talented people are willing to lend their technical skills free of charge, we now just need YOUR help to help raise the necessary funds to rent the gear itself. (The only thing people can't give us for free really).

Ever had a 30 second song written and performed exclusively for you? On the right side of this page you'll see how we are trying to give back to those who show support. You can choose from a range of perks so you won't feel like you're going away empty handed.

With your help, you'll be joining the rest of this team of people who have all seen/heard how great this band's music is and can be.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please if you can't afford a donation, please take the time to share this with friends, family and co-workers, or at the very least share the album! It's a free download! www.fevers.bandcamp.com

story:
So we're finally heading off to Europe! As you may already be aware we are very much a DIY band and we've deliberately knocked back certain labels in order to maintain our own artistic vision. However, doing this does make the financial side of things that little bit harder!

We've already raised some funds through our very own club night, 'No Direction' which can be found in the groovy venues around London every few months. But it's not enough. We need to pay for food, maintain our transport and fuel costs, pay for accomodation, buy new strings in deepest darkest Switzerland (okay so maybe not that last one...) but you get our drift.

Here are the dates, so come along and see us if you're in the area...

October 2012

18th - Paris

20th - Lyon

21st - Zurich

23rd - Cologne

24th - Berlin

26th - Copenhagen

27th - Hamburg

28th - Amsterdam

29th - Brussels

30th - Lille

1st - London

 

We're not doing this for a profit, we will definitely lose money on the tour. But we feel it's important for us to get out of London, out of the UK and to experience different places, fans and music in order for us to better ourselves as a band and as musicians.

We just want to play to as many people as we can.

Any contribution you can give regardless of size would be immensely helpful and massively appreciated. It gets us that much closer to our relatively modest goal. If you're strapped for cash, don't sweat it - simply sharing this campaign with others is great - and it won't take but a moment of your time!

Music is so accessible these days, you can log on to youtube and pretend you are at Woodstock, and that's all well and good but NOTHING can replicate that feeling of being at a live gig. We never want to stop playing live shows (the longer the better as far as we're concerned), and even though less and less bands are going on tour these days, we are old-fashioned in that we want to play for anyone that will listen. When we were growing up we went to see our favourite bands play and it changed our lives forever, what an amazing thing it would be if it went full-circle and we were able to do that for the next group of youngsters out there.

Thanks so much for taking the time to check us out, and hopefully we'll see you on the road soon!!

story:
$75 for drum sounds recorded by two professional industrial music guys.  

It's time for Stiff Valentine to record our third studio record, but we need your help! 

We want to continue to incorporate lots of live instrumentation with our heavy industrial sound, so we are going to record drums at Soundhouse in Seattle, and need to make back the $600 that we spent to make the studio session happen.

Here is the deal; the more you donate, the more you get back as a supporter. If we can obtain over the $600 goal, we will record acoustic versions and mix an additional version of the album in 5.1 sound. 

The Loops, and Surround Sound Perk is great for our fans who are on the look-out for new drum loops, samples, and synth sounds. We will include all the drums sounds (one shot samples, loops, and multi-tracks) from the album. That way you can load them into your drum trigger, sound replacement tool, or DAW to use on your next project. Drum machine and synth parts will also be included. You have full permission to use these files and loops for anything you want; music, film, video games, whatever! 

The drums will be played by Jason Bazinet (SMP, 16volt, Front Line Assembly). All the recording, editing and technical stuff will be done by "Loud" Chris DeMarcus (16volt, Chemlab, FLA). http://deathproofmusic.com/

Other ways you can help: Money isn't everything. If you could let other fans and potential fans know about this project, we'd love you like a boss! Get your grandpa to donate. He likes acoustic records, right!? 

What if you make over $600? Funds will go to additional recording costs, album production, and artwork. We plan to spend over $5,000 on the record alone.

story:
Our mission is to actively engage in the growth and development of youth through the use of music and the performing arts. We are a no-audition community-based organization. We are dedicated to the fundamental belief that any child or young adult with the desire to learn and participate will be afforded that opportunity. It is our desire to enrich the lives of young people through our commitment to excellence while guiding and instilling in them a sense of pride and self-confidence. Participation in the performing arts builds discipline and character. Our no-audition programs will be offered in a positive, family environment with the intent of helping our members to become confident, contributing members of their community. 

We are a competetive unit and are totally funded by fundraising and donations from the community.

Our entire staff is made up of volunteers who donate their time and talents to the organization. 

 

Please see our homepage at www.starcrossyouth.org for more information our contact our program director at Robert.Stocklas@gmail.com
story_txt:
Our mission is to actively engage in the growth and development of youth through the use of music and the performing arts. We are a no-audition community-based organization. We are dedicated to the fundamental belief that any child or young adult with the desire to learn and participate will be afforded that opportunity. It is our desire to enrich the lives of young people through our commitment to excellence while guiding and instilling in them a sense of pride and self-confidence. Participation in the performing arts builds discipline and character. Our no-audition programs will be offered in a positive, family environment with the intent of helping our members to become confident, contributing members of their community. 
We are a competetive unit and are totally funded by fundraising and donations from the community.
Our entire staff is made up of volunteers who donate their time and talents to the organization. 
 
 Please see our homepage at www.starcrossyouth.org for more information our contact our program director at Robert.Stocklas@gmail.com

story:
Introduction

Most of you know me as Adam Walker, chiefly because that's my name.  For those unfamiliar, I'm an L.A. based songwriter.  I've been singing and playing guitar for 17 years, and I've performed at House of Blues, Genghis Cohen, The Mint, The Good Hurt, and other popular venues in Southern California.

I'm adding a full band to my acoustic-rock album in order to produce radio friendly versions of some of my popular upbeat material, including "I'm Sorry to Tell You," "Dead Man Walking" and "I've Been Through it All."  Surplus money will be used to create marketing material.

Listen to my music for free at www.adamwalkermusic.com!

What your Contribution Gets You

I need to raise $2000 to record, mix, and master a short album of new and melodic rock music.  But I'm not asking you to give something for nothing.  Here are some perks you'll receive for your generous donation:

$5       Receive every song I record with this project (in MP3 format)

$25     Recieve my 8-track CD, released earlier this year, PLUS the above

$50     Receive my 8-track CD, new song recordings, signed flyer AND an invitation to the party I'll throw when we've reached our fundraising target.

$100   Recording of an acoustic version of any song you want me to cover!  Personalized in MP3 format, PLUS the above.

$300   Live acoustic performance by me at your next event (the more random the event, the better; e.g. business meetings, funerals, award ceremonies for other artists) PLUS the perks of the first three levels.

$2000  Fund the entire project in one fell swoop, and you'll receive a breathalyzer exam and complimentary straight jacket*

*not a real perk; you'll just get everything coming to you at all the levels below, plus a personalized thank you

The Impact

For those of you familiar with my music, I'm a strong proponent of well-constructed songs, crafted with the care exhibited by artists like The Beatles, Simon and Garfunkel, James Taylor, Bob Dylan, and others like them. 

So much of what is available on the radio fails to live up to the standard of those who came before us.  I prefer to hold myself to that proven standard.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that financial hardship is a reality for so many of us.  For those who cannot contribute, please think about:

-sharing news about the project to your friends

-using the "share" tools available here on Indiegogo.com to spread the word about my music

Thanks for reading, and I hope you enjoy the music.

story:
BE SURE TO CLICK THE GALLERY TAB ABOVE TO CHECK OUT SOME PRETTY COOL MUSIC VIDEOS!

MY STORY...

In a day and time where real music with a message seems to be taking a back seat to the manufacturing of artists based on age and image, I truly believe "The Journey Volume One", set for release in fall of 2012 will make you "see" the music with your ears. 

I'm known mostly as a featured artist on many European House and Dance music hits, including “Shined On Me” with the Praise Cats, and also as a supporting and backing vocalist - I've worked with artists such as Al Jarreau, Angela Winbush, Esperanza Spalding,  Frank McComb, George Duke, Gerald Albright, Michael Manson, Nona Hendryx, and Terri Lyne Carrington to name a few. Now, I think the time is just right for me to release  this debut CD as a great alternative for us "grown folks" that are seeking balance in today's music :-)

THE PROJECT...

This project will include a mixture of songs that will be both up tempo and down tempo Acid Jazz, Smooth Jazz and Soul, that lyrically reflect on love and everyday life - from the good, to the bad, to the human, to the crazy - and how it's all gonna eventually be alright! :-) Basically, this project is for the adult contemporary listener that loves, supports and seeks REAL, LIVE music by REAL artists!

THE TEAM...

This project will have lots of live instrumentation by some of the best musicians around, and includes collaborations with Grammy-nominated producer/remixer Eric “E Smoove” Miller, who is also co-executive producer, and Grammy-winning producer/remixer Maurice Joshua, as well as writers that have to their credit a number of songs that have hit Billboard charts in various genres, as well as other music charts around the world – guaranteeing nothing less than a quality body of work.

THE FACT IS...

The project is being completed independent of major record labels, which is a good thing because it guarantees that the artistry stays pure – but it also means that the project's completion is at the mercy of my finances and contributions from people like you. Now - - the really cool thing is, through your contribution, you are actually helping to create the music that YOU want to hear! This is why....I NEED YOU!!!!

Contributions will pay for:

  •  Studio recording costs
  • Musician/background vocalist fees
  • Marketing
  • Mixing, mastering, printing and packaging of the CD and other production costs. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP...

Lastly, please help me get the word out on this project that I hope will help keep REAL MUSIC alive. PLEASE share the link on the pages of your social sites such as Facebook, Twitter and others.

THANK YOU SOOOOO MUCH IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION AND I CAN'T WAIT FOR YOU TO HEAR THE FINISHED PRODUCT!!!! 

MUCH LOVE YOU!!!

story:
Our Story

Hi my name is Justin and I'm reaching out to everyone whos ever been wronged by our so called justice system. My brother, Johnathon, is one of these people. He is incarcerated at the moment due to the incompetancy of his lawyer who had drained him for every penny he had. My brother had broken his back almost literally working weeks on end to come up with the money to pay this lawyer. At the end of the week my brother was lucky to have enough money left over from paying Dave Partridge to buy himself a pack of cigarettes. For months he did this, he had to give up his appartment he had and had to move back in with my mother and I.After John had literally bent over backwards to apease his lawyer and pay him what he had asked for the lawyer still did not do his job. Not one part of the case was handled professionally, if I were a member of the BAR association and could represent my brother I think I could have made a better case for him. Everything that the lawyer had based his case on for self defense the judge had thrown it out of court because it was irrelevent. John is not a bad person running around doing horrible things. He's a 24 year old man who's caught up in a confusing and crazy world. He did what he believed was right to save his friends life and in the end his friend, lawyer and even the entire justice system had stabbed him the back and left him out to hang dry. He's not a murderer or a thief or a rapist, he's a loving caring, Happy-go-lucky person, sure he could have his dark days, but who doesn't? Does he really deserve to rot in a prison because he did what our mother had taught us, to do ever since we were little, to protect your friends and family at all costs? Are we all just as bad as everyone on the inside of the institutions? I believe not. I believe justice shouldn't just be for those who can afford it. Justice should be what is morally correct not let's see how much money we can drain from this person as they jump through my hoops. David F Partridge is a fraud and lawyer is the farthest thing from his profession. He is like the snake in the garden of eden. He led my brother astray and made him believe his sinister lies. David told my brother that it would be a clear cut case and he had no chance of spending one day in jail, after a plea bargain had been offered for two years. David was adament and confident in himself that John would not do more than probation and pay a fine. He never once told John that he was facing a minimum of 5 years in prison and upwards to 15 years until John was already cuffed and in custody. My brother lost it all, his car, his job, his life and every joy that he once held. He seems happy between plexi glass and a phone during visits. But I'm his brother I can see through it all. I can tell he wants to cry and let it out but he can't because of where he is. I cry everyday because of these circumstances and how every person who supposedly is out to help him just ends up taking the shoes off his feet and the shirt off his back. Ever since my Father was in a car accident when we were young, he has been mentally challanged as well as wheelchair bound for the rest of his life in a convelecent home, is only in his early 40's and this happened nearly 13 years ago. Ever since the loss of our Father for who he was our lives have gone down hill. My mother tries her best to make ends meet and supports my brother with every penny she could possible manage but it's just not enough to support him (well honestly the "Justice system" that asks him for all this money just to be able to have any type of comfort in his life in this hell hole. My brother's life is practically over if things go the way the courts want. I won't see my brother until he's 39, I'll be 34... Everyday I pray for him to be able to make it through this and for some miracle to happen to make this all just go away and I'm at my wits end. My family has very few resources left to offer, we can't even afford to get him paper and envelopes to write us, he can't afford shoes or sweat pants and shirts and he's constantly complaining about how cold it is. This is my brother and I know full heartedly who he is as a person and the justice system doesn't care about who you are you're just another number to them another way to get their daily bread. Well where's my daily bread? I thought this world was supposed to be based on righteousness and goodness, not greed and alterior motives. This whole situation is tearing me apart I've spent many days crying to the point of being dehabilitated. There's days when I can't even get out of bed because I miss my brother so much. He's always been there to protect me and I feel it's my time to try to protect him. We're currently trying to get a new lawyer to help with the case we have soent the last of our resources just for him to look into the case and don't know how to make enough money to pay the rest. I'm literally begging on my hands and knees for a break, just one thing to happen good to turn this thing around but we can't do it on our own. So please won't you help us? If you have any questions about anything that had happened I will be glad to answer them I just don't know where else to turn for help and I know i won't be able to make it 15 years without my brother. It's bad enough we lost our Father at a young age. Our grandparents within a week of eachother and now I'm losing my brother. So please out of the kindness of your heart any amount will help us even if its a few cents we need everything we can get to provide my brother with the proper outfitting to fight this case and atleast lessen his time if not get off completely. I would rather wait two years and get to see him then wait 15 when both of our dreams and already nothing more than dust in the wind. Without him I don't feel like I have any strength to achieve any of my endeavours and without me I know he's dying on the inside. so please even if you can't donate to this cause please spread the word I will be forever grateful and karma is a real thing I may not be able to literally do something incredible for you, but what you give unto others will eventually come back to you. God sees all and makes sure to account for every action. Thank you for your time


The Impact

Hopefully this will inspire others who are in a tough position with legal standings to have the confidence to reach out and try to get help rather than just swallowing an extremely bitter tasting pill that takes away the rest of your life.


What We Need & What You Get

We need anything and everything we can get. dollars, cents it doesn't matter every last penny helps and honestly Ive even been collecting pennies, dimes, nickles everything just to try to buy my brother a sweatshirt because of how cold it is in that jail and I can't even afford that it kills me on the inside, if I can't afford a sweatshirt for him how am I supposed to pay for a lawyer? I beg of you please help us. This is my final SOS because my familys ship is sinking and fast!


Other Ways You Can Help

Donations through credit cards are accept at this time I'm currently working on updating a paypal account to make things easier for those of you who use paypal. Even if your'e just as tight on money as myself and family word of mouth  spreads quickly and even quicker on the internet, so please even if you can't doanything more than repost this please do, facebook, twitter, tumblr anything you wish just please let this get out there. We don't have much time and need all the help we can get in such a small amount of time. Thank you for your time..

story:
Our Story

In Expectation of the Thaw began life as an idea.  On the one hand, how could you create a new experience for live audiences, with music that bridged the gap between classical and a more contemporary sound? And how could you incorporate a special visual element to underline the delicate and evocative music?  The goal was simply to reinvigorate the classical music experience around a special and universal theme of our time: Global Warming.


The Tampere Philharmonic Orchestra in Finland commissioned the original work, enabling us to perform the production for the first time in several sold-out concerts and to record the music separately in the superb acoustics of Tampere Hall.  Ever since that recording in 2008, the music has been sitting on hard drives waiting for the right moment and circumstances to mix and produce an album for release.


More recently, In Expectation of the Thaw was performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra at the Royal Albert Hall for a special audience of business leaders including HRH Prince Charles.  The performance was a resounding success and the music touched a chord in the audience.

The Impact

Rather than a handout, what we seek is small investors.  A recording like this could inspire millions of people around the world into feeling compelled to support change in thinking around Climate Change and little lifestyle choices that contribute to the problems.  Given the impact of live performances, this will allow people to enjoy the music at home.


Contemporary composers rarely get the opportunity to realize such a big and ambitious work, and I hope you will consider supporting my development as an artist with an investment in the production of this album and platform for future subsequent productions.


What We Need & What You Get

We require a total of $8000 to finish the album of In Expectation of the Thaw and prepare it for release.  This will include approximately 4 weeks of studio time in a high end mixing facility, an experienced engineer and a producer.  The studio and crew work cost $400 per day, with a total of 20 days required.


Anything we receive over $8000 will be used for my personal expenses whilst working on the album including transportation, bills and food.


Unlike many campaigns, I am offering an opportunity for contributors to recoup any money they give with a substantial rate of interest when the recording goes into profit.  This way, rather than a handout, you'll be investing in a product that might just make you money.


In addition, all contributions of $100 or more mean you will receive a numbered, signed limited edition copy of the finished album.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to help with cash, please spread the word to friends and colleagues you feel might enjoy being a part of the launch of something special.  The links above might help get them excited.  Beyond individuals, special opportunities exist for Corporate Sponsors.  Please pass links to people you know in companies that would benefit from this type of international exposure and association.  Every donation adds up quickly to what is really quite a modest sum for a fully mixed orchestral album.

story:
Our Story

Speed Control's legendary 4th member, Neuman, has died at the young age of 27.  After covering over 300,000 km, his engine horrifically burst into flames in Fort McMurray.  Speed Control, a rock band out of Whitehorse, Yukon, has been touring across Western Canada teaching Rock & Roll to kids aged 8 - 65.  

Currently we are in Fort McMurray, AB, running a 2-week rock camp.  By August 8th, we hope to find a new vehicle to carry us through the remainder of our tour and home again.

The Impact

With outstanding results, Speed Control has run rock camps in 6 different communities in Yukon, BC and Alberta.  Without a tour van, we will be unable to continue bringing rock & roll to aspiring musicians across the country.  


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5000 to purchase a new tour van that will keep Speed Control on the road, to not only rock audiences but to work with youth.  All funds garnered from you awesome people will be put toward the van.  

By contributing to our cause, we will give awesome perks!!!! Check it out!

Other Ways You Can Help


SHARE THIS WITH EVERYONE!!!!!  Speed Control LOVES YOU! Check out the share tools and help us by spreading the word!  Thanks!


Graeme, Jody & Spencer
story_txt:
Our Story
Speed Control's legendary 4th member, Neuman, has died at the young age of 27.  After covering over 300,000 km, his engine horrifically burst into flames in Fort McMurray.  Speed Control, a rock band out of Whitehorse, Yukon, has been touring across Western Canada teaching Rock & Roll to kids aged 8 - 65.  

Currently we are in Fort McMurray, AB, running a 2-week rock camp.  By August 8th, we hope to find a new vehicle to carry us through the remainder of our tour and home again.


The Impact
With outstanding results, Speed Control has run rock camps in 6 different communities in Yukon, BC and Alberta.  Without a tour van, we will be unable to continue bringing rock & roll to aspiring musicians across the country.  


What We Need & What You Get
We need $5000 to purchase a new tour van that will keep Speed Control on the road, to not only rock audiences but to work with youth.  All funds garnered from you awesome people will be put toward the van.  

By contributing to our cause, we will give awesome perks!!!! Check it out!

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS WITH EVERYONE!!!!!  Speed Control LOVES YOU! Check out the share tools and help us by spreading the word!  Thanks!


Graeme, Jody & Spencer

story:
PETER SHILLINGFORD...WRITER of "BELLA'S CLUB PHOENIX" THE STAGE MUSICAL
REQUESTS CONTRIBUTIONS TO CREATE THE SHOWS SONGS FOR THE CD.

I came up through the UK/US camera department in 16mm and 35mm, 3-D and later to 70mm IMAX production level.  Valuable time was spent as a commercials producer and writer/director with my own UK/US company working globally with major brands.

During living and working in Hollywood for 20 years I became the line producer and location cameraman on the Academy Award winning “Genocide” starring Orson Welles and Elizabeth Taylor.

Director/cameraman for 20th Century Fox on “The Making of Star Wars” in Tunisia and London. Subsequently shot US Public Service commercials for George Lucas using Star Wars R2-D2 & C-3PO.

I have always loved writing for film and the theatre and shall continue to do so. "Bella's Club Phoenix" the musical, is especially important to me after researching many of London's street kids and being appalled at their living conditions and the reasons why they left the safety of their homes.

This is a story told with humour and pathos with uplifting song and dance from the street kids as a tribute to their guts and talent for living and performing.

BELLA'S CLUB PHOENIX...STORY LINE

Bella's troubles begin when she buys an abandoned ghetto warehouse in which she intends to create a sophisticated restaurant club. The problem is an unruly crowd of homeless street kids are squatting there and will not move out. Conflict!

Bella having lost her only child, stolen as a babe in arms, decides to take on the street kids and train them up as her staff and give them a home as well. They build the club on stage from found theatrical materials in the warehouse but once the cast erect the club set, the villainous Maître ’d burns it down in revenge for being fired for stealing.

After the interval and the departure of the firemen, Mr Midnight, a bankrupt alcoholic lost soul from the upper classes, reveals a brilliant talent for spray painting graffiti in homage to Picasso and Warhol...the street kids and Bella are pretty good at it as well..these classic paintings will feature in the Gifts and Perks...Bella's Club Phoenix rises from the ashes.

Gangsters and their molls come and go as do established stars from television/film and theater, as guests for a week or so.  The cops make a mock raid and party with inept gangsters and anybody they can handcuff. 

Bella's lost child, now one of the street kids is found. Can't tell you how !

All is set for the opening night.

But the invitations have been burnt; none of the celebrities will arrive so selected members of the audience...our funding Angels...are invited on stage for wine and finger food but they have to sing with the cast the last song from the menu.

PERSONAL NOTE

I intend to donate a percentage of any revenue I receive from the stage production to a charity. May I suggest with your contribution you name your favourite charity for consideration.

THIS IS A FOUR TIER FUNDING PROCESS...this is the serious part !

TIER 1. $45,000… THE SCRIPT IS WRITTEN, NOW WE NEED TO CREATE THE MUSIC AND THE PRODUCTION OF THE SHOW CD WHICH WILL ATTRACT THE REST OF THE FUNDING REQUIRED.

TIER 2. $15,000…USE OF CD AND PROMOTION TO SHOW INVESTORS THE CONCEPT.

TIER 3. $75,000… BUDGET, CASTING, SET DESIGN AND EFFECTS OF SHOW.

TIER 4. $250,000… REHEARSAL AND PRODUCTION OF THE FINISHED SHOW

With the first tier of funding in place and the CD completed and optimised as a marketing tool, many areas of investment will open up to complete funding tiers 2, 3 and 4.

Should we not reach our total funding the CD will have fewer songs but will still be a valuable tool for our City investors. 

As in the video JOANNE BENJAMIN with The Entertainment Business, an established London stage management company is on board and will be bringing in many professional show investors and venture capitalists. We call them "Angels", which of course you are with your contributions.

The potential is an award winning original stage musical that can travel globally as the problems of these street kids can be found in every major city in the world.

We need your help, contributions large and small will get this CD and stage musical on the road. I will of course be e-mailng Progres Reports to you on a weekly basis.  Stand by for Blogs and Tweets as well. We will all have a great time with this project.

Gifts and Perks on the right of this page consist of a series of unique and fun involvements with the cast both on and off the stage once the show is underway.

The CD will be available in all social media outlets as well as autographed art work of the posters and sheet music. Photo opportunities, autographed scripts and other goodies are up for grabs.

All the music Gifts and Perks plus the CD will be available on completion of the CD and the theatre and cast Gifts and Perks will be available once the show is produced. 

To view Bella’s exclusive video progress reports see http://www.facebook.com/BellasClubPhoenix/app_311253165568475 and of course while you are there please click on the "like" button. Thanks.

Should we not reach our required total then the CD will have less songs but I can assure you we will get this show on the road!

I truly understand if you cannot support this campaign. Times are tough but we need music and great stage performances to lighten our world.

As a contributing "Angel" or not, be a member, spread the word and share this campaign with family and friends...and with all your clients and social media pals...please ask them to pass it along to their contacts for their consideration.

AND THANK YOU.

PS...Late news...a film production company are suggesting a film should be made. AND...we have a chorographer on board

story:
About Siobhan

Welsh born Siobhan, who turned 17 on October 4, is a classically trained singer who also turns her haunting soprano voice and delicate harp playing to a repertoire of traditional Celtic songs. Siobhan is winner of prestigious classical and folk awards and has played at major festivals, concerts and recitals around Australia. She is a truly enchanting performer. She has had wonderful comments about her voice and harp from people all over the world, including great musicians such as Orla (ex Celtic Woman) and Bill Whelan (Riverdance composer). Her voice has been described as "stunning", "exquisite", "mesmerising", "hauntingly beautiful".


Siobhan has already released 2 self-funded albums, in 2008 and 2009. She sells these albums at gigs (especially folk festivals) and online from her website. She is often asked when her next album will be released, so she has decided it is now time. She is about to start recording, but needs help to pay for editing/mastering, photography, graphic design, manufacturing, distribution and publicity.


Siobhan will be dedicating this album to her grandfather, who passed away in July 2010.


What We Need and What You Get

The following figures are only estimates. What we cannot raise now, we will try other methods or cut down on some of the fees. The project will definitely go ahead. Siobhan will also be busking to help pay with the recording costs (eg paying other musicians)


Editing/mastering: $2000

Photography: $300

Graphic Design: $200

Manufacturing: $1500

Distribution & Publicity: $1000


Siobhan will be offering incentives including digital downloads, signed CDs, mention in CD booklet and personal letter of acknowledge.


Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps with this cause. Even if you can't give anything yourself, please pass the word on to others.

story: My name is Michelle Kirchner and I am a 3rd grade teacher in South LA. I teach at 122nd Street School and I have been at this school for 14 years. I consider this school my second home and I feel like a part of so many families that I teach. I am blessed to work with these families and in this community and I feel grateful every day that I get to come to work. With budget cuts getting worse every year, we don't have the money to fund projects outside of the mandated curriculum. Here is an opportunity to help a classroom full of excited and eager students get the supplies they need for a photography project. In our classroom we learn together, grow together, and support one another. We often talk about family and what it means to be a part of a family. Room 20 is a family and I make sure they know that everyday. For our project, I would like to raise money to buy digital cameras (12) for my classroom. We have been learning different ways to express ourselves and I think photography is a wonderful way to do it. Pictures do so much more than tell me what is seen, it can help one feel what others feel. My students are always talking about home, their families, and what they do on the weekends. The concept of home is a powerful thing. As adults we know it is more than a house, and I want my students to explore all of the personal things that home might mean to them. I want them to capture the moments that are important to them and turn these moments into stories. Sharing ones home can be an incredible experience. Why not give each child a chance to be truly seen and to truly see one another. Once we have the cameras and the students have taken their pictures, we will have a gallery walk at school to showcase the pictures. I cannot wait for this night and to see the kids shine! I ask that you support me in any way you can to help out classroom achieve our fundraising goal. Thank you for reading and I am excited to see what happens next!!

story:
Hvad er Radio Syndikatet?

Radio Syndikatet er en ny form for radio, hvor passionen for formidlingen og respekt for den individuelle kultur er i højsædet, uanset om der er tale om Jazz, Hip Hop, Elektronisk, Italo Disco, Dupstep, Drum-n-Bass, Klassisk, ja you name it.

Radio Syndikatets vision er at skabe dynamisk radio i samspil med lytteren, hvor fokus er på det niche præget og særegne, frem for det alt-omfavnende radio man ellers oplever i resten af Danmark.

Hvis man vil læse mere konkret hvad Radio Syndikatet kommer til at tilbyde af programmer og gennem hvilke tjenester, så kan man læse mere på RadioSyndikatet.dk. 

Hvad har vi brug for?

Radio Syndikatet er en ikke-kommerciel forening, som bliver drevet af ildsjæle som betaler af egen lomme for at lave kvalitetsradio til et nichepræget og ofte meget snævert publikum. 

Det er bestemt ikke gratis, og faktisk har vi brug for hver en krone vi kan indsamle, så vi har mulighed for at betale for den daglige drift og udstyr. De indsamlede penge vil blandt andet gå til:

  • Udstyr: i form af mikrofoner, lydkort, borde, stole, lys og alt andet et radio studie nu har brug for. Vi har samlet meget selv og arbejder med hvad vi har, men rammerne må også godt være gode, så vi kan levere ordentlig kvalitet til lytterne.
  • Daglig drift: i form af husleje, KODA/Gramex, webhotel, sende tjeneste etc. Alle drifts udgifter dækkes af Radio Syndikatets egne medlemmer, men det er en dyr post og enhver luft i økonomien vil være tiltrængt, derudover vil det også kunne sikre Radio Syndikatets drift i de næste mange år. 

Hvorfor "crowd funding"?

Radio Syndikatet er en ikke-kommerciel radio, som bliver drevet af en ikke-kommerciel forening. Alle bidrag er derfor vigtige, da vi ikke må modtage indtægter i form af reklamer, bannere m.m. i og omkring radioen, hvilket vi bestemt heller ikke ønsker.

Derfor har vi brug for alle de opstartsmidler vi kan skrabe sammen, så vi kan få den bedst mulige start og ballast for en god afvikling.

Så snart Radio Syndikatet er i luften, må vi derudover heller ikke modtage mere end 5000 kr. i indtægter om året, ellers mister vi vores 'ikke-kommercielle' status hos KODA/Gramex og skal betale langt højere satser, heldigvis må vi dog starte med den start-kapital vi selv har til rådighed, og DERFOR er crowd-funding en perfekt løsning for os og dem som ønsker at støtte et fantastisk projekt... plus man får en masse seje "perks" selvfølgelig :-)

Hvilken betydning vil Radio Syndikatet have?

Radio Syndikatet vil betyde at det ikke kun er de samme 2-3 aktører som dikterer hvordan den niche præget musik/debat skal formidles. Radio Syndikatet vil i videst muligt omfang søge at levere top kvalitet, uden at gå på kompromis med indholdet i en jagt på lyttere, vi vil behandle hvert program med samme entusiasme og dedikation, hvad enten der er tale om 10 eller 10.000 lyttere.

Det mener vi er tiltrængt, i en radio verden hvor vi selv har ledt og ledt efter netop de programmer som kunne levere det indhold vi selv efterlyste, og nu har vi endelig fundet en løsning... vi laver det nemlig bare selv.

Hvordan kan du ellers hjælpe?

Det er ikke alle som har mulighed for at hjælpe økonomisk, men det er ikke kun penge vi har brug for. Vi har også brug for opbakning, omtale, udstyr m.m., her er et par måder du også kan hjælpe:

  • SPRED ORDET: fortæl alle om Radio Syndikatet, find os på Facebook, Twitter og RadioSyndikatet.dk, gå ind og "synes godt om", del, RT og link til vores hjemmeside eller denne indsamling direkte, ALT kan bruges.
  • GIV NOGET: ligger du inde med et par mikrofoner, et gammel lydkort, eller måske bare en blød sofa der alligevel skal smides ud, så kan vi måske bruge det. Skriv til os på radiosyndikatet@gmail.com så finder vi stensikkert ud af noget.
  • GØR NOGET: Vi har altid brug for ekstra hænder, hvad enten det handler om at sende fondsansøgninger, udfylde formularer til KODA/Gramex, kontakte den næste gæst eller komme med idéer til det næste program, så er det altid en stor hjælp. Hvis du har lyst til at være en del af Radio Syndikatet og hjælpe med den daglige drift, så skriv til os på radiosyndikatet@gmail.com

story: My name is Andrew Ellis and I'm an Americana (Blues, Country, Folk, Rock) musician from Toledo, OH. I'm, presently, writing and recording an album through Little Elephant Studios. I am also seeking a booking agnt/manager to start touring Europe and the US. Times are tough in Toledo, and being a husband and a father of two, I'm persuing my music career to provide a better life for my family. I've been playing professionally for 17 years but I need some funding to help me to the next level.  Any and all donations will go toward recording, purchasing new gear, and travel expenses for our upcoming cd release tour in February. Thank you for your support.
story_txt: My name is Andrew Ellis and I'm an Americana (Blues, Country, Folk, Rock) musician from Toledo, OH. I'm, presently, writing and recording an album through Little Elephant Studios. I am also seeking a booking agnt/manager to start touring Europe and the US. Times are tough in Toledo, and being a husband and a father of two, I'm persuing my music career to provide a better life for my family. I've been playing professionally for 17 years but I need some funding to help me to the next level.  Any and all donations will go toward recording, purchasing new gear, and travel expenses for our upcoming cd release tour in February. Thank you for your support.

story:
Hi and thanks for your interest in the album! Before we get into the details click on the video above and let me put you in the picture (if you haven't already watched it)

The Plan

After a lifetime of song-writing the time has come to get the best of the best on a professional quality album to share with you all.

We want the album to reflect the time and care that went into every song. To that end we are going to RSL studios (used by Sony BMG and EMI artists etc) to get a professionally recorded and mixed album to share with the world. Think of it as buying the album before it is made on good faith that it will be worth listening to! Basically we are offering 4 lifetimes of experience and musical training distilled into an album with 10-12 songs.
Musical communication means everything to us but without something to listen to there can be no communication, this album can't be made the way we want it to without your support!

Costs

Naturally a lot more goes into making an album than just good recordings of the songs, your donations will be used to pay for:

·  Studio time

·  Mixing

·  Mastering

·  Artwork

·  Design

·  Photography

·  CD/Vinyl production costs

·  Digital distribution

·  Travel to and from the studio

We are setting the target at €4000 as this is the absolute minimum amount we believe we need to spend to make a good job of the album. Anything we make above and beyond that will be used to improve the album with extra studio time and mixing work and for exciting extras like limited edition vinyl versions and maybe even a professional music video if you are particularly generous with your donations!!! Rest assured every cent that you donate will go towards generating content for you!

What’s that you say? “I really want this album to get made but don’t have much money”? Of course we musicians are very sensitive to the penniless, so even if you can only afford a small donation it’s a huge help if you post this link all over your social networks, the more people that know about this the better!

How to donate

  • Browse your way through the list of carefully considered and attractive perks on the right until you see one that tickles your fancy and then click on it.
  • You will be taken to a page where you have the option of paying more for your chosen perk should you so wish, then simply fill out your email address and postal address (shipping for those of you from the US) if you have chosen a perk that needs to be sent to you and click “continue”
  • The payment page requires a credit card or paypal account, fill out your details and then click “contribute” or “go to paypal”…… you know…… depending on how you want to pay.
  • Once you are done you will be transported to the sharing page by the magic of the internet. Here you will see a summary of your contribution and perk and then we would LOVE you to tell all your social networks and email contacts about our efforts! This is just as important as contributing because if people don’t know what we are up to then they can’t choose to help. We will be giving away amazing prizes to the people who generate the most donations by sharing their personal link to our site. Check out the updates tab at the top for details!

That’s it! Thank you for reading and thank you even more if you decide to contribute, STANDBY FOR AN ALBUM!!!!!

You can also visit us at any of the following sites to see what we have been up to until now:

http://charlywood.bandcamp.com/album/plan-c-ep

http://www.charlywood.com/

https://www.facebook.com/charlywoodtheband

https://twitter.com/Charlywoodband

story:
Short Summary
     My name is Quinn Harley, and I'm a fifteen year-old singer/songwriter from the New Haven area of Connecticut. I have been performing at local venues, including Toad's Place and Two Boots, over the past couple of years. To date, I have written five original songs and have several in the works. In an effort to help my music reach new ears I'm looking to take the next step in my career, which would be to release my first EP (extended play/shortened album), "By the Pines". In order to pay for recording time and everything else that comes with releasing an EP, I will need your help. You can pre-order my EP, or purchase any of the many other perks available to fund the release and become involved in my music. I appreciate anything and everything you decide to contribute and your lasting support.

The EP will include four songs that are as "haunting as they are inspiring":

- You are Yours

- Silent Cry

- Safe Haven

- Long Run

I'm very excited to share my music with you, and thankful to have you join me on this step in my career.

What I Need & What You Get

While sharing music with others is absolutely magical, it is incredibly expensive (especially for an unemployed fifteen year-old.) In return for your support, I'm offering several bonus perks including free tickets to one of my shows, and an early download once the EP is recorded. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign to help reach as many supporters as possible!

Thank you for your love and support! :D

story:
Résumé

Avec le livre-disque Déversement d'huiles, notre huitième Opus, on veut sortir de nos propres sentiers battus et amener l'univers des Chauffeurs à pieds ailleurs le temps d'un projet! L'essentiel de ce que l'on vous prépare pour ce projet a été créé pendant ou inspiré par une expédition en canot de 21 jours sur la rivière Moisie faite par le groupe en 2013.

Cette expédition a marqué un point tournant dans la carrière du groupe, ou à tout le moins une parenthèse créatrice, teintée d'expérimentations musicales et poétiques. Cette aventure a aussi donné lieu a un spectacle encore en chantier, présenté au Musée de la Civilisation à Québec l'hiver dernier.

Ce projet a poussé le groupe à repousser ses limites et à amener la musique traditionnelle québécoise vers de nouveaux horizons, pas nécessairement très commerciaux: c'est entre autre pour cette raison que nous avons besoin de votre aide!

Le disque comprendra notamment des chansons traditionnelles portant sur le canot et les voyageurs, des airs instrumentaux et de la poésie composés sur les rives de la Moisie, de l'improvisation, le tout agrémenté d'une touche de musique électronique et d'art sonore. Le livre quant à lui comprendra des photos de l'aventure, encore plus de poésie, des partitions d'airs instrumentaux dédiés à des peintres qui nous ont inspirés et des recettes de nourriture déshydratée.

Sur le plan politique et environnemental, le projet s’inscrit dans un mouvement citoyen exigeant depuis plusieurs années déjà la préservation des dernières rivières non harnachées du Québec et le développement des énergies vertes. Il invite en outre Hydro-Québec à réfléchir davantage aux alternatives futures en matière de production énergétique et à guérir son « syndrome du castor », qui consiste à construire toujours plus de barrages, au détriment des écosystèmes et de l’accès aux rivières.

Avec nos sept disques, dont trois nominés à l’ADISQ, notre participations à plusieurs émissions de radio ou de télévision, nos collaborations avec des artistes comme Richard Desjardins ou Gilles Vigneault, les critiques élogieuses du public et des médias, sans parler de la fougue et l'intelligence musicale du groupe, Les Chauffeurs à pieds sont devenus un groupe phare de la nouvelle génération. L'esthétique des arrangements en constante recherche, le niveau technique des musiciens et la signature propre des Chauffeurs a amené le groupe à prendre part à de nombreux évènements tant au Québec à qu’en Australie, en passant par l’Europe ou l’Afrique. Le band possède sa propre étiquette indépendante : Les disques Scorbut.

Les Chauffeurs sont Olivier Soucy, Antoine Gauthier, Louis-Simon Lemieux et Benoît Fortier.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Nous avons besoin de 7000$ afin de pouvoir payer le studio, le mastering, et surtout le graphisme et l'impression du livre et du disque, sans oublier les frais de lancement.

Nous avons déjà reçu une bourse en recherche et création du Conseil des arts et lettres du Québec pour assurer notre subsistance durant la période de création.

Le groupe est prêt à investir de sa poche 2000$ pour la réalisation du projet. 

Il y a des contribution pour tous les goûts pour nous donner un coup de pouce: pour les réglos, les couillus, les dérangés, les rangés, les enthousiastes, les fans et les désespérés!

L'impact

C'est la première fois qu'on se lance dans l'aventure d'un disque, avec tous les frais qui s'ajoutent au CD, qu'on est habitués de réaliser (on en a déjà fait 7 avec le groupe en plus des productions individuelles). Votre contribution pourra rendre le projet livre-CD possible et amener la musique trad et le travail du groupe vers une nouvelle avenue, le temps d'un projet.

N'hésitez pas à passer le mot!

Merci pour votre aide! Elle est grandement appréciée!
