story:
Short Summary

I have been a professional musician for nearly forty years, starting with Bauhaus and then Love and Rockets as well as a stint with The Jazz Butcher.  I have been playing solo gigs since 1983. For the past few years I’ve been playing an ongoing series of ‘living room shows’.  These intimate gatherings have taken me into peoples’ homes all over the world.  The experience is always warm and soul satisfying and I love that it cuts out the middle man so that I can deal directly with the fans /music lovers.  While out on the road I have been writing new songs inspired by these troubadour adventures.  I am now bringing these new works together as a double vinyl album.  I have already made a bunch of recordings.  These sessions having been funded by my Patreon site which has proved to be an invaluable interface with the fans and their support has been truly appreciated.  It’s about half way there and I now need to complete the project and then take it on the road.  I want to tour internationally in support of the new album in the Spring / Summer of 2017.   In these days of DIY independence, 'crowd sourcing' platforms (such as here at Indiegogo ) are now the all important factor that enables independent artists such as myself to function and thrive.  It is a reciprocal system that also creates a familial bond which is something that lies at the heart of the acoustic 'living room' shows.

The remainder of the recordings will be done at a great little musician run studio in Los Angeles. I have several wonderful musicians in mind to play on the tracks.  Once the record is recorded and mastered it will be manufactured as a limited edition of 500 double vinyl albums.  (I love that vinyl has made such a come back!  Nothing can beat that sound in my book and there is nothing like holding a beautiful gatefold sleeve in your hands and pouring over the art work as you listen to the music inside.  I have a great designer who I will be working with on this.)   I am confident that the record will be made but the biggest challenge will be taking it on the road, especially as I want to tour outside of my home in the USA.  International travel is not cheap.  If I do not hit my goal of $8000 then I will simply have to scale it all back and limit touring to the USA but hopefully I will be able to be a vagabond abroad as well as here!  'Hope to see you somewhere out there!

story:
Hi, I am Jeff Aug, an American guitarist and Guinness(TM) World Record holder living in Germany and currently active as a solo acoustic instrumental fingerstyle guitarist, the guitarist/vocalsist in the rockin´ acoustic country blues duo Dead Tuna, and the guitarist for the British artist Anne Clark -- who is currently taking a break from touring.  

I have released albums with my rock band Sorry About Your Daughter in the 90´s, as well as two acoustic instrumental albums with my duo Floating Stone, five solo acoustic instrumental fingerstyle guitar albums, three albums as the guitarist for Anne Clark, one DVD with Anne Clark, and have been featured as a guest on the Atari Teenage Riot album "Is This Hyperreal?" among others.

As a solo artist, I have set the Guinness(TM) World Record for "the most concerts performed in different countries in 24 hours" twice (2009, 2012); have toured as support for Allan Holdsworth, Soft Machine, Carl Verheyen, Alex Skolnick Trio, Johnny A., moe., Scott Henderson, and many others; been featured on the NPR program "Weekend Edition," and reached #1 position on the iTunes Acoustic Music album charts.

Releasing solo albums without a major label backing your production, marketing, and promotion is not an easy thing to do, especially when producing the recording on a professional level is expensive, most PR campaigns are out of reach, and album sales are very low in general.

At the end of the day, I am still motivated to get this album out.  This APE SHIFTER album showcases the best electric guitar playing I have ever recorded and the compositions will make bodies move!

After setting the electric guitar aside for a few years, I picked it back up in 2008 when Anne Clark decided she wanted some electric guitar in the mix (I had been playing strictly acoustic guitar in her shows).  Almost instantly, my fingers began to crave the electricity shooting through my veins when the lines, phrases, and riffs would hit the front-of-house speakers during soundcheck.  For the last 6+ years, and after having been inspired by the great artists with whom I was touring, I felt I needed to release an instrumental rock album.  At that moment, APE SHIFTER was born.

APE SHIFTER started rehearsals in November 2015.  We hit the studio in July 2016 and laid down the tracks for our debut release "Ape Shifter."  On March 3, 2017, I am releasing the APE SHIFTER instrumental rock debut "Ape Shifter."  This time I have decided to reach out to you – my friends, fans and supporters – to help me with the funding of the new album prior to its release, and at the same time to give you the chance to be the first to acquire the new album via a pre-order.

In addition to the APE SHIFTER release, this campaign will offer you the possibility of bargain deals on my last two solo albums "Living Room Sessions" and "Wedding Song."

story:
What is Philippi Music Project?

PMP started in July 2014 as a social business aiming at offering infrastructure to aspiring artists and musicians from the townships of Cape Town. More than just a recording studio, the place works like a platform connected to Cape Town 's music industry and creates meaningful interactions between musicians, record labels, streaming platforms, venues, media and so much more. Workshops, conferences, concerts, recording sessions will make this place a classroom to express creativity, connect people and learn from Music.

We crowdfunded the building of the studio in 2016, and the construction completed in March 2017, after three months of hard work involving local suppliers.

The studio will open in a very short while, as we are now working with a sound engineer to develop the most functional set up for local artists. PMP received a great media coverage that brought beautiful interactions, making the project more impactful.

We received a team of students from the Worcester Polytechnic Institute  of Massachusetts to develop a mobile app for our artists to promote their content and events, we organized a great event with the people from Recordbox Sessions that enables to promote local artists, we worked with a team of French reporters on a documentary about the music and its impact through social innovation (the documentary will be out soon), and it keeps on moving as we will soon host two students from the IDEA program of the EM Lyon School to help in recording an album with local artists.

These partnerships are key for PMP as they broaden its impact and enable the promotion of local artists from the townships of Cape Town. The Modular Festival represents for us an even bigger opportunity, to go further in our impact.

 

What is the Modular Festival?

The Modular Festival is organised by the city of Augsburg´s youth council and is one of the biggest non-profit youth and popcultural festivals in Bavaria (Germany) – however, it´s much more than this!

Around 30.000 visitors on three days, more than 50 artists and bands more than 30 programme planers from various youth cultural genres, a regional food court and a creative market with young designers – the Modular has established itself as a platform for Augsburg´s youth, designers, artists and culture lovers. 

Philippi Music Project has been invited to present its social innovation at the festival, through interactive presentation, and a collaborative workshop where visitors will be able to record music that will be used later by local music producers from the townships of Cape Town to do an EP. PMP will also perform during the festival on the main stage, as PMP's two co-founders are MC & DJ. They will offer a 100% South African Beats set, to promote the amazing music coming out from SA.

 

Why does PMP need to go to the Modular Festival? 

The Modular Festival will mean so much for us, as we will be able to promote the local and aspiring artists from the townships of Cape Town. It will mean so much for us, because we will be able to promote this music towards a big crowd, building bridges between artists that are not connected enough to the industry and people who will discover the richness and creativity of these musicians. 

It will also be for PMP the opportunity to present its project, its social innovation, and to meet relevant stakeholders in the media and the music industry. People is power, and meeting new actors in the game will empower our project, as it has always been the case for the past 3 years.

Eventually, this invitation is the first time that PMP will go physically abroad, and we hope that it will bring others opportunity. Eventually we hope to be able to tour with local artists using our studio in Cape Town...

 

How much and for what ? 

We need to purchase the plane ticket of our co-funder, Sibusiso Nyamakazi, who will travel from Philippi to Germany. The visa application is on its way, and we need the plane ticket to achieve it. We also need to pay for an health insurance that is required through the visa application. Therefore we need to raise 900 $ by May to make this possible.
story_txt:
What is Philippi Music Project?
PMP started in July 2014 as a social business aiming at offering infrastructure to aspiring artists and musicians from the townships of Cape Town. More than just a recording studio, the place works like a platform connected to Cape Town 's music industry and creates meaningful interactions between musicians, record labels, streaming platforms, venues, media and so much more. Workshops, conferences, concerts, recording sessions will make this place a classroom to express creativity, connect people and learn from Music.
We crowdfunded the building of the studio in 2016, and the construction completed in March 2017, after three months of hard work involving local suppliers.

The studio will open in a very short while, as we are now working with a sound engineer to develop the most functional set up for local artists. PMP received a great media coverage that brought beautiful interactions, making the project more impactful.
We received a team of students from the Worcester Polytechnic Institute  of Massachusetts to develop a mobile app for our artists to promote their content and events, we organized a great event with the people from Recordbox Sessions that enables to promote local artists, we worked with a team of French reporters on a documentary about the music and its impact through social innovation (the documentary will be out soon), and it keeps on moving as we will soon host two students from the IDEA program of the EM Lyon School to help in recording an album with local artists.
These partnerships are key for PMP as they broaden its impact and enable the promotion of local artists from the townships of Cape Town. The Modular Festival represents for us an even bigger opportunity, to go further in our impact.


 
What is the Modular Festival?
The Modular Festival is organised by the city of Augsburg´s youth council and is one of the biggest non-profit youth and popcultural festivals in Bavaria (Germany) – however, it´s much more than this!

Around 30.000 visitors on three days, more than 50 artists and bands more than 30 programme planers from various youth cultural genres, a regional food court and a creative market with young designers – the Modular has established itself as a platform for Augsburg´s youth, designers, artists and culture lovers. 
Philippi Music Project has been invited to present its social innovation at the festival, through interactive presentation, and a collaborative workshop where visitors will be able to record music that will be used later by local music producers from the townships of Cape Town to do an EP. PMP will also perform during the festival on the main stage, as PMP's two co-founders are MC & DJ. They will offer a 100% South African Beats set, to promote the amazing music coming out from SA.
 
Why does PMP need to go to the Modular Festival? 
The Modular Festival will mean so much for us, as we will be able to promote the local and aspiring artists from the townships of Cape Town. It will mean so much for us, because we will be able to promote this music towards a big crowd, building bridges between artists that are not connected enough to the industry and people who will discover the richness and creativity of these musicians. 

It will also be for PMP the opportunity to present its project, its social innovation, and to meet relevant stakeholders in the media and the music industry. People is power, and meeting new actors in the game will empower our project, as it has always been the case for the past 3 years.
Eventually, this invitation is the first time that PMP will go physically abroad, and we hope that it will bring others opportunity. Eventually we hope to be able to tour with local artists using our studio in Cape Town...
 
How much and for what ? 
We need to purchase the plane ticket of our co-funder, Sibusiso Nyamakazi, who will travel from Philippi to Germany. The visa application is on its way, and we need the plane ticket to achieve it. We also need to pay for an health insurance that is required through the visa application. Therefore we need to raise 900 $ by May to make this possible.

story:
I'm very excited to be starting an album with a producing/engineering team of two dear friends—John Hanson and Dan Ballard! John has played guitar for Christina Perri for the last few years and is currently producing in Los Angeles. Dan Ballard, in his previous band Until June, had a number one song in Greece. He is currently producing in Orange County. 

 

For friends who don't understand how albums are put together and why it's costly, I've included some of the steps in the process. Each step is necessary and takes years to acquire each specific skill. 

 

Songwriter: 

Songs can take a long time to write! I try to complete one song a month. Sometimes I'll chip away at a song for a whole year until I think it's right. I care about lyrics and the musical details that go into storytelling: chord progressions, melody, and structure. I will spend hours a day slowly building on the story. I've been doing this for two decades. 

 

Believe it or not, last year I made less than $20 a month on streaming music alone—on thousands and thousands of plays. Most people don't know that each time you stream an album on Spotify or another service, the artist only makes $.006. That's a lot of plays until I would even make a penny. 

 

This is why it takes a team of people partnering with me to continue to make music and tell these stories.

 

Players:

Rhythm sections (drummers and bass players) and other players take a lifetime to develop the skills for their instruments. There is no replacing these players. We will play guitar, keys, and sing on this record, but we will also have some other people "guest", because that's what makes music interesting. When you have a lot of people sharing ideas. Each player is paid per song. 

 

Producer: 

This is where the "shaping" of each song happens. The possibilities of where a song could go are endless. A single song could have an infinite amount of different combinations of instruments and styles. When you hear a song on most records, hundreds of decisions went into each instrument and part of the song. Should we go with this drum fill or this one? Is the bass too busy on this take? What instruments do you hear on this? Many producers are fantastic musicians that can arrange parts. It takes years and years to acquire the skills to produce well.

 

Engineer:

This has to do with the mic'ing of different instruments, getting tones, and an overall aesthetic of what the album sounds like. Again, there are endless combinations of each instrument, the tones desired, and the knowledge of how these will work together later for the mix. A good engineer also has a great knowledge for troubleshooting gear when it isn't working. Most people don't know how common it is to have sound problems in the studio and the time it takes to figure out why something isn't working. Does this guitar sound too "boomy"? Do you think we can get a better snare sound? How do we get these two guitars to not share the same mid-range space? Again, this skill takes many years to get good at.

 

Mixer:

This is the last "player" on the album. Good mixers take decades learning their craft and have fantastic ears. They learn how to meticulously make all of the instruments work together to make a final painting. I've watched people who weren't musicians listen to the same song mixed by a few different people. They were amazed at the difference one step in the recording process can make. Mixing can be really expensive and you definitely get what you pay for. 

 

Master:

The final step of recording. This is where slight adjustments to the tones and volumes are brought to similar levels so the album sounds cohesive. It's a skill that takes time to learn. Even though it's one of the most inexpensive steps, with a deal (favor from a friend) it would still cost about $1,500 for a 10-song album.

 

Artwork and Layout:

My dear friend and talented painter, Ryan Callis, has provided me with both of my previous album covers. Another dear friend, Ralph Polendo, an angel in my corner and a really gifted designer, helped me with this video and will handle any of my design needs.

story:
BoogieBike is a new musical venture from DJ Mano Gil to spread the joy of music to the many public spaces in San Luis Obispo and nearby towns. The project consists of a sound system (2 turntables + mixer + speakers) adapted to a customized E3 GO E-Trike that plays only vinyl records. 

The concept of the BoogieBike is to offer music for people in public spaces such as parks, squares, or even sidewalks. The volume and the selection of songs are adapted to the people's mood and the environment, ranging from jazz, bossa nova, soul, salsa, and other family friendly rhythms. An extra motivation for the creation of BoogieBike is the fact that, being originally from Brazil, Mano Gil will be able share  his collection of Brazilian music with the town he now calls home. 

The majority of BoogieBike gigs will be free and outdoors. It will count on the participation of local guest DJs and it will also serve as a mobile DJ school for the young generations that still can’t come to the evening events. As a teacher on his daytime job, Mano Gil loves sharing his musical knowledge with the future generation of DJs, helping inspire their passion for music and contributing in developing SLO’s multi-cultural scene.

 

Our project was inspired by a similar project from Montreal, Canada called Tupicycle. One can even say that these are sister projects as Mano Gil became close friends with the creators of Tupicycle; DJs Skambo and MKS, on his last visit to Montreal in 2016. You can see how their project turned out here --> #TUPICYCLE 

 

 

WHAT WE NEED  &  HOW MUCH IT'LL COST

 

THE IMPACT

San Luis Obispo is one of the most bike friendly cities in America. It has several public spaces that are not always used to their full potential at times. This project aims to provide an extra bit of diversity to our already vibrant music scene by bringing music to where people are. 

We expect the impact to be almost immediate. People of all ages a social walks will be able to congregate, meet new friends, build new community relationships and share the public spaces in a healthy and rich way. 

Without being pretentious, we also hope to inspire other people in other parts of the world to build similar projects in their town. We're living in times when the more you know your neighbor the more we can understand and appreciate each other. Music can be help create those bridges and strengthen the community as a whole. Just like we we were inspired by the guys from TupiCollective and their Tupicycle in Montreal we would like to spread the love and do the same here in SLO.

 

 

WHO IS BEHIND BOOGIEBIKE SOUNDSYSTEM?

Gil Braga is the real name of DJ Mano Gil. He was born in Belo Horizonte, Brazil and have been as DJ for almost 20 years. In 2009 he arrived in San Luis Obispo, California, after spending three years in Los Angeles. He now considers himself a SLOcal who is passionate about community outreach and human connection through music. Gil also serves his community as a school teacher. 

 

Josh Cohen grew up here in SLO and is passionate about all things bicycles. He owns Foothill Cyclery, a local bike shop that has been helping SLOcals get behind the handlebars since 1989. Josh also enjoys building things and his home projects with wood, metal, electronics are a fun weekend hobby for him. He's the perfect partner to help transform the Gil's visions into reality.

story:
My name is Krista Johnson. I'm a 29 year old singer/songwriter residing in the Canton, CT area, raised in Bristol, CT. From the moment I was 2 years old, when I climbed atop my Grandmother's kitchen table and put a beat to the prayer my mother would say to me every night, I knew, and my family knew, it was fate. Over the years, though, I got quiet and very shy. I joined choruses in school but otherwise never tried to stand out. Writing has been a part of my life for a long time as well. Maybe not since 2 but since I was old enough to keep journals. I started seriously writing poems in highschool, and into college. Looking back, they're nothing I'd use now, very somber but ultimately very well written. It sparked something in me within the last year or two as I uncovered them...

After trying to find someone to play guitar FOR me, so I'd be off the hook, turned out to fruitless I decided to really pick it up and learn. Thanks to the help of Andrew and Jesse at Downright music I learned some invaluable tips and tricks on guitar. I've done some self teaching and gained lots of knowledge from friends and family. I am completely surrounded and saturated with talent and I feel so blessed! In the late spring/early summer of 2015 I wrote the first song I felt super proud of, and that people responded very well to. That song is called River Bend, aptly named after an awesome spot on my beloved Farmington River (which is mentioned a few times in a few songs). With help and inspiration 5 more song babies were born! And more on the way! 

I finally realized I could be heard, and people actually enjoyed hearing me. I even enjoyed hearing me! (Good feeling) So I started up a music page on Facebook and kept adding regularly to my YouTube page. There is no feeling quite like it. And with all that finally happening, playing out, hearing applause and whistles, I decided it was time to make an album. I had NO idea how, or if I even had what it took. I started asking around and researching but ultimately left it up to God. As fate would have it I was contacted by Tracy Walton of On Deck Studios. There wasn't even any question in my mind that it was the right avenue since it came to ME. Furthermore he has produced my lovely Earth Fairy friend Krizta Moon's album "Tending to the Garden of Truth" along with Sara Barrios' and Julia Autumn Ford's albums to name a few strong, talented female singers! 

It has been so much fun hearing and seeing my songs come to LIFE. Tracy himself is quiet deft in many different instruments which will be heard on the album. You will also hear my super, duper talented brother Tim Johnson on one or more of the songs playing some fancy guitar riffs. And I hope to be working with a new friend of mine Dan Foster from England on fiddle. (Who is also a Fiddle instructor). Ultimately my sound will be mostly "back porch" as Tracy has put it but as you may know, or may not know recording and releasing an album has quite hefty financial costs and I would be so gracious if you were willing to aid in making this dream come true for me. I've decided to work with Indiegogo because it's a great platform for these fledgling ideas to come to life! Also, it offers great perks so that I may give back to my supporters. (Check them out in the "Perks" section of the main page.) 

The album itself is still very new but my hope is that it will be named "Always Looking Up" after a song that will be on the record. It is my motto for life, and even though I allow for those dark feelings to come and move through me, my disposition is always set to happy and gracious. Life has not always been an easy ride and I've been stuck in low, low places. Upon choosing happiness as an everyday goal,  life has given me such good things in return. And I know now that I am worthy of all good things. And so are you. The album touches on that topic as well as love and lessons learned. 

Again, thank you from all corners of my heart for your support. It means SO much to me that you are willing to help fund this journey with (blind, if you don't know me) faith. I truly hope you enjoy!

Love, Krista J.

story:
Mexamorphosis is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Mexamorphosis must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Watch previous performances here  and join us in October!! (Encuentra nuestras presentaciones anteriores aquí):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yWznUOLnfZc

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv97hDyzFChj2z...

https://www.facebook.com/mexamorphosis/

Montaje Interdisciplinario Mexamorphosis (English below)

Se propone difundir música y expresiones artísticas de diversos siglos, sus raíces populares, influencias, transformaciones y su relación con
tradiciones mexicanas como el Son Jarocho veracruzano, poniéndose al alcance de la comunidad por medio de espectáculos gratuitos.

Para lograr los alcances deseados, esta iniciativa se encuentra ahora en el comienzo de una campaña económica para cubrir gastos de producción en la ciudad de Nueva York y en Union City, Nueva Jersey. Cualquier cooperación voluntaria es bienvenida (Click en: Back it). El apoyo recibido es deducible de impuestos  en USA. 

Presentará música, danza y proyecciones multimedia en tiempo real a cargo del artista visual Ciro del Barco.

El repertorio musical comprende principalmente polifonía y repertorio vocal belcantista, el cual derivará, por medio de transiciones musicales y visuales, en música tradicional mexicana, principalmente Son Jarocho veracruzano, aludiendo así a la influencia estilística que se manifiesta en un mestizaje artístico en México y Latinoamérica como resultado de los años de la conquista.

En palabras del pintor y escultor yucateco Jesús Peraza, “empeñados en hacer con raíces otras ramas con nuevos frutos, traemos esta MEXAMORPHOSIS, la dialéctica del origen profundo en lo nuevo que nace ahora”.

La iniciación del proyecto ha contado con la colaboración solidaria de artistas internacionales como Radio Jarocho, los músicos James Kennerley, Sarah Stone, Kannan Vasudevan, Marc Molomot y la mezzo-soprano Guadalupe Peraza así como con la participación de un equipo creativo conformado también por Mauricio Trejo, John Rose, Carlos Cuestas, Amanda Sidebottom, Emma Sofía Peraza, Laura Pennisi y Federico Schmucler, entre otros. La dirección artística se encuentra a cargo de Guadalupe Peraza.

Mexamorphosis  is an interdisciplinary performance presenting live music dance and videomapping projections.

The music will transition between early western classical music and Mexican (and Latin-American) traditional music, considering their historical and stylistic influences on one another and making the combination harmonically and instrumentally logical and tasteful.

It also suggests relationships between all kinds of “classical” music (mainly vocal repertoire) and its text and popular/folk music, by using unusual instrumentation to accompany vocal music (opera/zarzuela arias and duets, oratorio arias/ensembles, polyphony and songs from the Renaissance to the 20th century). The use of instruments such as harp, accordion, jaranas, guitar, marimbol, marimba, etc., would substitute for the original orchestration and then transition into folk music, so that the two styles would mirror each other.

Initially the popular music side will emphasize Mexican Son Jarocho music from Veracruz in partnership with amazing group Radio Jarocho.

This show is intended to have its opening in New York City and in Union City, NJ in 2016 and then go to different countries. The emphasis on Mexican Son Jarocho is partially because it has a close stylistic and historical relationship with Baroque and Renaissance music from Europe (especially Spain), but is also for the purpose of exposing and promoting this music. In comparison with the Mariachi genre, for instance, the style is not well known outside of Mexico, even in some Latin American countries.

The use of aerial dancing will also be incorporated into these performances.

As a part of the interdisciplinary concept, the use of multi-media resources such as stage projections of images and films will be done on a series of white fabrics hanging around the performers to create the scenery. Paintings and sculpture by various artists will appear in the promotion, logo, website and stage as well.

One of the goals is to achieve a new level of interaction between performers and audience and between performers themselves, from different stylistic backgrounds. By including popular musicians in classical music concerts, and following the steps of exposition (of separate styles), transition (between styles) and then potentially fusion, the relationship between styles, texts, and ways of making music will be illuminated, inviting and including a wider community of different genres and disciplines into the same performances to establish cultural bridges.

Improvisation and jamming with everyone on stage is also intended.

The logo of the name “Mexamorphosis” or “Mexamorfosis” (in Latin America) will include works by Jesus Peraza, a Mexican artist from Yucatán.

Eventually, this project envisions encompassing not only Mexican and Latin-American music and traditions, but also music and traditions from around the world.


Mexamorphosis is scheduled to be presented at the "Cross Cultural Approaches to Latino Students" Faculty Interest Group Concert at the TriBeca Performing Arts Center at The Borough of Manhattan Community College, City University of New York on October 7, 2016, and at the Hispanic Heritage Month Concert at the Union City Performing Arts Center on October 15, 2016.

All of the above performances will be free to the public.

The performances have great educational and social value, as they exhibit a diversity of classical music genres, particularly opera, early music, and art song, and, at the same time, illuminate the close stylistic and historical relationship of these genres with popular music from countries that have been historically influenced by Western European cultures even while developing independent societies and artistic practices. The performances also promote and exhibit Mexican music and traditions, especially those like Son Jarocho which are not well known outside of Mexico.

The illumination of the relationship between styles, texts, and ways of making music invites and includes a wider community of  both performers and audiences into the same performances to establish cultural bridges, while giving voice to different (and sometimes unknown) music styles and disciplines at the highest level of interpretation.

Among the main audience targets are university and high school students, with the hope of awakening their interest in unusual cultural experiences.

Upcoming performances:

October 7, 2016, at the TriBeca Performing Arts Center at The Borough of Manhattan Community College, CUNY for The "Cross Cultural Approaches to Latino Students" Faculty Interest Group Concert.

October 15, 2016, at the Union City Performing Arts Center to close the celebration of the Hispanic Heritage Month in Union City, NJ.

Mexamorphosis is registered under the Writers Guild of America, WAG NUMBER: 1837586.

Picture credits: Gary Vereau

Your donation is tax deductible.

mexamorphosis.org
story_txt:
Mexamorphosis is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a 
non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable 
purposes of Mexamorphosis must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only 
and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.Watch previous performances here  and join us in October!! (Encuentra nuestras presentaciones anteriores aquí):https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yWznUOLnfZchttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv97hDyzFChj2z...https://www.facebook.com/mexamorphosis/Montaje Interdisciplinario Mexamorphosis (English below) Se propone difundir música y expresiones artísticas de diversos siglos, sus raíces populares, influencias, transformaciones y su relación con tradiciones mexicanas como el Son Jarocho veracruzano, poniéndose al alcance de la comunidad por medio de espectáculos gratuitos. Para lograr los alcances deseados, esta iniciativa se encuentra ahora en el comienzo de una campaña económica para cubrir gastos de producción en la ciudad de Nueva York y en Union City, Nueva Jersey. Cualquier cooperación voluntaria es bienvenida (Click en: Back it). El apoyo recibido es deducible de impuestos  en USA. Presentará música, danza y proyecciones multimedia en tiempo real a cargo del artista visual Ciro del Barco. El repertorio musical comprende principalmente polifonía y repertorio vocal belcantista, el cual derivará, por medio de transiciones musicales y visuales, en música tradicional mexicana, principalmente Son Jarocho veracruzano, aludiendo así a la influencia estilística que se manifiesta en un mestizaje artístico en México y Latinoamérica como resultado de los años de la conquista. En palabras del pintor y escultor yucateco Jesús Peraza, “empeñados en 
hacer con raíces otras ramas con nuevos frutos, traemos esta 
MEXAMORPHOSIS, la dialéctica del origen profundo en lo nuevo que nace 
ahora”.La iniciación del proyecto ha contado con la colaboración solidaria de artistas internacionales como Radio Jarocho, los músicos James Kennerley, Sarah Stone, Kannan Vasudevan, Marc Molomot y la mezzo-soprano Guadalupe Peraza así como con la participación de un equipo creativo conformado también por Mauricio Trejo, John Rose, Carlos Cuestas, Amanda Sidebottom, Emma Sofía Peraza, Laura Pennisi y Federico Schmucler, entre otros. La dirección artística se encuentra a cargo de Guadalupe Peraza. Mexamorphosis  is an 
interdisciplinary performance presenting live music dance and videomapping projections. The music will 
transition between early western classical music and Mexican (and 
Latin-American) traditional music, considering their historical and 
stylistic influences on one another and making the combination 
harmonically and instrumentally logical and tasteful.It also 
suggests relationships between all kinds of “classical” music (mainly 
vocal repertoire) and its text and popular/folk music, by using unusual 
instrumentation to accompany vocal music (opera/zarzuela arias and 
duets, oratorio arias/ensembles, polyphony and songs from the 
Renaissance to the 20th century). The use of instruments such as harp, 
accordion, jaranas, guitar, marimbol, marimba, etc., would substitute 
for the original orchestration and then 
transition into folk music, so that the two styles would mirror each 
other.Initially the popular music side will emphasize Mexican Son Jarocho music from Veracruz in partnership with amazing group Radio Jarocho.This
 show is intended to have its opening in New York City and in Union 
City, NJ in 2016 and then go to different countries. The emphasis on 
Mexican Son Jarocho is partially because it has a close stylistic and 
historical relationship with Baroque and Renaissance music from Europe 
(especially Spain), but is also for the purpose of exposing and 
promoting this music. In comparison with the Mariachi genre, for 
instance, the style is not well known outside of Mexico, even in some 
Latin American countries.The use of aerial dancing will also be incorporated into these performances.As
 a part of the interdisciplinary concept, the use of multi-media 
resources such as stage projections of images and films will be done on a
 series of white fabrics hanging around the performers to create the 
scenery. Paintings and sculpture by various artists will appear in the 
promotion, logo, website and stage as well.One of the goals is to 
achieve a new level of interaction between performers and audience and 
between performers themselves, from different stylistic backgrounds. By 
including popular musicians in classical music concerts, and following 
the steps of exposition (of separate styles), transition (between 
styles) and then potentially fusion, the relationship between styles, 
texts, and ways of making music will be illuminated, inviting and 
including a wider community of different genres and disciplines into the
 same performances to establish cultural bridges.Improvisation and jamming with everyone on stage is also intended.The
 logo of the name “Mexamorphosis” or “Mexamorfosis” (in Latin America) 
will include works by Jesus Peraza, a Mexican artist from Yucatán.Eventually, this project envisions encompassing not only Mexican and Latin-American music and traditions, but also music and traditions from around the world.Mexamorphosis is scheduled to be presented at the "Cross Cultural Approaches to 
Latino Students" Faculty Interest Group Concert at the TriBeca 
Performing Arts Center at The Borough of Manhattan Community College, 
City University of New York on October 7, 2016, and at the Hispanic 
Heritage Month Concert at the Union City Performing Arts Center on 
October 15, 2016.All of the above performances will be free to the public.The
 performances have great educational and social value, as they exhibit a
 diversity of classical music genres, particularly opera, early music, 
and art song, and, at the same time, illuminate the close stylistic and 
historical relationship of these genres with popular music from 
countries that have been historically influenced by Western European 
cultures even while developing independent societies and artistic 
practices. The performances also promote and exhibit Mexican music and 
traditions, especially those like Son Jarocho which are not well known 
outside of Mexico.The illumination of the relationship between 
styles, texts, and ways of making music invites and includes a wider 
community of  both performers and audiences into the same performances 
to establish cultural bridges, while giving voice to different (and 
sometimes unknown) music styles and disciplines at the highest level of 
interpretation.Among the main audience targets are university 
and high school students, with the hope of awakening their interest in 
unusual cultural experiences.Upcoming performances:October
 7, 2016, at the TriBeca Performing Arts Center at The Borough of 
Manhattan Community College, CUNY for The "Cross Cultural Approaches to 
Latino Students" Faculty Interest Group Concert.October 15, 
2016, at the Union City Performing Arts Center to close the celebration 
of the Hispanic Heritage Month in Union City, NJ.Mexamorphosis is registered under the Writers Guild of America, WAG NUMBER: 1837586.Picture credits: Gary VereauYour donation is tax deductible.mexamorphosis.org

story:
Little Boy Junior on Vinyl!

We're Little Boy Jr from Chicago, Illinois! Our sound is reminiscent of wholesome yesteryear rock and roll, pulling in elements from the increasingly popular reappearance of beach rock." With such heavy influence from good ol' fashioned Rock n Roll, it just makes sense to put this album out on vinyl! (Which is sadly very expensive to do on our own). Each contribution gets us that much closer to sharing our collective dream with you in a fancy high-fi package!

What Your Money goes to!

  • Pressing of the physical record
  • Paying for the Album Artwork (Which looks rad!)
  • Printing the Record Jackets (with the fancy artwork we mentioned above)
  • Hosting the digital download of the album (so you can put it on your flip phones and such)

What You Get!


  • $5 - A Personal Thank you on our Facebook Page! (How Cool is that?)
  • $10 - A Digital Copy of the Album
  • $15 - A Digital Copy of the Album on a sweet LBJ Flash Drive!
  • $20 - A copy of the Album on Vinyl w/Digital Download
  • $30 - A copy of the Album on Vinyl w/Digital Download + A Sweet LBJ Tee!
  • $50 - a signed copy of our record w/digital download plus a sweet LBJ T-Shit! (Ya never know what it might be worth some day!)
  • $70 - Double Disc Special! 2 signed copies of the album on Vinyl & 2 Tees (Share the love!)
  • $200 - A Special Thanks in the Album Notes! (Plus a copy of the Record & a Tee)
  • $500 - Dinner with LBJ! - We'll take you to one of our favorite restaurants (On us of course!) We'll also bring along a copy of the record & a T-Shirt for you!
  • $1000 - A Sweet LBJ Inspired Oil Painting created by our very own Drummer Sean! (Plus a copy of the album & a Tee!)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation right now, we totally understand and appreciate you even visiting the page to support us! Any support is greatly appreciated! Please like us on Facebook, Follow us on Instagram, and help spread the word about our music and this campaign!

story:
The Dream

Dear gentle people of the world, 

We are The Gentlemen Amateurs, and we come simply to move you. Drawing inspiration from the likes of Earth, Wind, and Fire, Stevie Wonder, and Tower of Power among others, our aim is to leave you with a beat in your feet, a tune in your head, and a smile on your face.

Over the last three years, we've been writing and performing our original music for fans all over the Bay Area. Now, with your help, we hope to do these beloved songs justice by professionally recording them for your personal listening pleasure.

The Deets

We'll be recording over the span of 8 days at the acclaimed Tiny Telephone studios in San Francisco. The goal for the album is to capture the raw energy of our live shows and blend it with the sophistication and polish only a professional recording studio such as TT can provide.
We will be recording together in a live room, directly to analog tape. Audiophiles swear by the subtle feel and warmth that only this traditional method of tracking can provide.
Additionally, we will be working with James Riotto, one of the Bay's most creative up-and-coming recording engineers, to craft a sound that's both completely original, yet comfortably familiar.

The Impact

As a band, and now close group of friends, we were brought together by a common deep and undying love of music. For many of us, recording a full-length album of original music has been a dream we have carried since adolescence. We have each poured countless hours into practicing, listening, writing, and basically inhaling music, with the sole intent of inspiring others with our passion. We are proud of these songs and of this band, and sincerely hope to spread joy and creativity through our music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this page anywhere you can to help spread the good word of The Gents. Thank you!!!

story:
Hi!

We are MonkingMe, a new music platform that allows you to listen to and download music for free, while the artists are paid for it. We link the music content from the artists with their concerts and merchandising in the same place. In this way, the fans will be aware of all the news from their favourite musicians.

The artists can select some options to download their songs:

  • Free download
  • Free download, in exchange for a user's like to the artist's profile
  • Free download, in exchange for viewing 20 seconds of a video made by the same artist
  • Free download and REMUNERATED, in exchange for viewing 20 seconds of a video ad

You have read well! It will always be free! And artists will promote their other income channels like concerts and merchandising or artists will be remunerated in a fair and transparent way for each paid download. And you, as a user, will never hear any ads in the streaming!

 

Download the Android app here: https://goo.gl/0V6LSS

 

THE REVERSE CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN

 

You can get rewarded with more money than you pay. The main objective of the reverse campaign is to incentivize the sale of merchandising and artist concert tickets. Meanwhile, the users can listen to and download for free every song on MonkingMe. 

If you get one of the reverse rewards you could choose between more than 52,560 concerts and festivals, and all merchandising items on the platform for 2 years.

You could choose between all the concerts and events from:

  • http://www.ticketmaster.com/

 

     

    FOR ARTIST

     

     

    If you are an artist you can get one of these rewards. For example, if you get the first, you pay 300€ and MonkingMe will produce 330€ of your merchandising if you upload it to MonkingMe. 

     

     

    You can also get the promotion rewards. You could be the artist of the week, or your song will appear as the song of the day. Check it out! LIMITED!

     

    IMPACT

    MonkingMe is the solution to the big problem of piracy. More tan 80% of music consume is illegal. Monkingme take profit of the advantage of the piracy, is free! So, MonkingMe has created a free business model that increase the incomes of the artists.

    This is possible because we have been able to develop a model that monetizes the free content. Also it gives more visibility to the real income of the artist, ticket sales and merchandising.

    This events and press have wanted to make us known

     

    THE TEAM

    The team is the most important part of a startup. We want you to know us better and show confidence that we will take this project to success.

    The founding partners, Miquel and Raul, CEO and COO of the company, met for first time at 18 years old. Now we are 22 years old. At the beginning the project looked too crazy. But after a long period of effort, new members of the team, more partners and some investment, MonkingMe is real. It will take very little for it to become a success. We need your collaboration in the campaign to continue making the musical revolution a reality.

     

    PRODUCTS

    Also we have some products to buy, the MonkingMe T-Shirts and headphones. You can see it on the picture below.

    In the rewards panel you can choose the t-shirt size! These are the bluetooth headphones specs:

    • 10 hours of music
    • Microphone integrated
    • Noise cancelling
    • Bluetooth
    • Folding design
    • Fore more specs and pictures go to  http://sensationheadphones.com/

     

    CHALLENGE

    We want to show that the business model of the musical industry is changing. We believe that MonkingMe is the solution to nowadays music problems. We solve them and the artists make more money with us. And it’s free for everyone!

    Money collected will be use to make the product better:

    • More power servers to charge the platform  faster
    • Hire new workers to obtain a premium quality product
    • The creation of a team with a main objective to increase the musical content

     

    Are you interested in collaborate?

    • Get rewards! Some will earn you money!
    • No money? Don’t worry about it! Collaborate sharing the campaign!

    Follow us on social networks to stay tuned with us!

    • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MonkingMe/
    • Twitter: https://twitter.com/monkingme
    • Instagram: https://twitter.com/monkingme
    • Telegram Channel: https://telegram.me/monkingme

story:
Long Is The Walk- Spirits and Ghosts


Hey there, my name is Jeremy Harman and I'm a Boston-based singer/songwriter, cellist, and music educator.  First of all, thanks for taking the time to check out my Indiegogo campaign!

I've done a lot of work over the years as a sideman for other artists, particularly as a session cellist writing and recording string arrangements in the studio.

Over the last few years I've been writing a collection of songs and cello instrumentals and I've finally started putting together my first full length solo album.

I've been fortunate to have spent time recording up at one of my absolute favorite studios, Rocking Horse Studio in Pittsfield, NH, run by one of the best producers in New England, Brian Coombes.

The name of this project is Long Is The Walk, and the album is called Spirits and Ghosts.  I'm joined by my good friends and killer musicians Jens Ellerhold on drums and Joey Pierog on upright bass.  We have been creating an album of earthy, ethereal acoustic music mixing elements of folk, indie rock, shoegaze, jazz, metal, and contemporary classical music.  I've been beyond psyched with the results and I can't wait to put the finishing touches on the record!

I've been financing the recording sessions myself thus far, and we have been able to finish most of the actual tracking of the record, and I'm hoping to get your support to help me finish the mixing, mastering, pressing, and publicizing of this album!



What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm hoping to raise $5,000 which will cover the remaining costs of mixing, mastering, and pressing the album to CD, and for album publicity once it is released to hopefully give wider exposure to this music and this project!  It will also go towards paying my band for the album release shows we are planning this summer for Cambridge (MA), NYC, Portland (ME), and Portsmouth (NH).
  • Perks for contributing include both digital and hard copies of the album when it is released, tickets to my album release show at Club Passim in Cambridge, MA on July 6th, beautiful prints by my partner Cai Vail who will be creating all of the album artwork, and possibly even a solo show in your home by yours truly. 
  • Regardless of the total raised, a contribution in any amount will be a HUGE help to cover the remaining costs of turning this album into a reality.

If you can't contribute, but you like what you hear and would like to support this project, you can! 

  • Share this campaign with friends, family, aquaintances, enemies, gurus, etc who might be interested in this music
  • Check my website jeremyharman.net for updates on the progress of the album and for information about how to order the album once it's released.

Thanks again!

Jeremy

story:
• I’m excited about returning to the big power ballads I’ve been known for through the years. There’s always the temptation in music to be the latest, hippest sounding artist.

    But reality grips me now in my sixties and I actually find my audience hasn’t left. There was an era of music that was deep and profound with great lyrics that captured the glory of the Gospel.

    I enjoy much of today’s music but long for the roots of my past. It’s like going back and listening to the groups and artists we grew up with. There’s a deep connection.

    As I’ve thought and prayed through this next album project, The Balladeer, I want to combine the fresh sounds of today with the big power ballad style I did for years.

    Some of the other songs on this new CD are love songs I’ve written for my wife and kids as well as the journey of looking more like my parents as I age!

    But most of all they are a passionate expression of my journey in Christ and a heart that longs to look like him!

    Thanks for your consideration of joining me in this journey! I can't do it without you!

    I Wish You Jesus! Scott Wesley Brown
story_txt:
I’m excited about returning to the big power ballads I’ve
been known for through the years. There’s always the temptation in music to be
the latest, hippest sounding artist.
But reality grips me now in my sixties and I actually find
my audience hasn’t left. There was an era of music that was deep and profound with
great lyrics that captured the glory of the Gospel.
I enjoy much of today’s music but long for the roots of my
past. It’s like going back and listening to the groups and artists we grew up
with. There’s a deep connection. 
As I’ve thought and prayed through this next album project,
The Balladeer, I want to combine the fresh sounds of today with the big power
ballad style I did for years.
Some of the other songs on this new CD are love songs I’ve
written for my wife and kids as well as the journey of looking more like my
parents as I age!
But most of all they are a passionate expression of my
journey in Christ and a heart that longs to look like him!
Thanks for your consideration of joining me in this journey! I can't do it without you!

I Wish You Jesus! Scott Wesley Brown

story:
The Show

When it debuted in 2011, A Day In The Life played to sold-out houses and created an unprecedented buzz in the midcoast summer scene. 

That's why we're thrilled to announce that we are taking the show on the road in 2016.  This newly-cast production features some of New England’s finest musicians, which makes A Day in the Life: A Beatles Experience the ONLY complete Beatles retrospective on the East Coast comprised entirely of Beatle-aged performers.

Utilizing newly-acquired replica instruments, including Paul McCartney’s iconic Hofner bass, George Harrison’s legendary Gretsch workhorse and painted Rocky Stratocaster, John Lennon’s classic Gibson acoustic and Epiphone Casino, and Ringo’s Starr’s pearl-finish drum set, the five-person cast recreate over thirty Beatles classics completely live. Three video screens showing vintage multimedia, coupled with five costume changes comprised of stitch-for-stitch authentic pieces create an awe-inspiring homage to pop music’s most influential band.

Featuring classics like...

I Want To Hold Your Hand • Twist and Shout • Yesterday •

Sgt. Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band • I Am the Walrus

• She Loves You • Come Together • Let It Be

and many more!


The Team

Musicians, theater professionals and volunteers from throughout New England are coming together to revive a show that captivated audiences when it debuted in 2011. A diverse cast and creative team have come together to not only bring the show back to where it premiered — Camden, Maine — but go on tour to several cities in New England. 

To do this, we need to raise a few thousand dollars to help off-set the cost of traveling with our cast, sets, equipment, instruments and (many, many, many) costumes.

Cast...
Ira Kramer - rhythm guitar
Morgan Cates - bass
Josh Kovach - lead guitar
Andrew Carlson - drums
Colin Graebert - keyboard

We are dedicated to fairly compensating our extraordinary creative team; all of which are experienced working artists who have brought our performance up to a purely professional level. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $3,000 to make this possible. If you're in to help us get there, we'll make sure to thank you with great offers including: tickets to the shows, merch, special backstage passes and more.

story:
UPDATE: Hello wonderful people, So I know it’s been a super long time since my last update, and I’m deeply sorry but It’s only because I’ve been working non-stop and making you proud. 

Now, It would be rather easy for me to just say everything’s in order and things are off to a flying start. But since so many of you wonderful souls have so graciously invested in me, I’ve decided to document this process every step of the way. Partly for posterity, but mostly to serve as evidence.This series is being shot by the ever-so-awesome and talented photographer Ekta Saran, who is obviously on something, as she has agreed to spend copious amounts of hours with Reiner and I in our tiny little studio. But, worry not. We plan on feeding her from time to time.

Committing all these moments to film, memory card rather, has given this album a whole new dimension. This is the first of a series of webisodes documenting the making of the album.Through this series you’ll see recording sessions with some amazing sessionists, choir recordings, collaborations with visual artists making the album artwork, teasers of the songs on the album, an indepth look into the production of the album and loads of studio footage with goof ups, one-take successes and the occasional heated arguement in pajamas.

So I hope you’ll stay with me and send me your comments through it all.

Webisode 1:Shot by Ekta Saran. www.ektasaran.com Edited by Gayathri, Music from ‘Our Little Thing’ on the upcoming album, Produced by Reiner Erlings.

WATCH: Making of - Part 1: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HUTBLqbLGlk&...    

 

Hi I'm Gayathri and I need your support to independently release my debut album this winter. 

Many of you have my last single & EP, and I'm super excited to report that I'm in the pre-production stages of my first full-length album. This is a major step for me, as I believe this album will not only define my voice as an artist but will be an ode to all the moments and people that inspire me to write songs. Over the last year, I have written songs that I'm proud of and that I believe represent a cohesive body of work. They've taken a lot out of me (in a great way), and I'm looking forward to sharing them with you. But to get them from my mouth to your ears, I need your help! 

I will be acting as my own record label, and there's thousands of dollars/pounds/rupees worth of costs associated with recording, producing, packaging and promoting this album. It helps that I have so much faith in the musicians I'll be working with, because I know in my heart, that we will create something that you will be proud to be a part of.  I will be recording parts of the album in the UK & India - working with a diverse array of amazing musicians. It's a huge dream for me to work with an orchestra on this album as a lot of the music has lush orchestral layers. Everything is ready to go: the songs, the musicians, the studio set ups. All I need is a little help from you! 

Every dollar will go towards the album: paying the musicians, renting gear, turning my music into orchestral scores, reserving studios, mixing & mastering  the album, my artwork team and of course packaging and printing of the album. And if by some miracle there's anything left over, the money will go towards promoting the album.

After investing everything I have and possibly could, I'm still falling short. So I've thoroughly done the math, and I figured that $20,000 would put me in a great position to get things moving and help me begin this journey, I'm dying to start. And I want YOU to come along. I've cooked up numerous fun perks corresponding with the amount of money you decide to pledge (The List is on the right). Perks include everything from getting the album way in advance to being credited on the album as a musician, specially thanked in the liner notes to getting executive producer credit. It's Goodies Galore and with an awesome team of designers on board, we're also creating some gorgeous personalized artwork/posters and t-shirts just for you. 

I will post regular updates, and a confirmed release date within this 30 day period. Please drop me a line about any queries you may have and I will be more than happy to clear things up for you. 

I am eternally grateful for any support from your end, even if it means sharing this with someone who is in a better position to donate. Pledges start as low as 10$ and every dollar counts. I humbly, sincerely, earnestly ask you to help me realize this dream. 

Thanks for your support & Happy Pledging! 

To hear my music and know more about me visit: gayathrimusic.com

story:
Hi,

I'm Naomi Psalm a singer/songwriter from Florida and living in Boise, Idaho...I used to ride a unicycle and I used to drive a bright pink '67 VW bug. That may be all you need to know about me.

.....I'm a girl who has had a passion for music since age 8. I feel things deeply, and I go crazy if I am not creating whether it be music or art. I am continuously driven to keep performing and making music largely because of YOU! For the people that smile when they hear it, for the kids that tug at their dad's shirts to stop and hear the music. For the joy it brings, for the thoughts it provokes, for the days it enhances.

I am hitting the studio early Sept., 2012 to record some new songs. This will be my 5th project, and I can't wait to share it with you!

I cannot begin to explain how much your support would mean to me...even if it is a small amount...even if you cannot help financially, but in the way of making some noise about this campaign.  Sharing this with your friends will be a huge help!

If my goal of $3,200 is not reached, I will still finish the project though I may have to push the date back.

The video INK that you see is a song off of my previous CD, and it is about my brother who passed away. I hope to make a campaign video soon!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

I’m Bill Bryson and I volunteer at Grow Radio, a volunteer-run, non-profit, community internet radio station broadcasting live from downtown Gainesville, FL.
I got my start in radio in college at WXYC in Chapel Hill, NC. After running a live music club in Gainesville for years without radio support for independent bands, I decided to start a radio station that would play anything that current FM stations in our area don’t play, with an emphasis on a deep interest in a variety of music, providing diverse content, with dedicated community members making community-driven content.

After spending time in communities with high quality, alternative, community radio it’s apparent what a valuable cultural niche such a station fills in a community. Grow Radio was established to fill that niche in Gainesville.

Your contributions will enable Grow Radio to expand our programming assortment by providing much needed resources to purchase equipment, expand our community outreach, and continue to provide the great, locally-generated content that enriches our community and culture.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding needs are significant as we have established this station from the ground up. With generous material and financial donations to get things started we have come this far, but to continue to grow our operation we have further material needs. These needs include funds to purchase otherwise unattainable music for our music library. We also need equipment to enable volunteers to create new programming including two video cameras, a field recorder, a mixing board, microphones, stands, cables, software, a MacBook laptop, and headphones. Funds will also be used to upgrade studio equipment. The contributions will enable Grow Radio to expand programming variety and quality immediately. Volunteers will have the opportunity to attain new skills, producing vibrant shows and features

Our rewards have been organized to showcase Gainesville, our creative artists, artisans and businesses in the community. Many are one-of-a-kind items produced specifically for this campaign. By supporting Grow Radio in this campaign you are getting a piece of Gainesville as well as ensuring the ongoing and expanding programming of Grow Radio.

Rewards can be viewed on our blog at: http://growradio.wordpress.com/2013/09/23/indie...

The Impact

The station benefits the community on several levels. It is both educational and informational. It provides the new music that informed listeners demand. Local music is highly valued and given significant airtime and, in doing so, we provide a vital component in a thriving local music culture.  Grow Radio offers an unconventional platform for community members to get directly involved in local media. Volunteers are comprised of students and faculty from the University of Florida and Santa Fe Community College as well as non-affiliated music lovers in the community. Live radio offers the DJs an opportunity to connect directly to their listening audience, with a variety of personality and color, ultimately celebrating the diversity of our community. Listeners tired of the dominant commercialized generic programming of contemporary FM radio crave the connection available in Grow Radio’s live DJ broadcast. It’s a more personal listening experience, without commercials, that nurtures the unexpected, keeping things fresh and the listeners on their toes. There’s no substitute for a live DJ playing music they are passionate about for a receptive audience. It’s something that can’t be standardized, computed and replicated. It’s something that has all but disappeared from the contemporary FM listening experience outside of traditional college radio. The difference is immediate and welcome and we believe the experience of live radio to be invaluable.

Grow Radio volunteers experience an environment that is ripe for exploration, discovery and sharing. Consequently it fosters new ideas, new connections, and ultimately new rewards for the listening community. By helping Grow Radio in this campaign you are contributing to the overall cultural health of the community. The arts are not merely a luxury item in society. They are the lifeblood of creativity, problem-solving and benefit a community in essential ways.

Internet radio is getting easier and easier to use. We have an iPhone app for Grow Radio. Great internet radio apps like TuneIn.com also enable easy listening. There are also several advantages to internet radio otherwise unavailable with FM. The listener is not bound by a time schedule for programming on Grow Radio. Podcasts are available for every show and thus are available at any convenient time for the listener. Video content can be incorporated through various web platforms, providing the opportunity to provide additional unique content. We can also enhance connection to Gainesville from afar. Internet availability provides listeners the opportunity to maintain connection to the radio station and consequently, to the town.

FM is currently the dominant media, but internet radio is the future. With Grow Radio we put Gainesville first. Our focus and identity is local-352, GNV, swampy, north Florida local. We play for a local audience, but the internet offers global accessibility.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, there are other things you can do to help Grow Radio in this campaign.

We accept donations of material goods including CD players, turntables, computers, LP/CD collections, and other audio/broadcast equipment. Grow Radio is a 501 (c) (3) organization and your donation may qualify for a tax deduction.

If you have items you'd like to donate you can contact us at Bill@growradio.org

Please help spread the word about our campaign.

You can use the great share tools provided by Indie Go Go.

story:
John built a Little Free Library in front of his home, to share books for all to enjoy. After he passed away, neighbors came together to add a bench as a memorial to his hard work and caring spirit. 

Earlier this week, the bench was stolen. 

Please help us raise funds to replace his bench. 

The new bench will be secured to concrete, and any leftover funds will be donated to the Sacramento Public Library Foundation and Front Street Animal Shelter in his name.

story:
Never stand still

 My name is Katja Rieckermann and here is a little information about myself..

I am a professional saxophonist who has been performing with Rod Stewart for the past 13 years.  Having never played an instrument before, I picked up the saxophone when I was 21, and from the very first note, I knew that I wanted to become a professional sax player. Of course, everybody around me thought I was crazy since I knew absolutely nothing about music. But being the German that I am, I put all my energy into it.  Practicing every free minute I had, within just a couple of years I was good enough to make a living as a musician. In 1997, I moved to Los Angeles.  4 years later I got a phone call that changed my life... an audition for Rod Stewart! I got the gig and have been so lucky to play in his band ever since.

I had always felt the need to write my own music.  In 2007, I released my first CD simply titled "Katja" which was produced by Jeff Carruthers. Mr. Stewart was gracious enough to promote my CD during the concert tour which helped it to become a great success.

One day a few years later, I came up with the title “Horn Star”, which I thought was a pretty good play on words.  That title required a bit more edge to the music, so I decided to make an electro-house album incorporating saxophone.  Produced by Sandi Strmljan  in Hamburg, this album was a lot of fun.


After finishing "Horn Star", I took a creative break and focused on live gigs. When I wasn’t touring with Mr. Stewart, I would preform with my own jazz quartet, or sit in on the many other projects I was involved with in the LA area. 2012 was particularly busy and touring last year took me all over the world.

We are on a break now for a couple of months and I thought to myself... "What to do with all this free time?"  So, I decided to make CD number 3.  I have started writing with my good friend, Grammy nominated producer Jeff Carruthers, who also produced my first CD "Katja". In the first 3 weeks of February we have already written 6 songs and have a lot more material we are working on right now. All originals.

 My goal is to record the best CD possible with some of the best musicians in the world in the best studios here in Los Angeles. I am very fortunate to know many famous musicians. Asking them to guest star, I can’t wait to have them play on my CD with me. This is where you come in. Your funding will help cover the costs of producing my CD including musicians, studio time, mixing, mastering, photos, cover design, CD manufacturing and possibly a video.

 While making this CD, I plan to keep you informed and up to date on the progress. We will continue to write music and then head into the studio sometime this summer. With production complete, I am looking forward to the release of my new album at the end of november!

 I am excited about this project!

Love,

Katja

was gracious enough to promote my CD during the concert tour which helped it to become a great success.One day a few years later, I came up with the title “Horn Star”, which I thought was a pretty good play on words.  That title required a bit more edge to the music, so I decided to make an electro-house
album incorporating saxophone.  Produced by Sandi Strmljan  in Hamburg, this album was a lot
of fun.After finishing "Horn Star", I took a creative break and focused on live gigs. When I wasn’t touring with Mr. Stewart, I would preform with my own jazz quartet, or sit in on the many other projects I was involved with in the LA
area. 2012 was particularly busy and touring last year took me all over the world.
We are on a break now for a couple of months and I thought
to myself... "What to do with all this free time?"  So, I decided to make CD number
3.  I have started writing with my good friend, Grammy nominated
producer Jeff Carruthers, who also produced my first CD "Katja". In the first 3
weeks of February we have already written 6 songs and have a lot more material we are
working on right now. All originals. 
 My goal is to record the best CD possible with some of
the best musicians in the world in the best studios here in Los Angeles. I am
very fortunate to know many famous musicians. Asking them to guest star, I can’t wait to have
them play on my CD with me. This is where you come in. Your funding will help
cover the costs of producing my CD including musicians, studio time, mixing,
mastering, photos, cover design, CD manufacturing and possibly a video. While making this CD, I plan to keep you informed and up to date on the progress. We will continue to write music and then head into the studio sometime this summer. With production complete, I am looking forward to the release of my new album at the end of november!
 I am excited about this project!Love,Katja

story:
Red in the Missile Room is a new album of themes and explorations for solo saxophone.  It is the first album to be released under my own name, after releasing recordings since the late 1990s with collaborative projects including Godzik Pink (5RC/Kill Rock Stars), Rats, and LA Fog.

A critical part of my vision for this album is to release it as a limited edition full length Vinyl LP, as well as a digital release.  Vinyl copies will include a digital download card.  The approach to recording was carefully conceived to capture a broad and colorful dynamic sound spectrum, in high fidelity, and it is my feeling that a vinyl listening experience will represent the album's fullest sonic potential.

The album has been recorded and mixed over the last year, together with my friend Ron Russell, without whom this project could not have been realized; it was through Ron's generosity and encouragement that a full album of unaccompanied saxophone performances developed, being recorded and mixed over a number of sessions.

Red in the Missile Room is comprised of twelve tracks, each of them performed by myself on tenor or soprano saxophone, recorded live and without overdubs.  The tracks vary in approach, from lyrical and angular melodies to 'sound based' multiphonic thematic improvisations.  The common thread is a grounding in the present moment, bringing together the experiences of performer and listener in an intimate way.  I feel like this album represents a largely unexplored part of my musical personality, as cultivated over the last couple of years, and I'm so excited to share it with you and others!

Now the album needs to be mastered and released in a way that best represents the spirit of the recordings, and for that I need your help!  To nicely master the recordings for digital and vinyl, cut the lacquers, and press the records I'll need to raise at least $3000 through this campaign.

That means if just 30 people give $100 each, this album will be made.  Any donation will help.  To further incentivize your contribution today I am offering these special perks:

Rewards

*$25 Donation- You will get a copy of the Vinyl LP w/ digital download card (includes US shipping or pickup at record release show).  You will also be listed as a funding contributor on the album’s liner notes!

*$100 Donation- above rewards PLUS personal saxophone performance ringtone for your phone.

*$250 Donation- above rewards PLUS custom Valentine’s Day saxophone melody, composed for yourself or a person of your choice.

Please watch the attached film that I’ve made for this campaign, featuring one of the pieces from the album.  If you are unable to contribute financially, please spread the word about my project to anyone you know who might be interested.  

I’m incredibly grateful for your support, thank you and looking forward to bringing you this music.  

Love,

Jonathan Silberman

story:
Wer ist JOVIAN SPIN?

Mit ihrem mitreißenenden Mix aus treibenden, elektronischen Sounds gepaart mit wuchtigen Gitarrenriffs und einem groovigen Drum & Bass-Fundamemnt sprengen JOVIAN SPIN Genregrenzen aus.

Ob Airplays bei Rockland Radio, Remixe für Van Canto oder als Toursupport für Samsas Traum und ASP - das Konzept geht auf.

Stilistisch bewegen sich JOVIAN SPIN dabei auf gewagtem Terrain wobei sie moderne, synthetische Sounds und Beats konsequent mit erdigen Elementen einer Rock-Formation mischen. 

  • Website: jovianspin.com 
  • Soundcloud: soundcloud.com
  • Facebook: facebook.com


Was ist geplant?

Wir möchten mit dieser Kampagne versuchen, die bevorstehenden Kosten für die Produktion unseres neuen Albums "Angstladen" zu einem Teil zu finanzieren. Das Album wird 12 Tracks (oder mehr?) im typischen JOVIAN SPIN-Sound beinhalten und ebenfalls bekannte Gastmusiker featuren. Wir werden weitere Infos dazu im Verlauf der Kampagne bekannt geben. Wie viele wissen, ist es nur mit Aufnahmen im Studio leider nicht getan. 

Folgende Punkte sind für eine erfolgreiche CD-Veröffentlichung wichtig:

  • Studiozeit
  • Design (Album-Layout, Website, Werbe-Layout, Merch)
  • Merch (T-Shirts etc.)
  • Promotion (Werbung, Anschreiben, Druck, Post, Telefon etc.)
  • Pressung 
  • Distribution (Vertrieb von Tonträgern & Musik)
All das verschlingt nicht nur Unmengen an Zeit sondern auch Geld. Da bei uns, wie bei vielen anderen Bands natürlich auch, keine Plattenfirma und Agentur diese Kosten und Arbeiten übernimmt, stellt sich hier für uns immer die Frage: wie finanzieren wir das? 

Dank Crowfunding-Plattformen möchten wir nun versuchen, einen Teil (das angestrebte Ziel von 500,00€ ist wirklich minimal) hier mit zu finanzieren. 

Release ist für das Frühjahr 2015 geplant.


    Und was bekomme ich?

    Das Wichtigste sind und bleiben Fans und Unterstützer! Und das seid ihr. 

    Es entsteht eigentlich eine Win-Win-Situation, da jeder Unterstützer und Fan mit einem ausgewählten "Perk" etwas von Wert erwirbt. Natürlich freuen wir uns auch über "Spenden" die hier nach der Wahl eines "Perks" noch gegeben werden können. 

    Folgende "Perks" möchten wir euch anbieten:

    • "Angstladen" Digital Version
    • "Angstladen" CD Version
    • "Angstladen" T-Shirt
    • "Angstladen" signed CD Version
    • "Angstladen" CD + Lyric Sheet (12x)
    • "Angstladen" CD + signed Photo (20x)
    • "Angstladen" Fan Bundle  (CD & Shirt)
    • "Angstladen" signed Fan Bundle (signed CD & Shirt)
    • JOVIAN SPIN - unplugged (3x)
    • JOVIAN SPIN - full concert (3x)


      Danke für Deine Unterstützung!

      Natürlich ist es schwierig, sein eigenes Geld in etwas zu stecken das noch nicht fertig bzw. visuell greifbar ist. Sollte das angestrebte Ziel nicht erreicht werden, bekommt ihr von indiegogo.com euer Geld wieder zurück überwiesen. Aber wir möchten euch versichern, dass dieses Album einfach verdammt genial wird und wir euch nicht enttäuschen werden. 

      Als Dank an jeden Unterstützer dieser Kampagne werden wir ebenfalls jeden Namen im Booklet des neuen Albums abdrucken lassen. Natürlich nur auf eure Erlaubnis hin. Egal was kommt: wir danken Dir! 

      JOVIAN SPIN
