story:
Brief intro of who we are

Joy and I are the founders, managers, and two of the members of the Glass City Swing Band. A nostalgic 18-piece group playing swing music of the 1930's and 40's.

 Now in our sixth year, the GCSB has grown in it's personnel and proficiency of the Swing style and is in demand at local festivals and events. The GCSB takes it's name from Jeannette, PA which was known for its many glass factories during the swing era and was known as "Glass City PA."

Managing an 18-piece swing band takes a lot of energy, teamwork, and funding. We've got the energy and the teamwork, but being on a fixed income due to our disability - we are lacking funding.

Joy and I have Limb Girdle Muscular Dystrophy. LGMD is a disease that slowly weakens the limb muscles as well as some of the vital organs such as the heart and lungs. We may not be able to walk, but that hasn't stopped us. We've both earned performance degrees in music from Seton Hill College in 1989. And we've spent all our adult life playing in musicals, teaching music lessons and participating in musical ensembles. Glass City Swing Band is our most exciting challenge to date.

Due to our disability employment opportunities are limited, so, obtaining funding for the band has become quite challenging. Our dream for Glass City Swing Band is to help preserve swing music but at the same time contribute our time and talent to encourage others with disabilities to pursue their dreams. So, it is our hope to get support from you, the music lover and benefactor.

The funding that we seek would be utilized to purchase musical scores for the band, rent sound equipment for live performances, compensate band members for their time and talent, produce a CD recording for promotional use, purchase larger instruments such as a keyboard and a baritone saxophone, and purchase marketing material.

We also intend to use our talents and time to play for charitable organizations in surrounding communities to help raise money for great causes like promoting the arts in schools and the Muscular Dystrophy Association. Your funding will help make this possible.

So, join us to help keep swing music alive - all while supporting causes that are close to our hearts.

Thank you in advance for your support.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding that we seek, $44,000 for this campaign, would be utilized for the items listed below:

  •  The purchasing of musical scores for the band - $2650 (yearly). The breakdown for the musical scores would be as follows: 10 arrangements written by arrangers at $200 per arrangement would be a total of $2,000.  Ten published arrangements at $50 - $75 per arrangement.  Averaging a total of $65 per arrangement, the total would be $650 for already published arrangements.
  • The renting of sound equipment for live performances - $9,000 (yearly). The breakdown of the renting of sound equipment would be as follows: 18 gigs per year at $400 - $500 per gig. Taking the higher total of $500 per gig would give you a total of $9,000 per year for the renting of sound equipment. The renting of sound equipment would consist of a qualified sound technician bringing their equipment to each gig, coming and setting up all the sound equipment, mixing the band, and tearing down for each gig.
  • Compensating band members for their time and talent - $10,800 (yearly). The breakdown of compensating our musicians for charitable gigs would be as follows: 6 charitable gigs per year at $100 per band member. There are 18 members in the band so the total for each gig would be $1,800 bringing the yearly total to $10,800
  • The production of a CD recording for promotional use - $4,000 (one time). The breakdown for a CD recording would be as follows: 100 Digipaks plus tax is a total of $260.02. 100 blank CD's and Memorex CD labels plus tax is a total of $56.18. Mechanical licensing of 16 songs 5 minutes and under for 100 CDs plus tax is a total of $357.86. 32 hours in a recording studio with mixing, plus  mastering and plus tax is a total of $2,501.60. Bringing the grand total to $3,175.66. Leaving the total at $4,000 because it is unknown if we would need more hours in the studio.
  • The purchasing of a Keyboard, case, bench, cables, volume pedal and stand - $777.70 (one time). The breakdown on the cost of the piano package would be as follows: 2 15-foot cables at $24.80, Keyboard bench at $33.31, Sustain pedal at $20.51, Keyboard stand at $42.19, replacement plan at $4.99 Yamaha P105 piano keyboard at $504.19, and a keyboard case at $97.74. Taxes at $49.97 bring the piano package total to $777.70
  • The purchasing of a professional Baritone Saxophone, mouthpiece, bari sax stand, and gig bag - $9,474.55 (one time). The breakdown of the baritone package is as follows: Yamaha YBS-62 Professional Baritone Saxophone $8,345.99, Meyer baritone saxophone mouthpiece $200, Hercules baritone saxophone stand $38.74, Protec Contoured baritone saxophone Pro Pac case $269.99.. Taxes would be $619.83 making the total baritone saxophone package at $9,474.55.
  • White polo shirts with the GCSB logo for Summer gigs - $370 (one time). The pricing per polo shirt would be $19.00. Tax would be $20.52 bring the total to $362.52 for 18 polo shirts.  Averaging out to $370 for bigger sizes.
  • Signage for promoting the band's image and for publicity - $250 (one time). The breakdown for the signage is as follows: 5 band fronts with the GCSB logo on the front at $30 per piece for a total of $150. A banner with sponsor names and/or logos on it at about $85. The tax would be $14.10 for a total of $249.10. Averaging that out would bring the total to $250.
  • Incentives and shipping the incentives for this campaign - $1650 (one time). All incentives breakdown as follows: T-Shirts (60) is a total of $992.82. This includes shipping and tax but not international shipping fees. CD (60) are $232.20. This includes shipping and packaging to ship. This does not include international shipping fees. One iPad mini is a total of $331.93. This includes tax and shipping but not international shipping fees. Bumper sticker (30) is a total of $90.50. This includes tax and shipping but not international shipping fees. The grand total would be $1,647.45. Averaging it out to $1,650.
  • Indiegogo and credit card fees - $4677 (one time). If all funding for this campaign is made then it will be at a lower funding but not knowing how the flexible funding for this campaign will come out, there is a 12% fee added on to the campaign fund to cover the costs of Indiegogo's fees.

Perks are as follows (see actual perk for complete details of each perk):

  • $5 - A personal thank you for your contribution via our Facebook page.
  • $10 - GCSB Bumper Sticker (30)
  • $25 - GCSB CD Recording (25) 
  • $50 - GCSB T-Shirt (25)
  • $100 - Name/Logo on Banner
  • $200 - $100 perk + iPad mini (1)
  • $250 - Name/Logo on Banner + Mention
  • $500 - $250 perk + GCSB CD + GCSB T-Shirt (25)
  • $2,000 - $250 perk + Concert by GCSB
  • $4,000 - $500 perk + Concert by GCSB (5)
  • $5,000 - $500 perk + Sing with GCSB (2)
  • $5,000 - $500 perk + Master of Ceremonies for the evening (2)
How funds will be distributed if campaign goal is not met
Items in order of importance:

1. Pay for and distribute perks - $5,745

  • T-Shirts
  • Bumper Stickers
  • iPad mini
  • Banner
  • CD recording to be made

After all perks are paid for and distributed, all other items will be addressed.

2. Purchase music, rent sound equipment, compensate band members and marketing material

  • The purchase of music, rent sound equipment, and compensate band members totals would be adjusted accordingly. The total of charitable gigs would be adjusted to meet the campaign funds that are left after perks are taken out.
  • Signage for the band would be added into the monies left.

The keyboard and baritone saxophone would not be added if the goal for this campaign was not met. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you feel a need to help in this project but cannot contribute funding. That's okay, you can still help by getting the word out to all your friends and family!

Indiegogo has a great website that has share tools for you so that it makes it easier to get the word out to people.

How to use Indiegogo share tools:

Indiegogo provides each campaign with a set of Share Tools to help you spread the word about. The Share Tools can be used by the Campaign Owner as well as Contributors and they are located in the box below the campaign's Pitch image or video.

  • Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks
  • Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
  • Send a direct email from Indiegogo

$25 - GCSB CD Recording (25) 
$50 - GCSB T-Shirt (25)
$100 - Name/Logo on Banner
$200 - $100 perk + iPad mini (1)
$250 - Name/Logo on Banner + Mention
$500 - $250 perk + GCSB CD + GCSB T-Shirt (25)
$2,000 - $250 perk + Concert by GCSB
$4,000 - $500 perk + Concert by GCSB (5)
$5,000 - $500 perk + Sing with GCSB (2)
$5,000 - $500 perk + Master of Ceremonies for the evening (2)



How funds will be distributed if campaign goal is not met
Items in order of importance:1. Pay for and distribute perks - $5,745
T-Shirts
Bumper Stickers
iPad mini
Banner
CD recording to be made
After all perks are paid for and distributed, all other items will be addressed.2. Purchase music, rent sound equipment, compensate band members and marketing material
The purchase of music, rent sound equipment, and compensate band members totals would be adjusted accordingly. The total of charitable gigs would be adjusted to meet the campaign funds that are left after perks are taken out.
Signage for the band would be added into the monies left.
The keyboard and baritone saxophone would not be added if the goal for this campaign was not met. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Maybe you feel a need to help in this project but cannot contribute funding. That's okay, you can still help by getting the word out to all your friends and family! 
Indiegogo has a great website that has share tools for you so that it makes it easier to get the word out to people. How to use Indiegogo share tools:Indiegogo provides each campaign with a set of Share Tools to help you spread the word about. The Share Tools can be used by the Campaign Owner as well as Contributors and they are located in the box below the campaign's Pitch image or video. 
Copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update
Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks 
Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code. 
Send a direct email from Indiegogo

story:
Notre histoire en 10 lignes :

  • À sept membres, nous formons un groupe à la musique parfois folk, parfois progressive, parfois classique avec, entre autres, violoncelle, mandoline, ukulele, banjo, accordéon, contrebasse, piano et une dizaine d'autres instruments...
  • Ça ressemble à ça :
  • Nous nous sommes fait connaître par le bouche à oreille, les réseaux sociaux et des folies comme celle-ci :

  • Après quelques mois, nous étions sur scène à plus de 200 reprises et nos spectacles ressemblent désormais à ça :

  • Nous sommes indépendants. Pas de gérant. Pas d'agent. Pas de maison de disques. Pas de distributeur d'albums. Pas de relation de presse. Rien.
  • Notre premier album (Good morning, Motherland. - 2012) a connu un certain succès, mais nous voulons surprendre avec notre deuxième (à paraître en 2015), aller plus loin et prendre les actions nécessaires pour poursuivre notre cheminement atypique quant à notre "carrière".
  • Nous désirons véritablement s'offrir une production ($$$) d'album et de spectacle à la hauteur de nos attentes et de celles du public.
  • Nous évaluons nos coûts d'auto-production du nouvel album et du nouveau spectacle à plus de 50,000$.
  • Nous n'avons aucune aide financière, aucun investisseur pour le moment.
  • Nous désirons rester maîtres à bord et rester propriétaires de nos albums et spectacles.
  • Nous voulons inviter notre public à agir comme complice dans ce plan d'indépendance et à contribuer pour la somme de 10,000$.

Nos principaux coûts de production  :

  • 15,000$ - L'enregistrement, "mixing" et "mastering" de l'album
  • 4,000$ - Location d'équipement, d'instruments (ex. piano à queue) et de lieux d'enregistrement originaux
  • 13,000$ - Les frais de duplication et d'auto-distribution de l'album
  • 10,000$ - Les frais de relation de presse et de publicité assumées par le groupe
  • 5,000$ - Création des décors de scène
  • 10,000$ - Réalisation de deux (2) vidéoclips

TOTAL APPROXIMATIF : 57,000$

AIDE DEMANDÉE AU PUBLIC : 10,000$


Comment contribuer  :

Notre but n'étant pas de demander la charité, nous mettons donc en vente des "privilèges" qui ne se vendent pas habituellement. C'est du donnant-donnant.

Quelques exemples d'achats que vous pouvez faire pour contribuer à l'essor de Bears of Legend :

  • Des concerts à domicile
  • Des participations à l'enregistrement de l'album
  • Des billets VIP pour 1 an
  • Des visites en studio pendant l'enregistrement de l'album
  • Des cours de violoncelle avec Christelle
  • Des cours de piano avec Claudine
  • Des billets pour un party privé avec le band + écoute en primeur de l'album
  • Des posters ou cartes postales autographiées
  • Les bannières du premier spectacle
  • et bien plus...
Regardez dans la section "contreparties". Tout est là !

L'impact de votre contribution :

Votre contribution agira comme un tournant majeur dans la production de notre nouvel album et de notre nouveau spectacle.

Chaque dollar amassé servira à augmenter les folies sur le nouvel album et à nous permettre d'aller bien au-delà de ce que nous aurions pu faire sans votre aide.

Nous pourrons, enfin, aspirer à créer un album de grande qualité et à un spectacle à la mesure de nos aspirations.


D'autres façons d'aider :

  • Partager la page sur laquelle vous êtes présentement
  • En parler aux gens que vous croyez intéressés par une telle folie
  • Continuer de nous suivre sur notre page Facebook

story:
Zippered Hoodies Just Added!

PLEASE NOTE: All Hoodies and other merchandise will be available for pickup the day of the show. We will email you when the Kickstarter is finished at your Paypal Contact Email address to obtain your size from you.

Who we are...

We are the Collinsville All-Stars, a ghetto-tech industrial horrorcore hip-hop group known for offensive music and over the top live performances that are typically remembered as legendary parties. Over the last 12 years we have played a plethora of shows, met lots of great people and produced several terrible demo recordings of questionable quality.

What it is...

Up until now, no one has had the opportunity to obtain a worthwhile recording of Collinsville All-Stars material, or see it live ever again... Now you have the power to change that.

Why dat crowdfunding doe?

Creating a worthwhile recording and/or a live show on caliber with what we have presented in the past - is a costly effort. Since we would love to be able to do both, (before we're all way too fucking old) we have created this crowdfunding effort in an attempt to let anyone who wants to see it happen again, one last time, pitch in to make it a reality. It would be pointless to dive back into the effort if no one wanted to see it happen, so we are allowing fans to throw down on it ahead of time, so as to judge the appeal of a reunion and gauge the possibility of this actually occurring.

How does this ish work?

Your donation allows you to choose one of the different levels of perks provided on the page to the right. We have set a realistic goal for the cost of throwing what will hopefully be the most incredibly epic Collinsville All-Stars show ever, and recording / creating an album.

Break down where my money goes, son.

We are not going to spend time nickel and diming with pie chart economics and whatnot, as this crowdfunding will cover MOST of the cost of achieving these goals. In reality money will probably still come out of our pockets to make it happen one way or another.

What do I get for donating?

The lowest level actual donations (read: at least $12) get both a ticket to a future live show sometime in 2015 at a yet to be determined venue in the St. Louis area, AND a copy of the new recordings; as well as their name in the liner notes as a donator. Higher level donations can obtain all kinds of extra goodies as indicated in the perks section located to the right. All Hoodies and other merchandise will be available for pickup the day of the show. We will email you when the Kickstarter is finished at your Paypal Contact Email address to obtain your size from you.

Up and Coming Baller Perk Level Hoodie:

Why should I do this?

If you want to come party with us one last time, and have a chance to actually have a Collinsville All-Stars recording, you should donate to the cause. The donation is far cheaper than a night out at the local bar, or seeing that shitty national band you like that just stands there doing nothing for 30 minutes.

I only have an affiliation with "X" member of your group.. Will they be included in this event/album?

Yes. Rob, Brian, Kurt, Twee, Adrian and Pat will all be featured on the album/live show.

    What are the details on this album?

    The goal is to put out a digital equivalent of a "double disc" mixtape, one disc including including all the old material, (Songs like 618, Armadillos on Fire, etc) re-recorded and re-engineered to sound listenable; The other disc containing a plethora of new material. It will only be obtainable by funding through this crowdfunding opportunity. ALL Donors will receive a download key to obtain this album when it is released.

      What are the details on this live show?

      The show will take place sometime this year in 2015, after the album is finished being created and ready to be released. There is not yet a specified date or venue for this to occur. ALL Donors will receive a single ticket to the event and advanced notice when these details are confirmed so that they will be able to arrange attendance. Depending on the response to this campaign, it is possible the show could sell out (based on the chosen venue and amount of tickets sold through this crowdfunding campaign.)

      What is the risk of me donating?

      • If the complete goal IS NOT met, all money is returned to donors.
      • If the complete goal IS met, shit's gonna go down, yo.
      • If the complete goal is exceeded, it's seriously going to be one hell of a show.

story:
Short Summary


Syd Perry has played in the West Coast as well as the East Coast and will now go coast-to-coast across Canada.

In the past tours, Irie-Ites Promo Tour (2013) and Catch Me If You Can (Summer 2014 Tour), I covered all my own transportation, accommodations and food expenses.

Both tours however, lasted merely 4-6 weeks. 

The Reggae Traveler 2015 Tour is going to be by far the largest tour, we have ever done, going coast-to-coast from Ontario to the Maritimes, to the West Coast and back through the Prairies.

Before Mawe and I can do this, we need your help!

We will be touring 9 provinces and 26 cities. 

We will be on the road for 19 weeks (May 1st – Sept. 13th).

Along the way, we will be performing at venues, radio stations and record stores.

Syd Perry Single on Soundcloud | Stereotype Live @ CKDU Halifax


Where is The Funding Going? 

Here is a list of our expenses and the costs...


Transportation - $2,976.36 
Along the way we will be taking 12 Greyhound buses, 7 Maritime buses, 1 flight, 2 ferriesand, 1 Island Link bus. The flight, as pricey as it may be, (Approx. $555.00/each), will play a crucial role in making this tour as excellent as possible. The flight will allow us to be in both Halifax and Vancouver for the peak of, not only festival season, but also the summer in general (month of July).

Accommodations - $2,160.00 
Along the tour we will be staying with close friends whenever possible to cut back on accommodations. As for the stops where we don’t know anyone we will be staying in hostels, to insure we spend as little on accommodations as possible. As it stands right now we have places to stay in 13 out of the 26 stops.However, if anyone can offer us coverage in any of the cities listed below, that would be a much-appreciated contribution Edmundston, Fredericton, St. John, Moncton, Charlottetown, Naniamo, Victoria, Chilliwack, Kelowna, Edmonton, Saskatoon, Regina & Winnipeg.

Food – $2,660.00
We will be on a budget of $10/day each for food, which will amount to a total of $140.00 ($70.00 each) per week…for 19 weeks; the grand total for food expenses will be $2,660.00.
We will be getting 90% of our food from grocery stores to make sure we don’t exceed our food budget. As Rastafarians we also don’t eat meat, fast food or junk food.All expenses included for both persons, will come to a final grand total of - $7,620.36


The Tour Impact

Reggae music has had a tremendous impact on the world. The message of the music has brought people, of all corners of the earth, together in love and harmony for generations and generations to come. 

Blues music for nearly a century has been the outlet to those who were otherwise unable to voice their hardships and bloodshed. Blues music is the songs of the oppressed…. The sound of the slaves… A perfect fit for Reggae.

Through our signature Roots Blues Reggae sound we not only cater to Reggae lovers but Blues listeners and singer-songwriter fans as well. Bringing patrons to a Reggae concert who may normally may not have attended a show of that genre otherwise. 


Risks & Challenges

The First challenge will be making the amount of money we need to cover our transportation and accommodations costs. If we fail to meet this goal, we will be forced to either find other means of transportation (hitchhiking) as well as not staying in any hostels (tents), and/or we would have to reduce the length of the tour – which would be devastation. 

Lack of transportation funds will likely also make us late for making stops in time.

By being on the road for nearly 5 months our faith and dedication will be put to the test. Expenses aside, we will be performing and traveling relentlessly, with few breaks.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help without donating!
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean YOU can’t help.
Share the campaign in any way you can!
Spread the word about the Reggae Traveler 2015 Tour as it comes to your city!
Come out to the show in your city and bring your people!


May 2015

Toronto - May 1st - 6th

Oshawa - May 7th  

Kingston - May 8th

OttawaMay - 9th - 14th

Montreal - May 15th - 26th

Quebec City - May 27th - 30th


June 2015

Edmundston - May 31st - June 2nd

Fredericton - June 3rd - 5th

St. John - June 6th - 11th

Moncton - June 12th - 17th

Charlottetown - June 18th - 28th


July 2015

Halifax - June 29th - July 9th

Antigonish -  July 11th - 13th

Vancouver - July 14th - July 23rd

Surrey - July 24th

North Vancouver - July 25th & 26th

Nanaimo - July 28th & 29th


August 2015

Victoria - July 30th - Aug 3rd

Chilliwack - Aug. 4th - Aug 7th

Kelowna - Aug. 8th & 9th  

Calgary - Aug. 11th - 18th

Red Deer - Aug. 19th

Edmonton - Aug. 20th - 31st


September 2015

Saskatoon - Sept. 1st – 4th

Regina - Sept. 5th - 9th

Winnipeg - Sept. 10th - 13th

Again, if anyone can offer us coverage/accomodations in any of the cities listed below, that would be a HUGE contribution!
 

Edmundston, Fredericton, St. John, Moncton, Charlottetown, Naniamo,Victoria, Chilliwack, Kelowna, Edmonton, Saskatoon, Regina & Winnipeg.

Respect to the Fullest!

story:
Help Me Record A Full Length Album In 2012!

(please note all figures on this site are in US Dollars)

"Strahan; of Gaelic origin; meaning – Poet, Minstrel, Sage.

Strahan is a folk / gospel artist from Auckland New Zealand with a unique songwriting style and a lot of passion. In 2011 he released his debut EP Water & Fire which has been described as “spiritually uplifting” (Challenge Weekly) and “a beautiful offering … from a passionate faith” (Salvation Army; Firezone). His songs describe journeying with God through the many stages of faith with a deep sense of hope enveloping it all.

Water & Fire was a success with its first single “Heaven” reaching the top ten on LifeFM and now getting airplay on Australia’s HopeFM. The EP has been downloaded in over 20 countries and sold out at the Parachute Music Festival in five minutes.

After playing the LifeFM Summer Tour earlier this year and to a packed out show at Parachute Festival Strahan has been working hard writing an album, which is due to be released later in 2012."

Hey Guys,

Last June I released my debut EP Water & Fire as an independant artist not really knowing what would come of it. Well, the EP went global being downloaded in over 20 countries in the first number of months, hitting the airwaves in NZ and OZ and giving me opportunities to play shows and preach around the country.

It's been an incredible adventure with a whole bunch of new opportunities opening up for me later this year including a few shows in Australia before Christmas.

I've been writing new tracks this year and have 14 (none from the first EP) to hit the studio with which will be culled down to 11 or 12 for the album. I'll be recording with legendary NZ producer Nic Manders who gets the style and heart behind what I'm trying to do which is so important.

The songs are written and the plan is set but in order to make it happen I need your help.

I need to raise $20,000 to record, master and produce the album (figures on this page are in $US). 

I'd love you to be a part of this exciting journey with me by pre-purchasing the album or purchasing one of the perks to your right. Every dollar counts and so does every person you share this with.

I'll be hitting the studio's as soon as I've raised the money and releasing the album before Christmas if all goes to plan.

Thanks for all your support to this point and into the future. 

Much love,
Strahan. 

PLEASE NOTE: All the figures to the right of the page are in $US, I've kept the figures simple to avoid conversion issues upon payment.

To Fund This Album:

800 people giving $25
400 people giving $50
300 people giving $60
200 people giving $100
100 people giving $200 

FAQ's

Wheres the money going exactly?

The money raised through this campaign will fully fund the production of my first full-length album which will go out to over 20 countries and be gigged around the world. Funding the album this way gives me the opportunity to play the music wherever God leads me, not according to the largest pay cheque.

I need $18,000 to do this, which will go to studio time, producing, equipment, and the actual physical album production. It covers it all from the recording process through to getting the CD's printed and the artwork designed.

What do you get?
Some sweet sounds I hope! At the least you'll get pre-released music. At the most the opportunity to have me play a private concert at your house. But ultimately that sweet feeling that you helped me get more music out there!

And if I don't reach the goal?
If I don't reach the goal, funds will go into a secure account and will be untouched while I find other ways to fundraise.

What's the point?
I truly believe that by funding this project you are helping people around the world to connect with God deeply through music. Beyond that you're helping grass roots kiwi music and a friend achieve a life dream.

Can't give cash?

If you can't give financially all good! Help me to spread the word by sharing this link and my music with your friends. Here's some ways you can do that:

Twitter: Tweet the link to this page encouraging people to give.

Facebook: Share this link on your Facebook page with your friends.

Email: Send an email to anyone you know who might be keen to support me (Don't be a spammer though :))

Or I would so appreciate your prayer that God would have his way through the music and open doors into the world.
story_txt:
Help Me Record A Full Length Album In 2012!
(please note all figures on this site are in US Dollars)
"Strahan; of Gaelic origin; meaning – Poet, Minstrel, Sage.
Strahan is a folk / gospel artist from Auckland New Zealand with a unique songwriting style and a lot of passion. In 2011 he released his debut EP Water & Fire which has been described as “spiritually uplifting” (Challenge Weekly) and “a beautiful offering … from a passionate faith” (Salvation Army; Firezone). His songs describe journeying with God through the many stages of faith with a deep sense of hope enveloping it all.
Water & Fire was a success with its first single “Heaven” reaching the top ten on LifeFM and now getting airplay on Australia’s HopeFM. The EP has been downloaded in over 20 countries and sold out at the Parachute Music Festival in five minutes.
After playing the LifeFM Summer Tour earlier this year and to a packed out show at Parachute Festival Strahan has been working hard writing an album, which is due to be released later in 2012."

Last June I released my debut EP Water & Fire as an independant artist not really knowing what would come of it. I'll be hitting the studio's as soon as I've raised the money and releasing the album before Christmas if all goes to plan.
Thanks for all your support to this point and into the future. 
Much love,Strahan.

story:
Ryan Cavanaugh is raising funds for a new record called:    

Back Country to the Future

Country banjo meets Jazz fusion.

This record will feature modern jazz music icons: Bill Evans, Mark Egan and Joel Rosenblatt

http://www.billevanssax.com

http://www.markegan.com

http://www.drumhang.com

http://www.ryancavanaughnomansland.com


Dear patron, 

The days of record labels funding artist projects are all but gone. Independent artists such as myself are forced to seek out production budgets through other means.  Please help us reach our goal in making some great new music!  

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>   Sincerely, Ryan Cavanaugh    


PS ~If campaign goal is met we will print a limited pressing of VINYL available to all $50 pledges and up

story:
Hello it's Esther Maria & Torsten speaking

 

For you who don't know us so well, we are a folkrock band based in Aarhus Denmark, and have been playing together since 2009 the same year we released our EP 'My Black Heart'

 

  • In 2010 we travelled to New York and recorded our debut album 'The Abyss' with the great producer Kramer, and finished it during 2011.

 

  • You can hear the album here: http://snd.sc/NFakH4

 

After realizing defeat when it comes to getting signed with a record company who would be partially willing to fund the release. We want to do the release on demand solution instead wich benefits us all much better. And this is how you come into the picture!

 

We are working on raising 3750 dollars  a little under 25.000 danish kr. to finance the printing and secure the release of our debut album.

 

We will print 300 LP's and 500 cd's  -  or more if enough of you make a pledge.

 

Every pledge you make will fullfill it's purpose if we do not reach the full amount - then we will ouselves fund the rest of the money needed . So if you pledge the 30 $ you will recieve the LP as promised etc.

 

  • Remember every penny counts - the contribution you make will help us greatly, and you can be sure of our eternal gratitude. We so really wan't to get this album released and on the road, so we can share it with all of you!

 

Thank you all!

Love , Light & Gratitude

Esther Maria & Torsten

Remember every penny counts - the contribution you make will help us greatly, and you can be sure of our eternal gratitude. We so really wan't to get this album released and on the road, so we can share it with all of you!
 
Thank you all!
Love , Light & Gratitude
Esther Maria & Torsten

story:
Summary

My name is Gregg.  More importantly, my daughter's name is Lucy.  She is 7, and she is a talented musician.  But it doesn't really matter how talented she is - what matters is that she has a huge heart.  She has decided to make an album of original songs that she wrote herself, and sell the CD's for $10.  She wants to give 100% of all proceeds to kids who need food.  Make no mistake: every dollar we raise in this campaign will go toward feeding hungry kids.

What We Need & What You Get

Target Funding Goal: $5,500

Use of funds: to pay for the replication and fulfillment of 5,000 CD's.  This way, all $10 of sale proceeds will go to feed hungry kids.  That's what Lucy wants. 

If we don't raise $5,500, or if we raise more than $5,500, all proceeds will go toward costs of replicating and fulfillment of the CD sales.  The more we raise, the more CD's we'll produce and sell.  The more CD's we replicate at one time, the cheaper the cost per CD is, and the more money we can use to feed hungry U.S. kids.

What you get: Our only perk is a copy of Lucy's CD.  For any contribution of $25 or more, you also get a copy of Lucy's CD.  She is probably not the next Alicia Keys, but she might contribute to the end of child hunger in America.

The Impact

The most significant impact Lucy's project will have is that of feeding hungry kids.  Each meal costs $0.25 to package so a $10 CD sale will feed 40 kids one meal. 

The charity is Outreach, Inc. - Kids Care.  http://www.outreachprogram.org/

Another, less significant but still important impact of her project is that other creative kids might be inspired by Lucy's creativity and generosity if she is successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please spread the word.  We will be generating quite a bit of media coverage of Lucy's crusade to feed hungry kids.  Use Indiegogo's tools as well as your own resources and networks please!

story:
We've met our $5000 goal for Indiegogo (BRAVO and thanks to everyone who has helped), but since our fundraising concert earlier this summer fell short of its goal, we're still short of the $7500 we need to put the disc out. 

This Indiegogo campaign is done, but you can still donate here

 

With your help, a new generation will get to know the chamber music of these two masters whose careers and lives were so tragically shaped by the madness of Nazi Germany


Now is the time- Gal's trios waited nearly 80 and 40 years for American performances. It's time to redress the neglect that began when Hitler banned this music in 1933. At least Gal was able to continue working after the War- Krasa was killed in Auschwitz just days after finishing the Passacaglia and Fugue, his harrowing final work which concludes this disc. Give for them, give so their voices are heard by new audiences.

 

The Complete String Trios of Hans Gál and Hans Krása

Ensemble Epomeo need your help to relase a very beautiful and important CD of the complete music for string trio by Hans Gál and Hans Krása, leading members of a gifted generation of Jewish composers in Central Europe whose destinies were shaped by Nazi persecution in the years 1933-1945.

Hans Krása (1899-1944) was born in Prague and had established himself as one of the most exciting Czech composers of his generation in the years before WW II. However, in 1942, he was arrested by the Nazi's and interred in the Theresienstadt ghetto, where he helped guid the unlikely flowering of a diverse musical life in collaboration with fellow-composers Pavel Haas, Gideon Klein and Viktor Ullmann until his deporation to Auschwitz, where he was murdered in the gas chambers on October 18, 1944. His two string trios come from the last months of his life, the visceral  and intense "Tanec" (or "Dance") and the extraordinary "Passacaglia and Fugue," the very last piece he wrote. Krása's music was largely forgotten in the decades after the War, and has only recently begun to be rediscovered and fully appreciated

Viennese composer Hans Gál (1890-1987) was lucky to escape to Britain with his family in 1938, but endurred terrible hardships in British internment camps during the War, before settling in Edinburgh. His Serenade for Trio, opus 41, was composed in 1932, at the peak of his pre-war career when he was director of the conservatory in Mainz. His Trio in F-sharp Minor, opus 104, written in 1974, is part of the extraordinary late flowering of  Gál's creativity in his ninth decade. Together, these two remarkable works frame a long and astonishingly diverse artistic life. Although Gál survied the war, his music fell into obscurity in the mid- 20th c., and these remarkable trios have remained almost completey unknown prior to their world-premiere recording on this disc. Ensemble Epomeo, in fact, gave the the first North American performances of both pieces.

Four beautiful and important works, long forgotten in the wake of tragedy and dislocation are brought together on this important recording for Avie Reocrds, who have led the way in the rediscovery of Gál's music, with a series of recordings that have been among the most widely critically praised discs of the last few years. Gramophone Magazine has hailed Gál's  “structural genius and contrapuntal mastery" and priased the serie's "…committed performance…splendid sound, warmly recommended." Classic FM Magazine has said "Gál is truly worth rediscovering" saying the series has "left me intrigued and delighted"

This CD will be the debut disc from the Anglo-American string trio  Ensemble Epomeo, who gave the Gál trios their American premieres in 2010 and 2011 respectively.  The recording was made leading producer/engineer (and grandson of Hans Gál), Simon Fox and in the beautiful concert hall at the Millfield School in Somerset, England in December 2011.


Ensemble Epomeo, Caroline Chin-violin, David Yang-viola and Kenneth Woods-cello, is an internationally touring string trio, whose performances combine intensity, virtuosity and accessibility.

Founded in 2008, their inaugural tours saw them performing in Italy, the UK and the USA, with performances at the Newburyport and Ischia festivals, and broadcasts on New England Public Radio and WKCR Columbia University in New York, where they were the subject of a 3 hour special showcase concert.

 

For more information about Ensemble Epomeo and the music on our debut CD, please visit http://ensemble-epomeo.net/

 

Ensemble Epomeo's debut CD is a sponsored project of Musica Reginae, a 501(c)(3) non-profit Arts organization. Contributions for Ensemble Epomeo must be made payable to Musica Reginae Productions and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Donations made on Indiegogo will go directly to Musica Reginae.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This important disc is "in the can,' but we can't release it without your help!

We need you to help us raise at least $5000, a portion of the approximately $8,000 outstanding budget which includes production and post-production costs, mastering and pressing costs and mechanical copyright fees.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this project! You can join our Facebook page

story:
Since we released our 3rd album almost 2 years ago, we’ve been touring and writing more songs. We’ve written 6 new songs that we absolutely love and would love to get them out to our fans now before we have a full album worth of material.

With the funds, we will be spending one day in a professional recording studio to track the drums (and the rest in our own studio), as well as getting some of the best mixing and mastering engineers out there to help us finish the record.

Check out the perks we have for you and please be generous! We want this EP to be the best we’ve ever recorded, and we hope it will open new doors for us such as TV and movie placements. We think these news songs are THAT good!

story:
Short Summary

Hello Tiny Army!
One afternoon Jamila and I were discussing ways to help her record a new album and to launch her music career. We came up with using indiegogo to make this happen. This is new to both of us and we are hoping it will be a good way for fans to help fund the album. If you were going to get her music anyways, why not ahead of time and get some added perks?

What We Need & What You Get

We worked out that the cost of recording will be $1000, the extra funding is to cover expenses for using indiegogo. The timeline of when you get perks is when the album is completed. We can't give an exact timeline of when that would be, but the goal is in the spring. We will update everyone when recording starts and when the album is done. The perks are listed below of helping out. Thanks to everyone that contributes! You are the best!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute,  that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • help us to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. This could be anything from telling your friends, tweeting about it or commenting on facebook. Any social media you use really. 
  • there are also Indiegogo share tools which are linked to the campaign

story:
Port Authority (ex-member of The Riot) is doing a "pay what you want" pre-order through Indiegogo. We need YOUR help to make this album happen. Any amount you donate will get you the album once it is released near the end of January.

We are looking to raise about half of what we are planning to spend on recording, lodging, mixing, mastering, and other small misc. costs in order to release this album.

We are looking to have this album finished by the beginning of January so that we can release it by the end of the month and tour non-stop from there on. 

Please do everything you can to share this page, any donation of any amount will help and is greatly appreciated.

story:
"If in the after life there is not music, we will have to import it. "

I believe that you don't have to put to put out great music. With that said I am launching a campaign to elevate my movement to greater heights. With your contributions I hope to help inspire young women to stand up for what they believe and that you can remain true to yourself, your gift and still find a way to shine!

The Impact

Once funded and released all the profits from my EP will go towards fueling the Good Karma movement which will include a tour, music video as well as the launch of other great female artists. This will also inspire many woman, men and young children alike to maintain a sense of integrity while still pursuing their dreams!

 

What We Need & What You Get

So I set a goal of $5000. This will cover the release, distribution, marketing and promotions of the "Good Karma Movement".

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Lets use the "Karma Method" which is Pay It Forward. For everyone who contributes and even for those who can't please go out and tell as many people as you can and so forth and so on. This is not a charity, or just a campaign this a movement. So lets move!
story_txt:
"If in the after life there is not music, we will have to import it. "

I believe that you don't have to put to put out great music. With that said I am launching a campaign to elevate my movement to greater heights. With your contributions I hope to help inspire young women to stand up for what they believe and that you can remain true to yourself, your gift and still find a way to shine!


The Impact
Once funded and released all the profits from my EP will go towards fueling the Good Karma movement which will include a tour, music video as well as the launch of other great female artists. This will also inspire many woman, men and young children alike to maintain a sense of integrity while still pursuing their dreams!
 


What We Need & What You Get
So I set a goal of $5000. This will cover the release, distribution, marketing and promotions of the "Good Karma Movement".
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Lets use the "Karma Method" which is Pay It Forward. For everyone who contributes and even for those who can't please go out and tell as many people as you can and so forth and so on. This is not a charity, or just a campaign this a movement. So lets move!

story:
INERTIA & ATTRITION

UK bands Inertia & Attrition are 2 of the most hardworking bands in the UK's Dark Alternative music scene.  Attrition have been together for 30 years!  And Inertia for 19 years!!

Both bands have several releases under their belts from over the years and have played countless tours and shows individually.. including several US Tours.

Inertia have just released their brand new album "Deworlded" and Attrition have recently released a best of compilation "Dreamtime Collectors 1980-2010".  Both bands are highly regarded in the music scenes of which they exist.


US Tour April 2011

The bands have been asked to appear on the forthcoming "Darkfest" East Coast USA Tour together with US bands Ego Likeness and The Ludovico Technique.  Inertia & Attrition have not toured the USA for a few years, so this tour poses a perfect opportunity for both bands to go on the road together and play to their US fanbases who have been requesting that they play the US again.

 

The current tour schedule is:-

 

 -April 6th Atlanta, GA @ Masquerade
-April 7th Savannah, GA @ ClubOne
-April 8th New Orleans, LA @ HiHo Lounge
-April 9th Tulsa, OK @ Eclipse
-April 10th Nashville, TN @ The Rutledge
-April 11th St. Louis, MO @ Crack Fox
-April 13th Raleigh, NC @ Legends
-April 14th Baltimore, MD @ Orpheus
-April 15th Pittsburgh, PA @ 31st St Pub
-April 16th New York City (TBA)
-April 17th Rochester, NY @ Water Street Music Hall

 

This will be a well attended tour with all bands playing to a good audience and a chance to play to each other's fanbases.

If all goes well, we will all be back to do it on the West Coast of the USA later in the year!

Our Indiegogo Goal

As much of a great tour this will be and excellent opportunity for the bands.  Fees within the smaller section of the alternative music scenes are not so high.  But costs for doing a tour with 4 bands are quite high!

The fees and merchandise sales that are made will go directly to Van hire, Gas, accommodation and food.  However, both UK bands have the expense of flights from the UK to the USA.  This will not be covered as part of the tour expenses and will cost in the region of $3000,

 

We need your help in raising $3000 within 3 weeks!  On offer are lots of very cool packages, which we are sure will make your pledge worthwhile!

 

Tours of this nature hardly ever make a profit, but the satisfaction of playing to your audiences Worldwide makes touring like this very special. 

 

In the event of us not making our goal, whatever is made will go towards cost of flights.  ANYTHING will help, but the full $3000 will, help the bands go on the road debt free and make the tour even more enjoyable.

 

Spread the word

If you know of anyone else who would be interested in contributing to this campaign, please let them know.  It would be highly appreciated!

 

Thank You!

 

INERTIA & ATTRITION

story:
Hello. I am an artist in the process of building a multi purpose bus stage, transportation vehicle to support other talents along the way and to spread the message of how to fix some issues with our social systems .

aim for fuel efficiency, high tech,informative, multi media entertaining experience.

lights , sound, projectors, digital art, fashion design, beautiful. 

there will be a platform on the roof for performances, and public announcements.

low energy lighting , as efficient as possible.

 


I am a 33 year old artist , professional driver, good mechanic, welder, electrician, designer and visionary. I have a very warm heart and am running after my dreams. I support other artists along the way, I plan to share music and art with the world on my mobile bus stage to inspire and entertain. I will also like to address social issues that we are dealing with to make the world a better place.
There will be a stage on the roof for performance and public announcements.

story:
OUR STORY

I have been learning a lot through my music and my connections with the people I meet in my life. I'm enjoying honoring the moments I share with them and constantly trying to become a better person by sharing those moments through my music. That's why I've decided to write the second album now and call it "The Dawn Of Momentum", partly because I promised Mum that her name would be in the title (Ha) but mostly because this really is the Dawn Of Momentum for me. It's a concept album, the concept is The Universe, life, stars, Heaven, Death, Fate etc...

I've gained so much awareness of my own self-expression over the past year and at points it's been a very bumpy ride, ever since Dad passed away. A short time ago I had some incredibly heart opening experiences that helped me drop my low self confidence and assisted the opening of my heart, in turn, delivering these amazing new songs which I now need to share with you.

I feel that the best way of doing that is by honoring the people that have supported my music career over the years. My fans, my family, friends and supporters... I really would like you all to be a major part of this new album.

We've just started the creative process for branding, the new sound (Electro/Acoustic) and new image to show the self-expression I have gained in my travels and life experiences since my award winning debut release "Slowly Diabolical" in 2008.

This year, "Warning Signs" my collaborative single, written with Darnell Swallow (UK) has obtained me the nomination for Best Dance Artist at this years Los Angeles Music Awards. This will be my 6th nomination and if we win, my 4th award. It's a great introduction to the new sound and a perfect wave to ride as we've also submitted "Warning Signs" to The Recording Academy for the 2011 Grammy's for Best Dance Recording and Best Short Form Video. The sound of the new album isn't going to be this dance heavy but it's a good introduction. It's going to be somewhere in the middle of my normal style of indie rock/pop fused with Electro. So exciting!


My team and I have set the wheels in motion but we would love you, the supporters, fans, friends and family to be THE integral part of the making of this new album a concept album. 


WHY YOU SHOULD CARE

My debut album which was nominated 3 times in 2008 at the LAMA's won twice that year! The album cost me and my small indie label partners over $60,000 including marketing and mastering costs. This soon mounted up to way way more... I am responsible for the funding and costs along with my business partners.

I would be so grateful to the people who have believed in me for years to now help me support this new project.

It's very important to me because the repercussions of loss and then building up my life again in a different country was very hard but the one thing that got me through it all was the love of the people around me. The most momentous occasions for me are the times I release the music that I've written by the inspirational situations I've experienced.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Pledge for $5 or more:
A download code for Kris' new album before its release via Inspire U Records

Pledge for $15 or more:
'Limited Reward'
A copy of Kris' new album, and a download code via Inspire U Records before anyone else

Pledge for $25 or more:
'Limited Reward'
A copy of Kris' new album, signed and personalized, a download code via Inspire U Records and a hand made THANK YOU card!

Pledge for $50 or more:
'Limited Reward'
A copy of Kris' new album, signed and personalized, a download code via Inspire U Records and a hand made THANK YOU card a KS t-shirt and a signed photo from the album photo shoot!

Pledge for $100
'Limited Reward'
Your name in the album (under a special "Thank You" section of the CD artwork), a copy of Kris' new album (signed and personalized by him), a hand made THANK YOU card, a download code for Kris's debut, via Inspire U Records before anyone else AND an invitation for you and a guest to one of the recording sessions whilst the album is being produced!!


**Special Pledge $500 or more OR the biggest donation:
'Limited Reward'
I will offer a very exclusive title on the CD as "Executive Producer" for the biggest donation pledged and your name in the album (under a special "Thank You" section of the CD artwork), a copy of Kris' new album (signed and personalized by him), a hand made THANK YOU card, a download code for Kris's debut, via Inspire U Records before anyone else AND an invitation for you and a guest to one of the recording sessions whilst the album is being produced!!


HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP

We are all connected, this is all for a bigger purpose, it's not just about the music... this will help empower and inspire others by showing them the power of independent music, the power of friends and family and honoring the people who are there to support throughout any journey they choose and the creative ones really are from the heart. So help support someone's heart <3

and life experiences since my award winning debut release "Slowly Diabolical" in 2008.This year, "Warning Signs" my collaborative single, written with Darnell Swallow (UK) has obtained me the nomination for Best Dance Artist at this years Los Angeles Music Awards. This will be my 6th nomination and if we win, my 4th award. It's a great introduction to the new sound and a perfect wave to ride as we've also submitted "Warning Signs" to The Recording Academy for the 2011 Grammy's for Best Dance Recording and Best Short Form Video. The sound of the new album isn't going to be this dance heavy but it's a good introduction. It's going to be somewhere in the middle of my normal style of indie rock/pop fused with Electro. So exciting!My team and I have set the wheels in motion but we would love you, the supporters, fans,
 friends and family to be THE integral part of the making of this new 
album a concept album. WHY YOU SHOULD CAREMy debut album which was nominated 3 times in 2008 at the LAMA's won twice that year! The album cost me and my small indie label partners over $60,000 including 
marketing and mastering costs.
This soon mounted up to way way more... I am responsible for the funding and costs along with my business partners. I would be so grateful to the people who have believed in me for years to now help me 
support this new project. It's very important to me because the repercussions of loss and then building up my life again in a different country was very hard but the one thing that got me through it all was the love of the people around me. The most momentous occasions for me are the times I release the music that I've written by the inspirational situations I've experienced.WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GETPledge for $5 or more:
A download code for Kris' new album before its release via Inspire U Records
Pledge for $15 or more:
'Limited Reward'
A copy of Kris' new album, and a download code via Inspire U Records before anyone else
Pledge for $25 or more:
'Limited Reward'
A copy of Kris' new album, signed and personalized, a download code via Inspire U Records and a hand made THANK YOU card!
Pledge for $50 or more:
'Limited Reward'
A copy of Kris' new album, signed and personalized, a download code 
via Inspire U Records and a hand made THANK YOU card a KS t-shirt and a 
signed photo from the album photo shoot!
Pledge for $100
'Limited Reward'
Your name in the album (under a special "Thank You" section of the 
CD artwork), a copy of Kris' new album (signed and personalized by him),
 a hand made THANK YOU card, a download code for Kris's debut, via 
Inspire U Records before anyone else AND an invitation for you and a 
guest to one of the recording sessions whilst the album is being 
produced!!
**Special Pledge $500 or more OR the biggest donation:
'Limited Reward'
I will offer a very exclusive title on the CD as "Executive 
Producer" for the biggest donation pledged and your name in the album 
(under a special "Thank You" section of the CD artwork), a copy of Kris'
 new album (signed and personalized by him), a hand made THANK YOU card,
 a download code for Kris's debut, via Inspire U Records before anyone 
else AND an invitation for you and a guest to one of the recording 
sessions whilst the album is being produced!!HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELPWe are all connected, this is all for a bigger purpose, it's not just about the music... this will help empower and inspire others by showing them the power of 
independent music, the power of friends and family and honoring the 
people
 who are there to support throughout any journey they choose and the creative ones really are from the heart. So help support someone's heart <3

story:
Our Story


"Silverhawk Glides Out of the Northwest With a Big, Soulful Psychedelic Vibe The Diverse, Wide-Open Sound of the Bandâ€™s Third Album The Forest For the Trees Twists Rockâ€™s Psychedelic History into Innovative New Shapes

Sam and John C. Densmore have been a part of the Northwest music scene since 1992. Theyâ€™ve played together in Slow Children, Frequency db, and the Jeremy Wilson Band, but they take the Northwestern sound back to the future on The Forest for The Trees. The brothers share songwriting and vocal duties, trading off on guitar and bass, ably supported by Anthony James Cotham on keyboards and harmony vocals, and drummer Coby Bixby." Green Light Go, 2011

Silverhawk is looking forward to making a new music video for the song "So Complex" from our forthcoming album The Forest For The Trees (Feb 7, 2012, Buddy Cat Music). We're shooting the video in Portland, OR., with local cast and crew. We're hoping to release it this spring as the third single from the new album.

The Impact

Silverhawk needs more grass roots style media exposure in order to promote our new album! A quality follow up video to "Woman in a Cloak" will help us in that endeavor.

What We Need & What You Get

Our estimated cost for crew, equipment and other production related expenses is $4000.
If we have any money left over from the campaign, it will go towards further promotion and distribution of the new album.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help SILVERHAWK spread the word about our campaign to make a video for So Complex. Tell all your friends about our band and our new album! Post links to this page on Facebook, Twitter and your other social media sites.

story:
Our Story

Ladies and gentlemen:  it's true - a new album is forthcoming!  And here is your chance to help us finish it. 

It might come as a bit of a surprise to some of you to hear that we've embarked on this rather imposing task of recording a new album, and honestly, it all came as a bit of a surprise for us too.  As many of you know, this last year has been quite a tumultuous year for us, and in some ways we never anticipated ourselves being in the position we now find ourselves: ready to tackle the studio with new music in hand. 

It's been a year full of dramatic transitions, where we saw the addition of a great creative dynamism in new band members, Ben-David and Andrew.  It's also been a tough year, where the tragedy and mystery of death hit close to home, with the passing of Alexander and Daniel's mother and grandmother, as well as good friend Patrick Halloran of the band Ceann.  After 1200 shows in 8 years, we decided to take some time off to let everything sink in for what it was.

But in January, after a couple of months to ourselves, we met up for 10 days in a house in upstate NY, and songs just started to flow.  It was unexpected, but it was clear that things were rising to the surface, and all we could do was try to keep up.  After this rock tumbler of a year, we came out of that "band camp" energized and eager to share a new side of Scythian.  It really drove home to us the healing power of music. 

You'll still hear the same upbeat energy in songs like "End of the Street" and "Leaving of Liverpool", but then you'll also hear songs that are more pensive and reflective, like "Far Away" and "Whiskey". You'll hear a ripping rendition of the Ukrainian-Carpathian song, Arkan from the region where the Fedoryka boys' ancestors are from. And thanks to Ben-David's enthusiasm, we've reconnected with our acoustic roots with some great new Irish trad sets as well.  In many ways, we feel the songs on the upcoming album really capture Scythian in it's latest, and we feel, most dynamic stage, which is part of the reason we felt compelled to share it with you all.  Not only compelled, but truly excited for you all to hear what's been brewing.

It’s a changing music industry.  In many ways this is a good thing. The record labels have less creative control over artists, the gate-keepers of FM radio no longer dictate what you get to hear as a music lover, and it's by and large less expensive to hear new music.

But, with that said, more and more costs fall upon bands to produce and release new music. Making an album right is an expensive process, from recording, mixing, mastering and promoting, and when there is no record label to pay for it, it falls on us to raise the money through touring, which is a big part of why we’ve been on the road constantly for the last eight years.  Ironically, you need to be off the road for the creative space to make music, but off the road you can't save money for the album you'd like to make.  And it is a big reason why there were 5 years between our last two studio albums.  But this great platform has changed that.  Your valuable dollars and support will go to pay for studio time, engineering, mixing, mastering, and printing.

So this is where you all come in: through IndieGoGo we are able to provide a variety of ways for you, our loyal fans, to actively participate in the process of making a studio album.  In return, we're offering perks and packages – from advanced copies of the new record, all the way up to a private house concert in your own back yard – as a way for us to generate enough money to record, mix, and release this new album in 2012.  This will be an album for you, and in a fundamental way, by you. 

As an extra thank you from us, anyone who buys a digital download of the album and up will receive three free songs, ready for immediate download: a song from the new album, Steve Earl's "Galway Girl", the Beatles' "I Should Have Known Better", and "Sands of Time (Sara's Song)", which Joey wrote for Sara on their 1 year anniversary. These tracks aren't available anywhere else, but we want you to have them as an extra thank you for your support. Once you become a backer, you will receive an email with a link and a download code to claim your free downloads.

The amazing outpouring of support that we've consistently gotten from you all has utterly humbled us throughout the years, and we humbly ask for your help in making this album a reality.  There are always costs around every corner.  Major record labels spend hundreds of thousands of dollars on publicists, radio promoters, and tour support for each album they release.  Our goal of $17,000 will cover the bare bones of studio time, mixing, mastering, session fees and printing of the album.  Any extra capital raised beyond our campaign goal would go towards valuable publicity and distribution: helping Scythian release the music from this album to radio stations in our 6 strongest markets.

If you’ve read this far, then chances are you’ve met us after one of our shows, and know what kind of guys we are and why we’ve poured our hearts into this band for the last 8 years.  We're hoping you can help us produce our best album yet.  We believe in generosity, and so in turn we'd like to let you all know that we will be sharing 10% of everything we've raised, no matter how much or little, with the poor and the hungry.  We were blown away that a family could be fed for a month in northern PA from the several hundred dollars you all donated during our tour with Enter the Haggis.  Your generosity is the only reason we're here, and all we can do is pass it on. 

We ask for your help and support to make this a reality for us in 2012.  We are looking for a June release, but we'll be sharing it earlier with those of you who can help us out in this campaign.  Stay tuned here and to our Facebook page for pictures, videos and updates from the studio.  We salute you and sincerely thank you for helping us make the best album we can. 

UPDATE: WOW!! The response has been incredible - we are blown away!! THANK YOU EVERYONE!  Just a note: We will be sending you an email with the download codes, but there will be a slight lag time, maybe up to as many as a few hours.  Sorry!  This is our first time working with this platform and we're working it out as we go - thanks for your patience!

In gratitude,

Daniel, Joey, Ben-David, Andrew and Alexander

story:
This will be our fourth Shabang...

 And the first three were incredibly fun, peaceful, and legendary. This has brought together populations of SLO's community under one uniting umbrella, local music. With your help we can continue to fund bigger and better Shabangs in the future as well as pay for the upcoming event! People like you have already made something good into something great, if we team up we can mold this idea into a creative expression to be shared with people across California.

What We Need

The 500 dollars we need for Shabang 4 goes to all the behind the scenes work that allows the safe and fun show we hope to have. We need lighting so we can see your cute faces in the crowd. We need a generator to bring the sounds to your ear canals. We need a stage so you can reach high in the sky for a handful your favorite lead singers balls. $250 of your donations is going straight to our professional security team to ensure your safety, the safety of others, and open parking spaces. With these things and more we will be able to throw the best local music showcase in years. To make matters even better all profits will go to SLO Boys and Girls club, benefitting the local community.

Be a part of something great and and donate to the Shabang 4! You all are the reason we have the show, and now we need your help.

Thanks!
