story:
Update:

I learned to sing Disney songs when I was young, and I hope that one day I can combine with what I have learned from music training with popular Disney tunes to create my very own versions of these songs. So here it is, a familiar theme with versatile voice, talking instruments, storytelling with popular Disney tunes. This will also be very educational for young musicians to be with it's unique style of music that shows what a music instrument can produce besides it's traditional sounds.

 

This album is very special to me because it will be created by the public, yes, that's all of your that have, will or may contribute to my campaign.

And to show my appreciation, for anyone contributing $50 or more, your name will be listed in the final release of the CD album.

I hope this can be a successful campaign so I can share this experience with people that loves music from around the world to enjoy!

 

Thank you and have a Magical day!

Sincerely,

Paulway

 

An Interview with the Mad Hatter:

Hatter: Hello everyone!

Alice/Cheshire Cat/March Hare: Hello Hatter, welcome to our interview today.

Hatter: Ohhh… It’s my pleasure.

Cheshire Cat: So… I heard you want to record an album… what type of album…? Well…? Tell us…

Hatter: Yes, this will be a Tribute to Disney album with the album named “Mad as a Hatter”. The album will be fun and easygoing. Like a musical, it will have a storytelling approach. Music arrangements will be influenced by Malay and Chinese instruments. In two of the songs, I will sing in four different languages including English, Mandarin, Cantonese, and Malay. There may be up to three languages in the same song. Yeah, it’s kinda like an ethnically album. Musicians will use their skills with their instruments to communicate and speak to me. Listeners will be able to use their imagination to picture the scene. Just like how Walt Disney would do it, with great story telling and good imagination.

This album will also be very educational for young musicians to be. They will be able to witness and understand how a musical instrument can “speak” in a conversation.

March Hare: Hehehehehe… Can you make some tea?

Cheshire Cat: can you stick... to the subject... please?

March Hare: Hehehehehe… oh yeah, the subject… hehehehe… So how will you portray this Mad Hatter?

Hatter: I guess you can say that I will be, musically “mad”. Just like the other instruments in the album, I will play around with my voice, as they will with sound.

Alice: So Hatter, I don’t understand… Why Disney?

Hatter: Disney is my dream. I always thought that Walt Disney was a great storyteller, and I learned a lot of important life lessons through watching Disney animations. They are meaningful, and also promotes encouragement. I have been a Disney fan since I was a young child. I wanted to become a cartoonist, while I was also fascinated by Disney musicals, so I started to draw Disney characters, and also pretended to portray the princesses by singing and acting. Well, singing and acting was of more interest to me in the later years, and this eventually led me to fall in love with musical theater. So I said to myself, if I were to record an album, I would do so to tribute Walt Disney and to share my experience with all Disney fans around the world.

Alice: Oh! That sounds wonderful! I too love to dream.  Oh pardon me, I also heard from March Hare that besides singing, you can also draw very well?

March Hare: Hehehehehe… Oh Yeah.. hehehe… she can tea... i mean she can draw!

Cheshire Cat: Draw? What can YOU draw?

Hatter: Yes yes yes, I love to draw.  I draw all kinds of Disney characters especially the princesses and I have been practicing for a very long time. I can also draw the three of you, as you will see on the album cover.

Cheshire Cat: So what else do you need to do to prepare for this album?

Hatter: Support. Yes, we need support from everyone to finish this album. Since we are a bunch of independent musicians and not working for any studios or labels, we really need all the help we can get. The above video is the demo introduction song for the album; we will fine-tune it once we start working on it. Thank you and enjoy!

Alice/Cheshire Cat/March Hare: Thank you everyone!

 

Cast:

Paulway Chew / Art & Music Direction / Vocalist / Mad Hatter:
San Francisco, CA, USA

 
Paulway exudes a cool mystique presence. Whether its performing in a musical or just singing her favorite Disney songs, Paulway never fails to showcase her powerful and ethereal vocals. One minute she sings in a soft-spoken undertone, the next you will be completely blown away by a voice that resonates an alluring intensity. Paulway's passion for music and art came at an early age of 6 where she was influenced with Disney animations from her parents. She began building her passion and skills throughout her childhood. Being a huge Disney fan she is, Paulway hosted her own musical show, A Tribue to Disney, on June of 2011 at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music.

"From the beginning to the end, A Tribute to Disney is a story in the Disney spirit. Paulway’s voice is so beautiful; her amazing voice made me smile the whole performance. She sings Disney classic songs and sounds just like a true Disney princess; you can sing along to every song. Disney fans young & old will love this show." - Pam Spedus, Walt Disney Family Museum

"Ms. Chew has a wonderful voice and sang quite a variety of Disney hits from some of Disney's great films. It was a fun evening. I thoroughly enjoyed the show and believe that "children" of all ages from 5 to 105 who have a love of Disney would really enjoy it." - Derek Willhite, Golden Gate Disneyana Club

With the show having great receptions, Paulway was invited to perfrom the same show at the Walt Disney Family Museum on February of 2012.

For more information about Paulway, please visit her websites.
http://www.paulwaychew.com
http://www.youtube.com/Amadeusway
http://amadeuxway.deviantart.com
https://www.facebook.com/Amadeuxway

 

Sze Wan Lee / Music Producer / Music Arranger / Piano / Alice:
Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Graduated from the famed Berklee College of Music in Boston, Sze earned her Bachelor's degree in Film Scoring and Productions. She then ventured into the scene as a music programmer for Realtime Music Solutions in New York where she worked for clients such as Cameron Mackintosh and played an active part in several musicals in Broadway which includes Les Miserables, Porgy & Bess, and Miss Saigon.

In the recent Seasons of Love and West End Stars in Concert, Sze gave a genius touch as a Musical Director for the great performances of Ramin Karimloo, Stephen Rahman-Hughes, and Simon Bailey. To great success, Sze was again the Musical Director for Ramin Karimloo (Orignal cast; Phantom, Loves Never Dies) in Concert.

 

 

Fung, Chern Hwei / Violin / Cheshire Cat:
New York, NY, USA

Chern Hwei’s interest with the violin came at an early age of 4. Shortly after starting his lessons, he soon found himself imitating the electric guitar and saxophone sounds with his violin. He further his studies in New York and upon obtaining his Masters, Chern Hwei decided to stay in New York as a freelance musician whilst playing many different genres of music and yet absorbing even more musical languages and expressions.

Chern Hwei’s style range from Western Classical, Jazz, Middle Eastern music, Baroque Historical performance, Rock, and Hip Hop. Chern Hwei was fortunate to be able to work with talented artists including; Uri Caine, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Billy Martin, Stanley Clarke, Tony Bennett, Bobby McFerrin, Steve Wilson, Elliot Sharp, composer Mikael Karlsson, among others. Chern Hwei is currently a member of Sirius Quartet, a string quartet that specializes on improvisation and original written materials by the members themselves. Chern Hwei recently self-release his debut album, “From The Heart”.

 

Jie Ma / Pipa / March Hare:
Los Angeles, CA, USA

Jie Ma began playing the pipa at age 5 and became a professional musician at age 14. Jie received her Bachelor of Music degree from one of China's top music conservatories. After moving to the United States in 2004, Jie began exploring the possibilities of blending traditional pipa technique with Western music and sounds from all over the world and culture. Jie enjoys playing traditional Chinese arrangements, creating her own works, and fusing Chinese and other styles to create a unique sound that is all hers.

In her continuing effort to push the boundaries of the pipa in many different contexts, Jie has played with a wide variety of musicians from a number of different genres, including jazz, country, blues, and rock.  Jie's impressive technique, exotic sound, musical curiosity, and tremendous stage presence are not to be missed. In 2009, Jie was referred to in the U.K. newspaper, the Guardian, as one of the "notable" pipa players in the West.

 

 

The Goal:

To reach our goal of $25,000, we will need all the support we can get. The money we receive will go into the production of the album which will includes;

  • Musicians
  • Production team members
  • Studio rentals in San Francisco, Los Angeles, New York, and Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia.
  • Mixing and Mastering by Abbey Road Studios.
  • Transportation cost
  • Production of CDs
  • Printed materials

We want to create an album with the best qualities possible, but we can not do it without your support. We are aiming at a release date of hopefully late 2013 or early 2014, but with our musicians scattered in different locations, it may take a little longer to complete our album. April of 2014 is listed in our perks, but we are aiming to complete this album and get it to everyone before that date.

 

What you get:

Of course you will get digital downloads and CDs. And being an artist herself our vocalist, Paulway, also creates beautiful drawings of Disney characters with an alluring style, hence the name for the series, The Allure Series. These drawings will be available as post cards, calendar, booklet, and phone cases. You may view enlarged versions of these drawings at http://amadeuxway.deviantart.com.

You will be able to choose one your favorites.

 

Album Poster.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to plege but would like to help, you can always share our campaign through the vast online of social medias like Facebook, Twitter, Email, etc... Just by helping us spread and share this campaign will help us tremendously. Any type of support will be greatly appreciated!
 

Thank you everyone, we really appreciate you taking your busy schedule to view our campaign.

THANK YOU, 謝謝, TERIMA KASIH AND HAVE A MAGICAL DAY!!

 

Disclosure:

I am in no way affiliated with the Walt Disney Company, Walt Disney Animation Studio, and the Walt Disney Family Museum. I am just a huge Disney fan trying to fullfill a Disney dream.
story_txt:
Update:
I learned to sing Disney songs when I was young, and I hope that one day I can combine with what I have learned from music training with popular Disney tunes to create my very own versions of these songs. So here it is, a familiar theme with versatile voice, talking instruments, storytelling with popular Disney tunes. This will also be very educational for young musicians to be with it's unique style of music that shows what a music instrument can produce besides it's traditional sounds.
 
This album is very special to me because it will be created by the public, yes, that's all of your that have, will or may contribute to my campaign.
And to show my appreciation, for anyone contributing $50 or more, your name will be listed in the final release of the CD album.
I hope this can be a successful campaign so I can share this experience with people that loves music from around the world to enjoy!
 
Thank you and have a Magical day!
Sincerely,
Paulway
 
An Interview with the Mad Hatter:
Hatter: Hello everyone!
Alice/Cheshire Cat/March Hare: Hello Hatter, welcome to our interview today.
Hatter: Ohhh… It’s my pleasure.
Cheshire Cat: So… I heard you want to record an album… what type of album…? Well…? Tell us…
Hatter: Yes, this will be a Tribute to Disney album with the album named “Mad as a Hatter”. The album will be fun and easygoing. Like a musical, it will have a storytelling approach. Music arrangements will be influenced by Malay and Chinese instruments. In two of the songs, I will sing in four different languages including English, Mandarin, Cantonese, and Malay. There may be up to three languages in the same song. Yeah, it’s kinda like an ethnically album. Musicians will use their skills with their instruments to communicate and speak to me. Listeners will be able to use their imagination to picture the scene. Just like how Walt Disney would do it, with great story telling and good imagination.
This album will also be very educational for young musicians to be. They will be able to witness and understand how a musical instrument can “speak” in a conversation.
March Hare: Hehehehehe… Can you make some tea?
Cheshire Cat: can you stick... to the subject... please?
March Hare: Hehehehehe… oh yeah, the subject… hehehehe… So how will you portray this Mad Hatter?
Hatter: I guess you can say that I will be, musically “mad”. Just like the other instruments in the album, I will play around with my voice, as they will with sound.
Alice: So Hatter, I don’t understand… Why Disney?
Hatter: Disney is my dream. I always thought that Walt Disney was a great storyteller, and I learned a lot of important life lessons through watching Disney animations. They are meaningful, and also promotes encouragement. I have been a Disney fan since I was a young child. I wanted to become a cartoonist, while I was also fascinated by Disney musicals, so I started to draw Disney characters, and also pretended to portray the princesses by singing and acting. Well, singing and acting was of more interest to me in the later years, and this eventually led me to fall in love with musical theater. So I said to myself, if I were to record an album, I would do so to tribute Walt Disney and to share my experience with all Disney fans around the world.
Alice: Oh! That sounds wonderful! I too love to dream.  Oh pardon me, I also heard from March Hare that besides singing, you can also draw very well?
March Hare: Hehehehehe… Oh Yeah.. hehehe… she can tea... i mean she can draw!
Cheshire Cat: Draw? What can YOU draw?
Hatter: Yes yes yes, I love to draw.  I draw all kinds of Disney characters especially the princesses and I have been practicing for a very long time. I can also draw the three of you, as you will see on the album cover.
Cheshire Cat: So what else do you need to do to prepare for this album?
Hatter: Support. Yes, we need support from everyone to finish this album. Since we are a bunch of independent musicians and not working for any studios or labels, we really need all the help we can get. The above video is the demo introduction song for the album; we will fine-tune it once we start working on it. Thank you and enjoy!
Alice/Cheshire Cat/March Hare: Thank you everyone!
 
Cast:
Paulway Chew / Art & Music Direction / Vocalist / Mad Hatter:San Francisco, CA, USA


 
Paulway exudes a cool mystique presence. Whether its performing in a musical or just singing her favorite Disney songs, Paulway never fails to showcase her powerful and ethereal vocals. One minute she sings in a soft-spoken undertone, the next you will be completely blown away by a voice that resonates an alluring intensity. Paulway's passion for music and art came at an early age of 6 where she was influenced with Disney animations from her parents. She began building her passion and skills throughout her childhood. Being a huge Disney fan she is, Paulway hosted her own musical show, A Tribue to Disney, on June of 2011 at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music.
"From the beginning to the end, A Tribute to Disney is a story in the Disney spirit. Paulway’s voice is so beautiful; her amazing voice made me smile the whole performance. She sings Disney classic songs and sounds just like a true Disney princess; you can sing along to every song. Disney fans young & old will love this show." - Pam Spedus, Walt Disney Family Museum
"Ms. Chew has a wonderful voice and sang quite a variety of Disney hits from some of Disney's great films. It was a fun evening. I thoroughly enjoyed the show and believe that "children" of all ages from 5 to 105 who have a love of Disney would really enjoy it." - Derek Willhite, Golden Gate Disneyana Club
With the show having great receptions, Paulway was invited to perfrom the same show at the Walt Disney Family Museum on February of 2012.
For more information about Paulway, please visit her websites.http://www.paulwaychew.comhttp://www.youtube.com/Amadeuswayhttp://amadeuxway.deviantart.comhttps://www.facebook.com/Amadeuxway
 
Sze Wan Lee / Music Producer / Music Arranger / Piano / Alice:Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Graduated from the famed Berklee College of Music in Boston, Sze earned her Bachelor's degree in Film Scoring and Productions. She then ventured into the scene as a music programmer for Realtime Music Solutions in New York where she worked for clients such as Cameron Mackintosh and played an active part in several musicals in Broadway which includes Les Miserables, Porgy & Bess, and Miss Saigon.
In the recent Seasons of Love and West End Stars in Concert, Sze gave a genius touch as a Musical Director for the great performances of Ramin Karimloo, Stephen Rahman-Hughes, and Simon Bailey. To great success, Sze was again the Musical Director for Ramin Karimloo (Orignal cast; Phantom, Loves Never Dies) in Concert.
 
 
Fung, Chern Hwei / Violin / Cheshire Cat:New York, NY, USA

Chern Hwei’s interest with the violin came at an early age of 4. Shortly after starting his lessons, he soon found himself imitating the electric guitar and saxophone sounds with his violin. He further his studies in New York and upon obtaining his Masters, Chern Hwei decided to stay in New York as a freelance musician whilst playing many different genres of music and yet absorbing even more musical languages and expressions.
Chern Hwei’s style range from Western Classical, Jazz, Middle Eastern music, Baroque Historical performance, Rock, and Hip Hop. Chern Hwei was fortunate to be able to work with talented artists including; Uri Caine, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Billy Martin, Stanley Clarke, Tony Bennett, Bobby McFerrin, Steve Wilson, Elliot Sharp, composer Mikael Karlsson, among others. Chern Hwei is currently a member of Sirius Quartet, a string quartet that specializes on improvisation and original written materials by the members themselves. Chern Hwei recently self-release his debut album, “From The Heart”.
 
Jie Ma / Pipa / March Hare:Los Angeles, CA, USA

Jie Ma began playing the pipa at age 5 and became a professional musician at age 14. Jie received her Bachelor of Music degree from one of China's top music conservatories. After moving to the United States in 2004, Jie began exploring the possibilities of blending traditional pipa technique with Western music and sounds from all over the world and culture. Jie enjoys playing traditional Chinese arrangements, creating her own works, and fusing Chinese and other styles to create a unique sound that is all hers. 
In her continuing effort to push the boundaries of the pipa in many different contexts, Jie has played with a wide variety of musicians from a number of different genres, including jazz, country, blues, and rock.  Jie's impressive technique, exotic sound, musical curiosity, and tremendous stage presence are not to be missed. In 2009, Jie was referred to in the U.K. newspaper, the Guardian, as one of the "notable" pipa players in the West.
 
 


The Goal:
To reach our goal of $25,000, we will need all the support we can get. The money we receive will go into the production of the album which will includes;

Musicians
Production team members
Studio rentals in San Francisco, Los Angeles, New York, and Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia.
Mixing and Mastering by Abbey Road Studios.
Transportation cost
Production of CDs
Printed materials

We want to create an album with the best qualities possible, but we can not do it without your support. We are aiming at a release date of hopefully late 2013 or early 2014, but with our musicians scattered in different locations, it may take a little longer to complete our album. April of 2014 is listed in our perks, but we are aiming to complete this album and get it to everyone before that date.
 
What you get:
Of course you will get digital downloads and CDs. And being an artist herself our vocalist, Paulway, also creates beautiful drawings of Disney characters with an alluring style, hence the name for the series, The Allure Series. These drawings will be available as post cards, calendar, booklet, and phone cases. You may view enlarged versions of these drawings at http://amadeuxway.deviantart.com.
You will be able to choose one your favorites.


 
Album Poster.


 
Other Ways You Can Help:
If you are unable to plege but would like to help, you can always share our campaign through the vast online of social medias like Facebook, Twitter, Email, etc... Just by helping us spread and share this campaign will help us tremendously. Any type of support will be greatly appreciated!

 
Thank you everyone, we really appreciate you taking your busy schedule to view our campaign.
THANK YOU, 謝謝, TERIMA KASIH AND HAVE A MAGICAL DAY!!
 
Disclosure:
I am in no way affiliated with the Walt Disney Company, Walt Disney Animation Studio, and the Walt Disney Family Museum. I am just a huge Disney fan trying to fullfill a Disney dream.

story:
UPDATE!!!

NOT TOO REVEALING STORY SYNOPSIS:

A solitary man proposes to the woman he loves. On their wedding day, he takes her to an eerily beautiful cavern where she suffers an unfortunate fate. Suffering and alone, he seeks to fill the void left by the mysterious loss of his fiancé by finding love with another.

Short Summary (German Translation Below)

We are reaching out to you for support to create a music video for one of the greatest electro-industrial bands around, Decoded Feedback.

We are currently in the process of preparing to film a music video to the first track on their latest amazing album, Diskonnekt, called Another Loss. 

Decoded Feedback have been creating incredible electro-industrial music since the mid 90's and have only had one other official music video. The great thing about this video is that it would be the first music video where they actually appear in.

The director, editor, and cinematographer of this music video is an award winning filmmaker named Rogelio Salinas who has directed numerous short films, commercials, and music videos, including the most recent music video for Die Krupps, Risikofaktor.

The plan is to create a music video featuring footage of the members of Decoded Feedback mixed with footage of a tragic love story to be filmed in the eerily beautiful Longhorn Caverns in Burnet, TX.

The reason we are reaching out to you is to be able to pay to rent the caverns for the shoot, pay our cast and crew, purchase or have costumes custom made.

What We Need

We are wanting to raise funds for:

  • Rent out Longhorn Caverns for at least a few hours or for the entire day for the story portion of the shoot.
  • Pay and feed production cast and crew
  • Post production crew including the editor and After Effects artist
  • Purchase/rent additional equipment
  • Costumes, Props, Flowers
  • Gas, travel, and hotel for the two different shooting days

What You Get

There are numerous rewards that you will receive with your contribution including:

  • Digital Downloads of Another Loss, an entire album of Decoded Feedback including Diskonnekt, rare mix or unreleased track, or even Decoded Feedbacks never released first demo album.
  • 48 hour advance view of the video
  • Have your name immortalized with a Thank You in the credits of the Youtube music video page or their upcoming album booklet
  • Concert tickets or a meet and greet with the band at the Austin show on Saturday 6/29/13
  • Be on set during the story portion of the video shoot
  • For musicians, Decoded Feedback will remix one of your electronic tracks
  • Walk on role in a future Odyssey Creative Entertainment project
  • The most incredible gift of all, Decoded Feedback will write and compose a personal song for you.

The Impact

The more we raise the longer we can rent the cave, the more we can pay the cast and crew, the better equipment we may purchase or rent, and we will produce a higher quality video.

Decoded Feedback have been creating incredible music since the mid 90's and have only had one other official music video, and this would be the first one where they actually appear in.

The director, editor, and cinematographer of this music video is an award winning filmmaker who has directed numerous short films, commercials, and music videos, including the most recent music video for Die Krupps, Risikofaktor.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who are unable to contribute, we would greatly appreciate you sharing this page with everyone you can.

I truly believe this will be an extraordinary music video and be used as a great tool to promote the incredible talents of Decoded Feedback. Thank you all for your support.

GERMAN TRANSLATION

UPDATE!

NICHT zu freizügig STORY SYNOPSIS:

Ein einsamer Mann schlägt der Frau, die er liebt. Am Tag ihrer Hochzeit, nimmt er sie zu einem schaurig-schönen Höhle, wo sie eine unglückliche Schicksal erleidet. Leiden und allein, sucht er die Lücke, die der geheimnisvollen Verlust seiner Verlobten von der Suche nach der Liebe mit anderen zu füllen.

Kurze Zusammenfassung

Wir erreichen zu Ihnen für die Unterstützung, ein Musikvideo für eine der größten Electro-Industrial-Bands, Decoded Feedback erstellen.

Wir sind derzeit in den Prozess der Vorbereitung auf ein Musik-Video zum ersten Track auf ihrem neuesten Album erstaunlich, Diskonnekt, genannt weiteren Verlust zu filmen.

Decoded Feedback schaffen seit unglaublichen Electro-Industrial-Musik seit Mitte der 90er Jahre und haben nur eine andere offizielle Musikvideo. Das Tolle an diesem Video ist, dass es das erste Musikvideo sein, wo sie tatsächlich erscheinen in.

Der Regisseur, Redakteur und Kameramann dieses Musikvideo ist ein preisgekrönter Filmemacher namens Rogelio Salinas, der zahlreiche Kurzfilme, Werbespots und Musikvideos, einschließlich der neuesten Musik-Video für Die Krupps, Risikofaktor gerichtet hat.

Der Plan ist, ein Musik-Video mit Aufnahmen von den Mitgliedern des Decoded Feedback mit Aufnahmen von einer tragischen Liebesgeschichte, in der schaurig-schönen Longhorn Caverns in Burnet, TX gefilmt werden gemischt erstellen.

Der Grund erreichen wir darauf aus sind, Sie ist in der Lage sein zu zahlen, um die Höhlen für das Shooting zu vermieten, zahlen unsere Besetzung und Crew, Kauf oder Kostüme nach Maß.

Was wir brauchen

Wir wollen, um Geld für erhöhen:

Vermieten Sie Longhorn Caverns für mindestens ein paar Stunden oder den ganzen Tag für die Geschichte des Drehs.
Pay-und Futtermittelproduktion Besetzung und Crew
Sende Produktions-Crew einschließlich des Editors und After Effects Künstler
Kauf / Miete Zusatzausstattung
Kostüme, Requisiten, Blumen
Gas, Reisen, Hotels und für die beiden unterschiedlichen Drehtage

Was Sie erhalten

Es gibt zahlreiche Belohnungen, die Sie mit Ihrem Beitrag auch erhalten:

Digitale Downloads von weiteren Verlust, ein ganzes Album von Decoded Feedback einschließlich Diskonnekt, seltene Mischung oder unveröffentlichten Track, oder sogar Decodiert Bewertungen nie veröffentlicht erste Demo-Album.
48 Stunden voraus Ansicht des Videos
Ihren Namen mit einem Dankeschön in den Credits des Youtube Musikvideo Seite oder ihr neues Album Booklet verewigt haben
Konzertkarten oder ein Treffen mit der Band und an der Show Austin begrüßen am Samstag 6/29/13
Seien Sie am Set während der Geschichte des Videodreh
Für Musiker, wird Decoded Feedback remix eines Ihrer elektronischen Tracks
Walk on Rolle in einem zukünftigen Projekt Odyssey Creative Entertainment
Die unglaublichste Geschenk von allen, wird Decoded Feedback schreiben und komponieren ein persönliches Lied für dich.

Die Auswirkungen

Je mehr wir erhöhen, je länger wir die Höhle zu mieten, desto mehr werden wir die Besetzung und Crew, die bessere Ausrüstung wir kaufen oder mieten können, und wir werden eine höhere Videoqualität bezahlen können.

Decoded Feedback wurden zu schaffen unglaubliche Musik seit Mitte der 90er Jahre und haben nur eine andere offizielle Musik-Video, und dies wäre der erste, wo sie tatsächlich erscheinen in. sein

Der Regisseur, Redakteur und Kameramann dieses Musikvideo ist ein preisgekrönter Filmemacher, zahlreiche Kurzfilme, Werbespots und Musikvideos, einschließlich der neuesten Musik-Video für Die Krupps, Risikofaktor gerichtet hat.

Weitere Möglichkeiten zu helfen

Für diejenigen unter Ihnen, die nicht dazu beitragen, würden wir schätzen Sie teilen diese Seite mit allen möglich.

Ich glaube wirklich, das wird ein außergewöhnliches Musikvideo und als ein großes Werkzeug verwendet werden, um die unglaublichen Talente von Decoded Feedback zu fördern. Ich danke Ihnen allen für Ihre Unterstützung.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY 

Hello there my name is James Kenney. I was born and raised in Portland, Oregon.  I started singing and writing songs at age 11 and haven't stopped since.  My dream has always been to share my voice with as many people as possible.  And through my second time on X Factor this season, I was able to do that.


I've been so grateful for all the support I've received.  People keep saying to me, "Don't give up." Well, your words have been a major inspiration.  People have also been asking for music, and this is my chance to fulfill your requests.  I'll be recording an EP trilogy to cover all my bases:  one entitled "Covers," comprised of songs I sang on The X Factor along with other cover faves of my own; a second called "Songs In 3/4," inspired by classic soul; and a third EP called "I Am James Kenney" that will be all new songs I will be writing just for this project. 

One of my favorite quotes is "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans," by John Lennon.  Because it's costly to make music, and I have a family to support, I haven't had the means to record a lot of my own music.  That's why your contributions are so crucial for me to complete this project and let my voice be heard. 


FUNDING THE DREAM

I need to raise at least $15,000 to get this project off the ground.  And, believe it or not, that's being conservative.  These EPs will be recorded in some of the best studios in LA and feature some of the most well-respected and accomplished musicians in the world.  My goal is to make all three of these EPs sound just as good as any record made by a major label.  The difference is their budget is hundreds of thousands of dollars.  But with the level of talent I have on my side, we will make these songs sound pristine and give you something quite special and beautiful to listen to. 

Please look to the right and see the list of incentives I've come up with for your pledge.  Pretty fun stuff all the way from just getting a single song for a buck to hanging for lunch to having me give you a private concert in your own living room.

If I don't reach my goal (which I pray doesn't happen), I will still record as much of the project as financially possible.  Even if it's just one or two EPs, I WILL get you some music to listen to.  That is the promise I make to you.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can’t contribute, and I totally get it.  But I can still use your help:

  • Share my dream and this page with your family & friends with the tools above or use this link: igg.me/at/jameskenney
  • Share my video: http://youtu.be/KAZZr0EPDok
  • Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/IamJamesKenney
  • Like my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/IamJamesKenney
  • Follow me on Instagram: http://instagram.com/iamjameskenney
  • Subscribe to my YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/IamJamesKenney

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and for your support!!
story_txt:
SHORT SUMMARY Hello there my name is James Kenney. I was born and raised in Portland, Oregon.  I started singing and writing songs at age 11 and haven't stopped since.  My dream has always been to share my voice with as many people as possible.  And through my second time on X Factor this season, I was able to do that.I've been so grateful for all the support I've received.  People keep saying to me, "Don't give up." Well, your words have been a major inspiration.  People have also been asking for music, and this is my chance to fulfill your requests.  I'll be recording an EP trilogy to cover all my bases:  one entitled "Covers," comprised of songs I sang on The X Factor along with other cover faves of my own; a second called "Songs In 3/4," inspired by classic soul; and a third EP called "I Am James Kenney" that will be all new songs I will be writing just for this project. One of my favorite quotes is "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans," by John Lennon.  Because it's costly to make music, and I have a family to support, I haven't had the means to record a lot of my own music.  That's why your contributions are so crucial for me to complete this project and let my voice be heard. FUNDING THE DREAMI need to raise at least $15,000 to get this project off the ground.  And, believe it or not, that's being conservative.  These EPs will be recorded in some of the best studios in LA and feature some of the most well-respected and accomplished musicians in the world.  My goal is to make all three of these EPs sound just as good as any record made by a major label.  The difference is their budget is hundreds of thousands of dollars.  But with the level of talent I have on my side, we will make these songs sound pristine and give you something quite special and beautiful to listen to. Please look to the right and see the list of incentives I've come up with for your pledge.  Pretty fun stuff all the way from just getting a single song for a buck to hanging for lunch to having me give you a private concert in your own living room.If I don't reach my goal (which I pray doesn't happen), I will still record as much of the project as financially possible.  Even if it's just one or two EPs, I WILL get you some music to listen to.  That is the promise I make to you.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPSome people just can’t contribute, and I totally get it.  But I can still use your help:
Share my dream and this page with your family & friends with the tools above or use this link: igg.me/at/jameskenney
Share my video: http://youtu.be/KAZZr0EPDok
Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/IamJamesKenney
Like my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/IamJamesKenney
Follow me on Instagram: http://instagram.com/iamjameskenney
Subscribe to my YouTube channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/IamJamesKenney
Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and for your support!!

story:
The Story:

So, a few weeks ago we were presented with one of the most amazing opportunities of our career. We were offered three shows on the West Coast for the last ever VANS WARPED TOUR! Needless to say we were freaking out! This is an opportunity that literally only comes once in a lifetime!

We knew we had to accept the offer, and in typical Blameshift fashion we would somehow figure out the logistics (how we would get there from the East Coast, what gear we would play, where we would stay and how we would get around). Then to add to the craziness, we came up with the idea of recording a new song while we are out in California. As most of you know our producer, Erik Ron (Godsmack, New Years Day) is based out of North Hollywood and it's not often that we make our way to California. Plus, it's been way too long since we've gotten in the studio! So, we made the decision to attempt the impossible! 

 

We Have Officially Lost Our Minds:

To pull this all off in less than a month is a HUGE undertaking both financially and mentally ;) But, we've pulled off crazy things like this before...all with your help! Over the years you have been our backbone! People ask us all the time how we have accomplished so much as an independent band and it all comes back to you guys.You have supported us and helped us every step of the way.

Your support will help us get to California to play the final Vans Warped Tour on the Shiragirl Stage and will get us back into the studio to record a brand new single! The coolest part about this new song is this will be the first time our rhythm section (Mike LaRoche & Jeff Maurer) record & write new music with Blameshift. This is something we've been excited about for a few years! 

 

 

How Your Support Will Help Us:

We promise to give all of our amazing donators behind the scenes access, perks and so much more. Any donation at all helps us pull this off! Your donation will specifically help us pay for: 

  • 4 Round Trip Tickets to California
  • A Vehicle Rental to Get from Show to Show (We aren't able to take our bus)
  • A Place to Stay for About 10 days (Could be the vehicle we rent lol)
  • Studio Time with Erik Ron to Record a Brand New Blameshift Song
  • A Million Other Little Expenses

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We know that this is an extremely short campaign. We were put on a huge time constraint and we are trying to achieve the impossible in about 3 weeks! So, if you aren't able to donate at this time, you can still help us get the word out there! We are up for the challenge of making this tour and new music a reality and we know that you guys are the only way we can make it happen! 

Thanks so much for all your love and support! 

xoxo,

Jenny, Tim, Mike & Jeff

story:
My name is Anna Kavalerova, I am a Russian born pianist and I am planning on recording a new CD with a program of variations for piano. I hope you can help me to share my music!The program will include R.Schumann Symphonic Etudes, op.13, S.Rachmaninoff Variations on the theme of Corelli, op.42 and N.Kapustin Variations op.41. 

The recording will take place in Jerusalem Music Center Mishkenot Sheananim, Israel. The CD will be published and distributed by Solo-Musica Recording Label (Germany) and will appear on all digital channels, like Spotify and Apple Music. 

Why this recording is important for me?

I hope this project will be one more step in my growth as a musician and as a human being. The place of an artist in a chain between a composer and an audience can be seen from different points of view. 

One of them - delivering the ideas that composer expressed though ourselves to the audience and making the music alive in time. 

From a different point of view we (musicians) live our lifes through the music, with it’s challenges, curves and transformations. Expressing in the variety of music, the variety of life.

About the Program:

Variations as a form and genre demonstrate magnificent skills of composers to develop the musical theme, to show it in different shapes, forms and styles using musical language; and to deliver the idea, that is concentrated in the theme all the way through the piece. 

I chose to present for this CD three different pieces written in the form of Variations. Those three cycles present different paths of development, both technically and emotionally, using the same musical form. In R.Schumann's "Symphonic Etudes" the theme passes all the way from a funeral to a victory march. S.Rachmaninoff's Variations on the Theme of Corelli is a deep, tragic and dramatic life story. And N.Kapustins Variations op.41 shows us unusual view on classical music through the lens of jazz.

About me: 

Russian born pianist Anna Kavalerova has established herself as a refined, intelligent musician, who is well-versed in a diversity of styles. In her interpretation she acquires instrumental brilliance, emotional maturity, and a varied tonal palette.

As a soloist and chamber musician she regularly appears with performances in Israel, European countries, Russia, China, and Japan. She has also been participating in music festivals, such as the Aurora Chamber Music Festival (Sweden), the Grieg-Tchaikovsky Festival (Russia), the Suolahti Summer Music Festival (Finland), and the Kol HaMusica Chamber Music Festival in Kfar Blum (Israel). Anna has performed with several orchestras in Russia and Ukraine, the Kaunas Symphony Orchestra (Lithuania), as well as the Rishon Le-TzionSymphony Orchestra, the Jerusalem Camerata, and the Haifa Symphony Orchestra (Israel). Several of her concerts have been recorded by Israel Radio.

After graduating the Moscow State Tchaikovsky Conservatory in 2012, Anna moved to Israel, where in 2015 she completed her master's degree with Professor Emanuel Krasovsky at the Buchman-Mehta School of Music, Tel Aviv University.  Among other teachers, Anna worked with Professor Alexei Nasedkin, Professor Nina Kogan, Professor Massimiliano Ferrati, and Professor Yaron Rosental.  Anna participated in the masterclasses of well-known musicians, such as Lazar Berman, Vladimir Krainev, Steven Kovachevich, Murray Perahia, and Robert Levin.

During her studies, Anna won several international competitions in Russia and Europe. She was the recipient of grants from Vladimir Kraynev, as well as from the Vladimir Spivakov International Foundation, and is a laureate of the Russian Performance Arts Foundation. Anna was acclaimed as an outstanding musician at the Tel Hai Piano Masterclasses (Israel), and received the Marina Bondarenko Memorial Prize. She won First Prize at the Yasha Bistritsky International Piano Concerto Competition that led her to performances with the Israel Symphony Orchestra. In 2013 she was awarded the Dorothy Mackenzie Artist’s Recognition Prize at the International Keyboard Institute and Festival (New York). Anna also won Second Prize at the San Dona di Piave International Piano Competition, the Gran Prix at the International Piano Competition "Lazar Berman" in Italy, First Prize at the Gabala International Piano Competition in 2016 (Azerbaijan), and the 2017 Clamo International Piano Competition in Murcia, Spain.

 

You can check more informaction on the personal website www.annakavalerova.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hayley Ryerson, and I am a fiddler & composer residing in Nova Scotia, Canada. I'm raising funds to record a collection of Celtic music called, 'Both Sides of The Water.'  The release is April 7, 2020. This campaign has several perks you can choose from, ranging from 5$ to 1000$ (on a mobile, swipe right to view all perks; on a tablet or computer, view right side bar o view perks. Click on each perk to learn more about it!). Thank you for your time in viewing my campaign video, FAQs, and perks! Your support is creating positive work for my colleagues and I, making a beautiful collection of tunes become a reality, and supporting a young composer and artist.

This record will be a meaningful collection of 13 tracks, including many beloved traditional tunes, 5 original tunes, 3 tunes by fellow contemporary Celtic composers, and 1 original poem. This album will be a valuable record in my development as a player, composer, interpreter, and artist. It will feature musicians with whom I have been playing and performing over the past 3 years,  as well as many invited musicians to add a rich variety of instrumental textures to the arrangements on the album.  

Creating 'Both Sides of The Water' is important to me; the album presented itself to me in its entirety one year ago, asking to be made. I have met challenges in attempting to fund the album process myself, which is why I am reaching out for support with this campaign. So I can be able to record & release this collection of music that so wants to see the light of day, to reach your ears, heart, storyline, and toe-tappin' feet. 

Receiving your support will be an absolute delight, and it will be so fulfilling to send you a copy of this album! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This project has several perks you can choose from, ranging from 5$ to 1000$. You can also make a custom contribution if you'd prefer to contribute a different amount, or would like to donate without a perk in return.

All of the funds raised in this campaign will cover the costs associated with the 4 phases of this album's creation.  The project goal of 12,000$ is informed by Hayley's industry experience and is designed to provide a frugal yet professional quality album process & product.  

The process and budget design for 'Both Sides of The Water' looks like this:

1. Production. This is when the musicians perform in studio to create the tracks for the album. Costs associated with this phase include artist fees, engineer fees & studio rental. 

The budget fro this phase is 44.5% of the project goal. This provides the project with 3 days in our chosen studio with 4 bed track musicians on those days, 6 short overdub sessions, and an engineer and assistant for all sessions. 

2. Post-Production. This is when a skilled audio engineer takes the raw recorded tracks we've produced and works with them until they are happy to be in your CD player, or another digital home. In this phase tracks are edited, mixed, and mastered. There is so much creativity  and skill in this step... engineers are the hidden start behind every tasty piece of recorded music and we look forward to giving our engineer a comfortable working pace and time to get artful with the mix!

Costs associated with this phase are engineer fees and studio rental. The budget for this phase in 20.9% of the project goal. 

3. Design. This is when a visual artist develops a visual representation for the album. I have chosen a beautiful artist to work with, whose muse is sea creatures. I cannot wait to collaborate with her to develop a stunning cover art commission. Also in this phase is album design. A designer will incorporate the cover art into the other panels of the album and format the album notes, with all the juicy tidbits of tune names and inspirations, and names of musicians on the track.

Costs associated with this phase are commission fees, and hiring a designer for the album design. The budget for this phase is 10.5% of the project goal. 

4. Manufacturing & Distribution. This is when we get to print the album so we can share, ship, and share some more! It is also when the album will make its way to its digital home, CDBaby. 

Costs associated with this phase are manufacturing fees, and online platform fees. The budget for this phase is 22.1% of the budget. 

5) Indiegogo's service fees @ 2% of project budget.

The above budget will support the artistic vision for this album and provide an enjoyable, efficient, resourced process- the means being able to feature a rich variety  of instrumental textures on the album, having a comfortable studio schedule during the recording process to allow premium performances to come through the musicians, and including time enough during mixing to let it be a creative element and felt-presence on the final album's aesthetic. 

If the campaign goal is not fulfilled, 'Both Sides of the Water' will still be created with the support we do receive. We will make adjustments to the process and resulting album (eg: less instrumental textures, less studio time, more functional mix), and will be happy to realize it how we can.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Please share the campaign widely within your network- friends, family, musical peers, lovers of traditional, Celtic, folk and roots music, or anyone else you think may be interested in the project.

I truly appreciate your support and involvement in this project. THANK YOU!!

story:
Project Description and Background

After 22 years of studying North Indian Hindustani music I am ready to make a series of Dhrupad vocal audio recordings. These will be pressed into CDs and released online through all streaming platforms. (CDs are still a popular form of audio storage for the Hindustani music community, and allows for more detailed program notes and information about the music.) 

The primary drummer for these recordings is Pandit Akhilesh Gundecha, a living master of the pakhawaj drum, and one of my Gurus. I am deeply honored that he is lending his talents to this project.

These recordings will be in honor of my Gurus, with deep respect for their endless support and encouragement, and in memory of Pandit Ramakant Gundecha, who unfortunately passed from this world to the next last year.

My journey into Hindustani music started when I was very young. A full explanation can be found here: https://paytonmacdonald.com/dhrupad-biography/

I first studied tabla, and then in 2011 I switched to Dhrupad vocal and I've been a disciple of the Dhrupad masters the Gundecha Brothers. I spent nine months in India as a Fulbright Scholar, plus many other trips to India, plus I've been learning here when my Gurus are in North America, plus Skype lessons. I made my professional debut as a Dhrupad singer in 2014 and am now finally ready to record. I have toured all over the U.S., Canada, Europe, and India, performing on major festivals. I've also made five YouTube videos of my Dhrupad singing.

I will record the following ragas, in full exposition of all four movements, with alap, jor, jhala, and bandish:

  • Todi
  • Ahir Bhairav
  • Lalit
  • Bhimpalasi
  • Madhmaad Sarang
  • Jog
  • Malkauns
  • Bihag

The final result will be six full-length recordings.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I seek support so I can record, mix, and master the audio files, as well as press hard copies of the CDs. I also have personnel costs with the audio engineers, graphic designers, and honorariums for the drummers. Here are the levels you can contribute:

  • $10-$50, Friend, name listed on website page for recordings
  • $51-$150, Two signed CDs sent to you, and name listed on website
  • $151-$300, Three signed CDs sent to you, and name listed on website
  • $301-$500, Six signed CDs sent to you, name listed on website, and a meal with Payton at his house in New Jersey and he'll show you the process for the recordings, including the DAW files, and other information.
  • $501-$1000, Six signed CDs sent to you, name listed on website, and private house concert for you (for concerts outside of the NYC area some travel expenses may be necessary)

Budget:

  • Recording/mixing/mastering costs = $1,000
  • Artist Fees for pakhawaj drummers = $1,000
  • Graphic Designer (through Fiverr) = $200
  • Microphone (Rhode NT 1-A) for home recording portion = $270
  • CD Duplication = $1,500
  • Miscellaneous = $30

Total cost: $4,000

 

The Impact

These recordings will further the ancient art of Dhrupad. Dhrupad is an oral tradition, guru-shishya-parampara. The music isn't written down, but rather passed down from guru to disciple, one at a time, generation after generation. Recordings are an essential part of this oral tradition. I am very lucky that I have learned these ragas sitting at the feet of the master Gundecha Brothers, who learned them from their gurus (Z.F. and Z.M. Dagar), and so forth, back 19 generations in the Dagar bani.

These recordings will add another perspective to this tradition. They will serve as a marker of my development so far, as well as another guidepost for future generations of Dhrupad students. My Gurus have given me permission and encouragement to make these recordings. Dhrupad is one of the crown jewels of Indian culture, and preserving it through audio recordings is essential. Although I'm not Indian, Gurujis have never given that a second thought. Above all this music is human, and the fact that people from all over the world are now singing it at a high level only strengthens and deepens the art form and the tradition.

I've spent tens of thousands of hours in deep riaz (practice), learning the nuances of this music, and am ready to share it with the world through professional audio recordings.

 

Probability of Finishing the Project

I've made over 20 recordings so far in my career as a percussionist and singer and I know exactly what the costs and time commitment are. I am 100% confident that I will complete this project, and in fact I've already recorded one of the ragas and it turned out very well, and Akhilesh Guruji has already made his drumming track, so the project is well underway. I just need your support to finish it.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't offer financial support that's okay, but you could help by asking people to get the word out about this campaign. I would sincerely appreciate any publicity you can generate about this project. The Indian-American community and the Yoga communities are especially interested in this music.
story_txt:
Project Description and Background
After 22 years of studying North Indian Hindustani music I am ready to make a series of Dhrupad vocal audio recordings. These will be pressed into CDs and released online through all streaming platforms. (CDs are still a popular form of audio storage for the Hindustani music community, and allows for more detailed program notes and information about the music.) 
The primary drummer for these recordings is Pandit Akhilesh Gundecha, a living master of the pakhawaj drum, and one of my Gurus. I am deeply honored that he is lending his talents to this project.
These recordings will be in honor of my Gurus, with deep respect for their endless support and encouragement, and in memory of Pandit Ramakant Gundecha, who unfortunately passed from this world to the next last year.
My journey into Hindustani music started when I was very young. A full explanation can be found here: https://paytonmacdonald.com/dhrupad-biography/
I first studied tabla, and then in 2011 I switched to Dhrupad vocal and I've been a disciple of the Dhrupad masters the Gundecha Brothers. I spent nine months in India as a Fulbright Scholar, plus many other trips to India, plus I've been learning here when my Gurus are in North America, plus Skype lessons. I made my professional debut as a Dhrupad singer in 2014 and am now finally ready to record. I have toured all over the U.S., Canada, Europe, and India, performing on major festivals. I've also made five YouTube videos of my Dhrupad singing.
I will record the following ragas, in full exposition of all four movements, with alap, jor, jhala, and bandish:

Todi
Ahir Bhairav
Lalit
Bhimpalasi
Madhmaad Sarang
Jog
Malkauns
Bihag

The final result will be six full-length recordings.
 

What I Need & What You Get
I seek support so I can record, mix, and master the audio files, as well as press hard copies of the CDs. I also have personnel costs with the audio engineers, graphic designers, and honorariums for the drummers. Here are the levels you can contribute:

$10-$50, Friend, name listed on website page for recordings
$51-$150, Two signed CDs sent to you, and name listed on website
$151-$300, Three signed CDs sent to you, and name listed on website
$301-$500, Six signed CDs sent to you, name listed on website, and a meal with Payton at his house in New Jersey and he'll show you the process for the recordings, including the DAW files, and other information.
$501-$1000, Six signed CDs sent to you, name listed on website, and private house concert for you (for concerts outside of the NYC area some travel expenses may be necessary)

Budget:

Recording/mixing/mastering costs = $1,000
Artist Fees for pakhawaj drummers = $1,000
Graphic Designer (through Fiverr) = $200
Microphone (Rhode NT 1-A) for home recording portion = $270
CD Duplication = $1,500
Miscellaneous = $30

Total cost: $4,000
 

The Impact
These recordings will further the ancient art of Dhrupad. Dhrupad is an oral tradition, guru-shishya-parampara. The music isn't written down, but rather passed down from guru to disciple, one at a time, generation after generation. Recordings are an essential part of this oral tradition. I am very lucky that I have learned these ragas sitting at the feet of the master Gundecha Brothers, who learned them from their gurus (Z.F. and Z.M. Dagar), and so forth, back 19 generations in the Dagar bani.
These recordings will add another perspective to this tradition. They will serve as a marker of my development so far, as well as another guidepost for future generations of Dhrupad students. My Gurus have given me permission and encouragement to make these recordings. Dhrupad is one of the crown jewels of Indian culture, and preserving it through audio recordings is essential. Although I'm not Indian, Gurujis have never given that a second thought. Above all this music is human, and the fact that people from all over the world are now singing it at a high level only strengthens and deepens the art form and the tradition.
I've spent tens of thousands of hours in deep riaz (practice), learning the nuances of this music, and am ready to share it with the world through professional audio recordings.
 

Probability of Finishing the Project
I've made over 20 recordings so far in my career as a percussionist and singer and I know exactly what the costs and time commitment are. I am 100% confident that I will complete this project, and in fact I've already recorded one of the ragas and it turned out very well, and Akhilesh Guruji has already made his drumming track, so the project is well underway. I just need your support to finish it.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't offer financial support that's okay, but you could help by asking people to get the word out about this campaign. I would sincerely appreciate any publicity you can generate about this project. The Indian-American community and the Yoga communities are especially interested in this music.

story:
If you like what you see then please share my campaign with all your friends so we can make this happen together! 

Crowdfunding Campaign for "Join up the Dots"

My name is Pete Kavanagh and I am a singer-songwriter from Naas, Co.Kildare in Ireland. 

My debut album "Join up the Dots" is set for release in November 2021. To date, the album has been completely self-funded and is fully recorded. The pandemic has severely affected so many of us and as a musician unable to ply his trade, my avenue for income has been seriously diminished.

I am asking for your support to help get the album over the line.  In return I am offering a number of great perks, exclusive to Indiegogo. 

Your support will enable me to bring new thought-provoking and emotionally charged songs into the world. The album blends folk, blues, rock and country with a strong Americana feel. Anyone who knows me as a songwriter and performer will attest that I put my heart and soul into my music. My lyrics are honest and raw - they're not always pretty but they're real. 

This album has been a labour of love, recorded over the past two years with a host of incredible musicians.  I have released two singles to date-namely, To Hold The Red Rose and Hold On. Both singles were well received and gained airplay worldwide. My debut single reached number 3 in the Irish iTunes singer-songwriter charts and reached the semi-finals of the prestigious International Songwriting Competition, from over 26.000 entries. ​

What I Need

Your support. My goal is to raise €3,500 which will go towards the cost of

  • Album completion (mixing and mastering)
  • CD production & shipping
  • Vinyl production & shipping
  • Musician fees
  • PR and marketing
     

What You Get

In return for your contribution I am offering a selection of great perks including:

  • Pre-release Digital Download and/or CD
  • Vinyl (subject to availability)
  • Signed copies of the album with a personalised, handwritten message
  • ** SOLD OUT** Early bird tickets to the launch night at The Moat Theatre, Naas. 
  • T-shirts
  • Handwritten lyrics (With CD/Digital Download)
  • Custom song
  • Personal performance* (limited to the Republic of Ireland)
  • Semi-Acoustic Guitar **SOLD PRIVATELY**
  • Various bundle options

 

Risks & Challenges

The best part about this project, is that the risks regarding the music are minimal. The recording and artwork for the album is complete. Therefore, with the exception of some final mixing and mastering, the album is ready. 

If I don't hit my target, I may not be in a position to produce the album on vinyl. If this occurs and you have chosen vinyl as your perk, you will receive a full refund. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you are not in a position to donate at this time, however,  you can still help by sharing my campaign with your friends and family!

Here are some other ways that you can also help me out!

  • Share this campaign on social media. You could also tag a friend you think will enjoy my music.
  • Follow me on Spotify or YouTube.

story:
Since 2016, Born Dad has been making genre-bending pop/surf punk songs about quitting your job, ghosting, sexist leftists, and more!

After three years of writing songs and playing shows all over DC, we recorded our first LP in the summer of 2019 at Headroom Studios in Philadelphia. We’re so excited and proud of the album we’ve made, and we cannot wait to share Born Dad's Greatest Hits with you! We’ve set up this campaign so you can pre-order the record (coming out in mid-March!!) and get some exclusive merch items that won’t be sold again. And you’ll be providing crucial support for us as we fund this record and get our music out into the world!

What We Need

Our recording and production process so far has been completely self-funded. We’ve learned that making a great sounding record isn’t cheap!

We're looking to raise $2,000 to help us recoup the costs of finishing the mixing and mastering process, as well as produce CDs and the awesome merch items that we’re offering exclusively for this campaign. Here's a breakdown of where your money will be going:

Mixing: $800

Mastering: $750

CD/Perk production and shipping: $450

Any funds raised beyond our goal of $2,000 will go right back into the band. We want to write new songs and share them with all of you! We want to make new merch items! We want to play outside of DC!

And we also have some special extra items planned for our stretch goals if we get past $2,000.

What You Get

Your pledge will not go unrewarded! We have a ton of rad perks we're offering, many of which are only going to be available to folks who back the campaign. So let everyone know how much you love Born Dad at every price point!

Obvs you can pre-order a digital download code (the Cool Dad perk), but we also have some rad physical merch too. (Also, make sure to check out the section below on shipping details! tl;dr if you need to have items shipped to you, make sure to select the shipping add-on perk when you're checking out!)


Hot Dad: Let the world know you are an Official Born Dad Boifriend with this pennant pin!


Hip Dad: Fanny packs are back baby! And nothing is more in style than being on time, so order this fanny and experience being at the height of fashion and the envy of all the other punks at the show.

   
Rad Dad: Official Born Dad mascot Potato is Dad to the Bone, and you can be too with this campaign exclusive t-shirt that will never be printed again. Celebrate Born Dad's three year long "Dad to the Bone" tour with this commemorative shirt that will for sure be a collector's item when we're rich and famous!!

Adventure Dad: Let one of the Dads be YOUR boifriend for a day! You can choose Zach, Rae, or Mary Alice to hang out with. You can go get drinks/dinner or go see that movie no one else will go to with you! Maybe we'll wanna splurge and go to one of the museums you actually have to pay to get in to! The options are limitless! (Except for location, which is limited to the DC area only. Although, if you wanna pay to have us travel somewhere else....get in touch).


*CLAIMED* Sports Dad: This past summer, a friend of drummer Zach's sent him this hat and an unsigned note via Etsy as a birthday present and he lost his mind for 3 days trying to figure out where it came from! (He figured it out eventually). Now this completely unique, one-of-a-kind baseball cap can be yours!

Show Dad: Want your own *~private~* Born Dad show? We'll play your back yard, your living room, your abandoned, yet structurally sound barns, or anywhere in the greater DC area that has electricity! We're offering two of these shows, and we encourage folks to go in on these together because we love friendship and we love playing shows.

Shipping Deets

The default option for all physical merch item perks will be picking up in-person from the Dads. We know so many of our fans and friends are based in DC, and we don't want you to have to pay for shipping if you live just down the street, y'know? Also, did you know, shipping is expensive when you're a small operation like ours!

But that means if you are not in the DC area or do not want to pick up your physical items in person from the Dads, please make sure to select the Shipping add-on perk when you're checking out, otherwise, we won't be able to get you your stuff! (Or, more likely, we'll have to coordinate with you after the fact and it'd probably be a lot of emails and Venmo coordination and honestly that just sounds like a lot of work for both of us!)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, but want to help out, that's awesome! You can share our campaign on whatever social media you like using, and make sure to tag us @born_dad (on instagram) or @BornDadDC (on twitter)! Stream our songs on Spotify or bandcamp! Tell your friends irl! Anything helps and we are eternally grateful for it.

    Risks & Challenges

    Worry not! There is no risk of the album not coming out. However, this campaign will make it feasible to recoup some of our costs.

    Born Dad is a pretty DIY operation. We book our own shows, we make most of our own merch, and as we said above, we have funded the making of this album so far out of the money we have made playing shows over the past couple years and a lot from our own pockets. We don't have support from a label, and we want to keep Born Dad going as long as we can without breaking the bank. This campaign will help make that possible!

    We love and appreciate all the support we have gotten over the past few years, and we want to keep making more Born Dad content for you! Thank you.

    (All band photos by Mariah Miranda)

Tell your friends irl! Anything helps and we are eternally grateful for it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Damien Boggs and I'm a singer-songwriter living in Columbia, Tennessee. I was raised in southeastern Louisiana surrounded by music from an early age. I began writing and performing in Baton Rouge in my early 20's. I moved to the Nashville area and started to really learn what it meant to be a "musician". This project is very important to me and acts as a measuring stick for me as an artist. Your support will allow us to release these songs and begin the process of touring and promoting this record. We have poured countless hours of our souls into this record and are really excited to share it with you. With your support, this will be just the beginning of a very productive and musical period. When we reach our goal, we will be able to continually provide new music and content at the high level that you, the listener, deserves.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $5000. These funds will pay for the production, mastering, and release of this project. Making a quality album is not only a challenge for an independent artist, it can be nearly impossible without the support of an amazing fan base. I am blessed to have an awesome support team and I am so excited to work with you in this campaign. I have come up with some great perks in gratitude of your support. You can claim perks that range from a Tshirt to a full band house concert and lots of cool things in between. When we reach our goal, the turnaround of the release will be quick and exciting. In the event we miss our goal, I will try to release the songs as singles throughout the year, but we are gonna make this goal and release a great record. This record is your record, not mine or the band's. We are only able to do this because of you and we are GRATEFUL!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, tell your friends and other music lovers about this! 

Share on your social media and any other way you would like!

story:
Colour My Mind

                            

I am Lonely Eddie a singer, songwriter and multi instrumentalist from Exeter, U.K. I write atmospheric, emotional piano pop straight from the heart.  At live shows you will find me doing a lot of multi-tasking, surrounded by pedals, drum pads and synths performing as a one man band.

I have made this campaign to help me give to you what you want - an album! All of the songs are written and I want nothing more than to get them recorded for you.
Getting my music professionally recorded is so important to me as it gives you as a listener the true, full experience of my songs. So much time, thought and passion has been put into writing this album and I want you all to hear it as I envision it. 

I am hoping to make it available to you on as many platforms as possible; Vinyl's, CD's, Spotify, itunes etc along with that and the actual studio time, funding it fully alone is just not something I am able to do. That's where you come in.

I have made some simple and easy to digest perks and bundles including some very limited framed album artwork, a handful of house shows and some T-shirts - see t-shirt artwork below.

                               Where Your Money Goes.
 

£970 towards the pressing of 300 vinyl.
£480 towards 500 CD's.
£300 towards 50 hand printed T-Shirts.
£1750 towards half of the studio time.


I am so grateful for you taking the time to look at my page and I understand that some people just aren't able to contribute, but don't worry, you can still help! Please spread the word, show your friends and family, come to a gig and use the share tools at the top of the page!

 

Thank you, you beautiful, beautiful humans.
