story:
Campaign Summary

My name is Brian Rice and I am a full time percussionist with a specialty in Brazilian percussion, in particular the Brazilian tambourine called "pandeiro". Over the last 22 years I have been performing choro music with many masters of the genre and have recorded with many choro groups. My dedication to this music led to the creation of the Berkeley Festival of Choro of which I am Artistic Director.

This project is very special to me because it is my first full recording project with my long-time friend and collaborator, Almir Cortes. Originally from Bahia, Almir is a master of the mandolin and guitar and is currently Professor of Music at the University of Rio de Janeiro’s Villa-Lobos Institute. I am also very pleased to have the expert hands of Nando Duarte on the 7-string guitar. Nando is from Rio de Janeiro and currently lives in Los Angeles where he is a composer and producer of music for commercials. He studied with the choro guitar master Dino 7 Cordas.

This CD will be a testament to the special musical connection between the three of us. Our goal is to capture the playfulness of our performance, and also to present less common choro songs to our audience. We plan to invite a few special guests to play on select songs which will add to the CD’s variety.

We aim to raise $4,500 from this campaign. Though this amount will not cover every cost of the project, it will offset the great expenses of studio recording, which can cost $500 per day or more. Following the initial recording, the music needs to be mixed in a studio, mastered for reproduction, artwork created and the CD reproduced. Some of these funds may go to offsetting the cost of flying in Almir from Rio, and Nando from LA, to Oakland where we will record.  

As a contributor, you can be confident that you will have helped us achieve a milestone in our trio's career. This CD will help us develop the music we play, the synergy we share, and shore up our future with a product that represents us and spreads this beautiful music to others.

For your donation of $30 or more you will receive a copy of the CD. We also offer other perks including multiple signed CDs, free entry to one of our concerts, or even a private concert for you and your guests, depending on your level of support.

Choro music has the ability to draw in aficionados of both jazz and classical music because of its crossover appeal and beauty, adding to the wonderful diversity of musical ideas and creativity so needed in our world today. I truly believe that music and art is at the heart of a vibrant, thoughtful and caring society.  

I hope that you will contribute today and help us reach our goal. Watch for our CD this summer! 

Thank you,

Brian Rice, Almir Cortes and Nando Duarte - Choro Trio

P.S. Please help us get the word out about our campaign and upcoming CD using social media or in other ways; don't forget Indiegogo has robust sharing tools.
story_txt:
Campaign Summary
My name is Brian Rice and I am a full time percussionist with a specialty in Brazilian percussion, in particular the Brazilian tambourine called "pandeiro". Over the last 22 years I have been performing choro music with many masters of the genre and have recorded with many choro groups. My dedication to this music led to the creation of the Berkeley Festival of Choro of which I am Artistic Director.
This project is very special to me because it is my first full recording project with my long-time friend and collaborator, Almir Cortes. Originally from Bahia, Almir is a master of the mandolin and guitar and is currently Professor of Music at the University of Rio de Janeiro’s Villa-Lobos Institute. I am also very pleased to have the expert hands of Nando Duarte on the 7-string guitar. Nando is from Rio de Janeiro and currently lives in Los Angeles where he is a composer and producer of music for commercials. He studied with the choro guitar master Dino 7 Cordas.
This CD will be a testament to the special musical connection between the three of us. Our goal is to capture the playfulness of our performance, and also to present less common choro songs to our audience. We plan to invite a few special guests to play on select songs which will add to the CD’s variety.
We aim to raise $4,500 from this campaign. Though this amount will not cover every cost of the project, it will offset the great expenses of studio recording, which can cost $500 per day or more. Following the initial recording, the music needs to be mixed in a studio, mastered for reproduction, artwork created and the CD reproduced. Some of these funds may go to offsetting the cost of flying in Almir from Rio, and Nando from LA, to Oakland where we will record.  
As a contributor, you can be confident that you will have helped us achieve a milestone in our trio's career. This CD will help us develop the music we play, the synergy we share, and shore up our future with a product that represents us and spreads this beautiful music to others.
For your donation of $30 or more you will receive a copy of the CD. We also offer other perks including multiple signed CDs, free entry to one of our concerts, or even a private concert for you and your guests, depending on your level of support.
Choro music has the ability to draw in aficionados of both jazz and classical music because of its crossover appeal and beauty, adding to the wonderful diversity of musical ideas and creativity so needed in our world today. I truly believe that music and art is at the heart of a vibrant, thoughtful and caring society.  
I hope that you will contribute today and help us reach our goal. Watch for our CD this summer! 
Thank you,
Brian Rice, Almir Cortes and Nando Duarte - Choro Trio
P.S. Please help us get the word out about our campaign and upcoming CD using social media or in other ways; don't forget Indiegogo has robust sharing tools.

story:
What is this campaign?

Watch the video below to find out!

 

About Us

Two years ago, a group of 18 Toronto musicians came together to record and produce an album which captured the spirit of an improvised jazz jam session. In a single day of recording, and through self-funding, Collective Order made their first record, Volume 1. The following year, the concept expanded, and CO emphasized the creation and documentation of original music composed by members of the group. Volume 2 was released to critical acclaim in the fall of 2017.

 

"Collective Order Vol. 2 is a unique project that showcases some truly original songs, excellent musicianship and the voice of Jocelyn Barth alone makes this a must-have for any jazz fan."

         —Jaymz Bee, JAZZ.FM91

 

"[Volume Two] In which we find ourselves in the midst of the first, all original, mental telepathy jazz date--and we find the bar is set pretty high... Taking solid, non-showy-for-the-sake-of-showy improv to places it’s never been, there’s something here for everyone but oddly enough, it’s solid enough that everyone will probably like everything. Yeah, it’s like that. If this isn’t a major collection of the stars of tomorrow getting it all down, then nothing is. Hot stuff."

         —Chris Spector, Midwest Record, Lake Zurich, IL, USA

 

"Jam sessions are all about shared moments and ideas; collaborative creativity. In times when concepts of community are screaming out for serious revisiting along comes a uniquely sensitive album project, Volume Two, from Collective Order. It is timely and very welcome."

         —John Devenish, Host, Dinner Jazz, JazzFM91, Toronto

 

“On the self-released Volume Two…the tracks flow by in a free and easy totally breezy funkified picnic.”

         —Mike Greenblatt – The Aquarian Weekly (NJ, USA)

​

​

Our Plan

On May 27 and 28 of 2018, we will be going into the studio to record Collective Order: Volume 3. Our vision for the new record is to create a songbook of 12 original pieces that are tied to each composer/member's personal and cultural story. 

This is where YOU come in!

Your contributions will help us cover the cost of post production (CD printing, mastering and mixing) and producing extra content such as video documentation and a live stream of the recording session on Monday May 28.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Everything that you contribute towards this project is going towards aiding the success of burgeoning young jazz musicians in Canada. With your help, this project can continue to showcase up-and-coming jazz musicians in Canada.

We've received funds from the Toronto Council from the Arts and the Ontario Council for the Arts to help with recording, mixing, mastering, printing physical copies, digital distribution, and a publicist. But even with these arts councils generous support and our own funds, the addition of some some additional pursuits such as live streaming our recording session on Monday May 28 and adding even more new members means we can still use your support.

 

How to Support this project

The best way to support any creator is by buying their product!

Pre-Ordering Vol. 3 or purchasing the physical copy of Vol 1 & Vol 2 will help us reach our goals.

If you don't have a use for CD's anymore and still want to support young Canadian talent, select the Thank You! option and we'll send you a letter on a print of the album art for Vol. 3 to be created by Rebecca MacIntosh, the same artist who created the artwork for Vol. 1 &2. Selecting the Super Thank You will get your name in the liner notes as a premium supporter and a spot for you and a +1 on the VIP list at our CD release party this fall (in Toronto, date TBA) which is sure to be a great night out.

For a more personal experience, you can even hire a Collective Order Duo or Trio to play at your event or house party- all funds going toward this project.

 

SPREAD THE WORD for a FREE DOWNLOAD!

If you're short on funds but still want this to see this succeed, then give this campaign a share! Use the hashtag #CollectiveOrder3 on any platform and we'll send you a free digital download of Volume 1.

You can also show support in person by coming to our Toronto Jazz Festival show on July 1st on the OLG Cumberland Stage.

                    

 

Our vision for Volume 3 is to create a songbook of original music that is tied to each composers personal and cultural story. We're lucky to live in Toronto, Canada, an incredibly diverse time and place founded on immigration, democracy, and collaboration. We’re excited and honored to share music from our community both as individuals and as a whole.

 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

Collective Order is:

  • Jon Foster
  • Chris Adriaanse
  • Julian Anderson-Bowes
  • Connor Walsh
  • Nebyu Yohannes 
  • Jocelyn Barth
  • Mike Campbell
  • Belinda Corpuz
  • Ewen Farncombe
  • Marie Goudy
  • Murray Heaton
  • Andrew McAnsh
  • Andrew Miller
  • Liam Stanley
  • Emily Steinwall
  • Laura Swankey
  • Sarah Thawer
  • Ethan Tilbury
  • Joel Visentin
  • Tamar Ilana ​
  • Colin Story
  • Joanna Majoko

story:
NOTE: To pre-order an LP please make sure you claim the Sacred Son 12" Vinyl LP PERK rather than clicking 'back it'.

In August 2017 I released my debut one person black metal album 'Sacred Son'. It has gone on to amass a fair amount of coverage both positive and negative which can largely be put down to what many consider an unusual and stylistically unconventional album cover.

Several people have asked me if I plan to release the album on vinyl, so after doing some research I've decided to go ahead with an initial pressing of 300 providing I can meet the manufacturing costs through pre-orders.

The album will be remastered exclusively for vinyl by James Plotkin before being pressed onto 150g 12" vinyl complete with full colour label and 3mm matt laminated spined sleeve. Every LP from this pressing will be individually numbered.

Order will be placed with the manufacturer as soon as the goal is met, with turnaround time being approximately 10 weeks.

All remaining vinyl will then go on pre-order via my Bandcamp page.

story:
UPDATE: Check out the new album & Drum-DVD Teaser:

 

Hi folks, my name is Chato and I’m the leader & main composer of the band CHATO!...duh! We do zappaesque progressive rock. In mid-January we went into the studio to record our 2nd album and we plan to release it in July 2017, just right before the Zappanale Festival ;) The album will feature 8 songs, including 1 Zappa cover song with 2 guest horn players

This time we wanna make it a bit more professional and we went into a better recording studio with a more experienced engineer/mixer with astonishing ears. THIS of course means that it will cost more money.

 

So here’s the deal:

 

We are independent and our budget is tight. I can barely pay for the studio sessions, the mixing, the mastering and the pressing of the CDs. But there is still more.

We need to pay for:

  • the layout designer
  • cover artwork (yes, we have handpainted artwork from Jovana Wolf)
  • a photographer for the artwork (too big for scanning)
  • an engineer for the overdub sessions and spiffing up some other audio material for this campaign

And we would like to do promo stuff like:

  • sending out digital copies to radio stations, print & online media
  • sending out physical copies to radio stations, print & online media
  • submitting the album to the Music Promotion Network MPN (this one is pretty expensive)
  • digital distribution through iTunes & Spotify

The Cover Art (front- & backcover):

 

Even without your help we could release this album, BUT we wanna reach a bigger audience, because: Why should we make an album when almost no one gets to hear it?

 

There are still questions how to organize the artwork/layout, so:

With your help, you can make our album better, visually and by giving us a chance to enlarge our audience.

It would be the ultimate goal to pay for all the things listed above. To reach that ultimate goal, we need 1400 €.

BUT even if we don’t reach 1400 €, this crowdfunding will be successful, because every euro, dollar, pound or whatever helps to fulfill our plans to reach more people with our music, e.g. with 500€ we can pay for some of the stuff listed above

 

Some of you might think “Even if I don’t give you my money, you will release the album, so why should I help you?” Here is the answer:

 

You can use this campaign in 2 ways:

 

  1. You can pre-order our new album which is a safe way for fans to get it right in time delivered to their home. BTW this is the ONLY WAY to PRE-ORDER our new album
  2. You can get here EXCLUSIVE REWARDS which won’t be available for sale after this campaign. For example:

 

  • Download of Demos of songs from the new album and 3 demos of songs from the 1st album. A great insight for the hardcore fan with over 24 min. of demos AND you will get a PDF with information about the composition process and other trivia.
  • Half of them were available on our soundcloud page for a time, the other half is totally unreleased.
  • A copy of the lead sheet of a new 9 min. song PROGTOPIA. Here is a live version:

Instrumentation: vocals/flute, clarinet/Sax, guitar, piano/synth, bass, drums

  • Get your name into the booklet
  • Skypechat with me (Chato) for 45 min. You can use it as a guitar/music theory lesson, you can ask questions about me & my music OR we can just chat about what’s on your mind J
  • A special unplugged concert at your location, even in your living room, if that is big enough

and more, e.g. special bundles with 1st album:

and T-shirt

 

What happens if we reach more than 1400€?

 

If we manage to go beyond the 1400€ mark, it will nevertheless go into the production of this album, e.g. we can go into more detail in the editing/mixing process or the layout design. Also I want to pay the cover artist more than promised because she deserved more :)

If you have any questions, post them in the comment section.

That’s about it. I would be glad if you could help us out and hopefully we’ll see each other on the road with our new album

stay unique,

Chato

story:
The Philippines is comprised of a tapestry of cultures, each with its own unique musical tradition. Though traditional Philippine music is a rich confluence of the country’s colonial and indigenous past, it remains distinct from its various influences. Abundant art songs and folksongs detail rural experiences that capture not only pastoral imagery but Filipino traits as well. Later on, Filipino musicians educated in the Western idiom have adapted the style and flavor of these folk songs to more formalized music examples called art songs that, while are up to par with their foreign counterparts, are still distinguishably Filipino.

Despite having such a plethora of folksongs and art songs, there continues to be a dearth in documentation and preservation of such traditions. There is a lack of a comprehensive and accessible material that details not only these songs’ origin, but how such artistic gems could be performed. Other cultures have been successful not only in showcasing, but more importantly in making their artful songs a part of the great repertoire that artists all over the world perform in their own recitals and concerts.

GOALS & OBJECTIVES

•           To promote and to elevate Filipino folksongs through recital performances, and lectures.

•           To make these arrangements accessible to recital artists and enthusiasts through a produced recording

story:
FROM US TO YOU!


Hi, fellow rockers. This is Jeff from St. Elmo’s Fire. As a teenager, I started this band with a good friend of mine and vocalist lyricist, Tim Allwein. It was a long time ago in a garage far, far away (actually in Sacramento, CA). What did we do? We formed this band, we wrote, we rehearsed, we played crappy clubs, we opened for major artists, we played more crappy clubs, we moved to Hollywood in the ‘80s, we partied and mingled, we wrote more, we put out a successful single titled "Really in Love", we signed record contracts with CBS, BMG and more, we toured, we made videos, we toured some more, we released four albums, and well, you get the picture!

click here for a complete history of St. Elmo's Fire including videos and songs


More St. Elmo;s Fire info HERE


St. Elmo's Fire Facebook Campaign Page





FROM YOU TO US!

 So what is this all about?  We need your help with our new record. We want this to be a joint venture between the band and our fans who want to be part of something exciting. Something that will outlive us all! Just imagine a brand new St. Elmo’s Fire album. A melodic, ass kicking, big gang chorus, solo shredding, drum pounding, fist pumping, in your face, heavy metal tour de force! Exactly the way we used to do it. The songs are written. the demos are recorded and the record label is just waiting to release it.


                SO WHY NOW? 

Why? Because we feel it is the right time. Most of our fans know that last year, one of heavy metal’s biggest labels, Germany's Pure Steel Records honored us by re-releasing our four previous studio albums as numbered collectable limited editions.                                                                                                                         

They included holograms for authenticity, bonus tracks and 12-page CD booklets. Not only that, but they wanted a new album, which  brings us to our current project. You are probably wondering why we need funding if we have already signed with a record label. The answer is simple. As professional musicians, it is important that we maintain control of the finished musical product. The label takes care of the artwork, graphics, manufacturing, distribution and promotion. What you will be doing is helping us fund the most important part of the project, the MUSIC


     Read the Pure Steel Records newsfeed about our campaign

By having you help fund the project, instead of leaving the important creative decisions up to the record label, we get to do what we do without limitations. Call it artistic freedom, if you will, but there is actually much more to it than that. We want our fans involved this time around from the very beginning. You will have exclusive access to us while we are in the studio. We want to hear your opinions and you are welcome to ask questions and offer your feedback. In a very real way, you will be making this record with us!

Our Campaign is Getting Worldwide Press. Click the Links Below 

Nemesis Magazine (Germany)


Bel7 (Europe)




SO HOW MUCH WILL WE NEED?

Since we live in Northern California, we will record here in order to keep quality high and costs low. Consequently YOU WILL NOT help fund travelling expenses, hotels or anythinfg else other than recording, mixing and editing, plus shipping the perks. And since I will be producing again, like I did with our other albums, we can control even more. But most importantly, the music will sound killer.

At the conclusion of the campaign funding, we will start the preproduction phase and then transition to the studio sessions. You will receive constant updaftes on our timeline, expenditures and progress. Also you will be able to see the whole process as it’s happening. 
And when the album is finished, we will be release it worldwide, just like our previous albums! Pure Steel Records is distributed by “Soulfood”, one of the world’s largest media distributors. The album you help make will be everywhere, including in record stores, on the internet, downloaded on websites like Amazon and iTunes or streamed on Pandora, Spotify, Rhapsody and other music sites. This album will be reviewed and talked about in the rock music press all over the world.  This is the big time and you get to be a part of it.


THE COOL STUFF!

In appreciation for your help and belief in our music, we want to go the extra mile. We are offering signed equipment we actually used to record, original framed handwritten lyric sheets, album credits, Skype guitar lessons, personalized pictures, video thank yous, free downloads, autographed albums, shirts, remixes, demos and even alternate versions not on the album. The list goes on and on.

Other Ways You Can Help
Can’t contribute right now?  No sweat! You can still help us out by spreading the word about our campaign. Please tell your friends, and share to Facebook, Twitter and any other social media.


       But above all..THANK          YOU for whatever you can do!

Why? Because we feel it is the right time. Most of our fans know that last year, one of heavy metal’s biggest labels, Germany's Pure Steel Records honored us by re-releasing our four previous studio albums as numbered collectable limited editions.                                                                                                                         

They included holograms for authenticity, bonus tracks and 12-page CD booklets. Not only that, but they wanted a new album, which  brings us to our current project. You are probably wondering why we need funding if we have already signed with a record label. The answer is simple. As professional musicians, it is important that we maintain control of the finished musical product. The label takes care of the artwork, graphics, manufacturing, distribution and promotion. What you will be doing is helping us fund the most important part of the project, the MUSIC


     Read the Pure Steel Records newsfeed about our campaign


By having you help fund the project, instead of leaving the important creative decisions up to the record label, we get to do what we do without limitations. Call it artistic freedom, if you will, but there is actually much more to it than that. We want our fans involved this time around from the very beginning. You will have exclusive access to us while we are in the studio. We want to hear your opinions and you are welcome to ask questions and offer your feedback. In a very real way, you will be making this record with us!
Our Campaign is Getting Worldwide Press. Click the Links Below 


Nemesis Magazine (Germany)




Bel7 (Europe)


SO HOW MUCH WILL WE NEED?




Since we live in Northern California, we will record here in order to keep quality high and costs low. Consequently YOU WILL NOT help fund travelling expenses, hotels or anythinfg else other than recording, mixing and editing, plus shipping the perks. And since I will be producing again, like I did with our other albums, we can control even more. But most importantly, the music will sound killer.




At the conclusion of the campaign funding, we will start the preproduction phase and then transition to the studio sessions. You will receive constant updaftes on our timeline, expenditures and progress. Also you will be able to see the whole process as it’s happening. 

And when the album is finished, we will be release it worldwide, just like our previous albums! Pure Steel Records is distributed by “Soulfood”, one of the world’s largest media distributors. The album you help make will be everywhere, including in record stores, on the internet, downloaded on websites like Amazon and iTunes or streamed on Pandora, Spotify, Rhapsody and other music sites. This album will be reviewed and talked about in the rock music press all over the world.  This is the big time and you get to be a part of it.
THE COOL STUFF!



In appreciation for your help and belief in our music, we want to go the extra mile. We are offering signed equipment we actually used to record, original framed handwritten lyric sheets, album credits, Skype guitar lessons, personalized pictures, video thank yous, free downloads, autographed albums, shirts, remixes, demos and even alternate versions not on the album. The list goes on and on.





Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute right now?  No sweat! You can still help us out by spreading the word about our campaign. Please tell your friends, and share to Facebook, Twitter and any other social media.       But above all..THANK          YOU for whatever you can do!

story:
Short Summary

Hey, we're SWEAT were a trashy thrashy Flint, MI band with no cash to fund the release of our album. We're bottom feeders that are thirsty for the opportunity to get our sound out there. It's been over a decade of us steamrolling through band members to finally realize that we just need each other and the help of our friends and fans to make things happen. We're a 2 piece nugget and its rough coming up with dollars between just us.  We finally have an album worth the money, and we're asking you to help us in getting it pressed by donating or pre ordering some merch.  Check out the prizes listed on the right and help us out if you can!  We'll totally appreciate it.


CLICK HERE TO LISTEN TO HEMATOLAGNIA - The first single from this album


What We Need & What You Get

The money that's raised from this campaign will be used to:

- Pay Jay Roedel - our awesome and patient recording engineer.

- Pay for the pressing of all of the physical goods that are the rewards to our backers.

- Any extra will help us to get t-shirts, stickers, lighters, and other merch to help get our band into a more professional status.


And if we don't quite make the goal, then we'll use whatever we do raise to pay Jay, and start selling the tracks online to pay for pressing.  We'll make sure you get your copies of the disc as soon as pressing happens if we don't reach the goal.


    Prizes are listed to the side and here are photos of some of the prizes: (poster pic may be up soon - or it might be a surprise)




    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help us out monetarily, you can still help us spread the word about this campaign, and we'd appreciate that just as much as if you gave us a bunch of money, cause maybe someone you know will...


    Thanks to all of you!

story:
Summary

“I am not a color.  I am not your fear. I am not my country.”

“I am not my income.  I am not your anger.  I am not my body.”

These words I wrote for the song “In Search of Love” speak of the labels by which people justify violence and discrimination, the labels people get judged by, and the labels that divide us.  My greatest desire AND my great challenge as a songwriter is to write words that have meaning, reach people's hearts on a deep level or inspire change.  I endeavor to achieve that impact through my new CD project with songs like “In Search of Love,” “The Best Things in Life are Free” and the title track “In My World.” 

I have pursued music passionately, both in my personal and professional life. I have done everything from teach guitar lessons to music therapy with hospitalized children to writing music for political commercials (this is DC after all!).  As a singer/songwriter I have been fortunate enough to achieve a certain amount of success with my first two CDs of all original songs.  Both of these received positive reviews in the Washington Post and Gazette newspapers as well as online music forums. I love performing and have performed solo and with some stellar musicians in various venues around the United States and in London. 

I have also been blessed with the opportunity to write music for some television including National Geographic Explorer, the PBS documentary Barnstorming and most recently a song for the new feature documentary Pictures From a Hiroshima Schoolyard (Oscar campaign starting soon!).  While these successes have been very meaningful, it’s a challenge to make ends meet and even more challenging to fund a large recording project.  That is why I need your help and am so very grateful you are taking the time to visit my Indiegogo page.

More about the CD project…

I've chosen 14 of what I consider to be my best new songs, written on guitar and ukulele, to include on the CD.  I’m excited about the different ways I plan to arrange them—from one or two acoustic instruments on some tunes, to a full band on others.  I can't wait to experiment with instruments & sounds like I did for the soundtrack of Barnstorming (I used various percussion and household objects including a straw broom on one track). 

I'm excited about the variety of subjects I deal with in this collection of songs too.  Some speak of peace, love and equality while others pay tribute.  “Here Today” is a nod to the late 70s singer/songwriter—and personal favorite—Nick Drake.  Another is a loving ode to a close friend who, as she put it, ‘shed her earthsuit’ all-too-early three years ago.

“The Boy & the Tree” is a love song inspired by the beautiful story in Shel Silverstein’s  book “The Giving Tree."  For "Pilots' Anthem" I adapted one of the instrumentals from the Barnstorming soundtrack and turned it into a lively song that expresses the joy of flying.

What I Need & What You Get

The money I raise here will all go toward the following costs: some recording (most I can do in my home studio), hiring some stellar musicians to accompany me on several tracks, hiring a first rate producer for a few songs, mixing, mastering and CD duplication.  I have also budgeted for what might be the most important step—promotion.  Also, a good chunk will get absorbed by taxes and Indiegogo, paypal, credit card and shipping fees. 

Please peruse my perks! This is not charity! I am offering a range of goodies including the ‘presale’ of this CD, my previous two CDs, the Barnstorming DVD & CD soundtrack, and some songs I recorded acoustically but never officially released.  I also make jewelry that I’m offering.  And did I mention I do video & film work?  I’ve included some of that too!

In addition to my own offerings, a few kind souls have donated some items.  Sound therapist Carol Colacurcio is donating CDs for the effort, and NewGrowth Healing & Hypnosis will offer healing sessions.  Both have provided me with incredible healing (both emotional & physical) during extremely challenging times. You can benefit too, while helping me reach my goal!

Regardless of fund raising totals this CD is happening, and your perks are guaranteed!  Although I'm confident that with your help I can reach this goal, if I don't, I can always be my own producer or mix some of the simpler songs and reduce the amount of CD duplication.  No matter what, I will get this music out there!

The Impact

Making music is the truest, deepest expression of my soul and my heart.  I love creating it, but what is the point if I can’t share it?  I would be honored if you would help me create and share this collection of songs. I hope my new music will have an impact—that is the dream.  Your donation (or ‘pre-sale’) says you think it could!  Keep in mind, your donation also helps support the musicians, engineers and others I need to hire to complete this project.  This is your “Impact!”

Other Ways You Can Help

Please also consider doing the following:

• Use the Indiegogo share tools to share my campaign on your social media pages.

• Email a link to this page to your friends and other music lovers asking them to be a part of this campaign and mention some of the perks you think might peak their interest.

story:
History of Bill at the Fest

20 years ago, a few Lodgers thought it would be a fun thing to take Billy to Jazzfest.  The idea stuck, and a few of us have kept the tradition going, most notably, Brent Lesher, who hasn't missed a Fest since.

Why we are asking for some help.

As time has gone by, this core group of Lodgers has split the funding for Billy's trip, and we're all very successful and rich now, but the cost continues to rise.  We are very happy that we can now include Odell in the fun.  Tal Knochenmus has done most of the travel agent work in recent years.

Why should you help?

I know many of you have always wanted/intended to go to the fest, and many of you feel guilty for never having gone.  A contribution will assuage such feelings and will make you a part of things even if you can't join us.  We promise to send you lots of photos of Bill eating crawfish bread, second-lining, hanging out with the pie lady, telling us he can play better than the piano players in the Gospel Tent, and generally wishing you could be there in person.

story:
“Don’t Be Afraid, It’s Only Death”

Music Video Press Release

“Macabre, literate and shamelessly theatrical, there's real vision behind the Widow’s Bane’s, death-folk howl. Not to mention courage — a rare commodity lately in the local scene.”

— Jason Heller Westword Magazine

“Don’t Be Afraid, It’s Only Death” will be The Widow’s Bane’s second full-length album released to date. It will be their first album recorded in a studio, as the previous recording took place in a garage. Despite it’s humble beginnings, the debut, self-titled album acquired critical acclaim in Colorado. Adam Perry of Denver’s Westword Magazine wrote, “The debut album from Boulder zombie folk-punkers, the Widow's Bane, is arresting and addictive. Mortimer Leech's love for harrowing old-time chanteys shines through (darkly) on this thirteen-song trip through death, un-death, debauchery and abuse.” Now, the seed that was planted by that first album has been germinating for three years. Meanwhile, the Widow’s Bane has continued to write, tour and record. Their new album is currently being mastered, and is slated for release in June 2013.

On March 24th, production will begin on a music video for the title track, “Don’t Be Afraid, It’s Only Death” in order to accompany and promote the new album. While the song itself is obviously controversial in some regards, its only intended purpose, besides entertainment, is to simply invite a dialogue on death; a topic which Governor Mortimer Leech believes to be lurking in the minds of most everyone, yet is seldom spoke of.

The story of the video will follow one newly dispatched bride beyond death and into the world between worlds. She will meet a questionable companion and dance with death, as the saying goes. The viewer will try to decide whether she’s in heaven or hell, and we will try our damnedest to leave that question unanswered. She will find herself at a beautiful masquerade ball, she will find herself alone in an abandoned factory, she will meet a handsome young man, and she will dance all night while fleeting zombies terrorize her from the shadows.

The script has been written, the cast has been chosen. The ballroom has been rented and the crew has been hired. However, in order for this video to reach its full potential, we will need to spend more money than we have. The Widow’s Bane has been primed to blow ever since their last album sent ripples across Colorado’s pristine music scene. Now is the time to send a shock wave across the globe. If you love ‘em, let ‘em know it. If you hate ‘em, help them to success, and they’ll go back to their own countries and leave you all well enough alone. Good day, and God bless.

- The Widow’s Bane

story:
The New Album is Coming! Pre-order Here!

As you've heard, The Abramson Singers' second album, Late Riser, is coming out on May 14. We think it would sound really good on vinyl, but pressing is a little pricey.

But here's the thing, if you buy a copy before it's out (I mean, you were going to buy it anyway, right?) we'll have enough cash to press it! You can buy a digital copy, a CD copy, or a vinyl copy. It'll cost less here than at a show or at a store, and you'll be helping us out. Plus we'll mail it to your home before the release date with a suprise gift! WIN-WIN!

Your support helps us keep doing what we're doing, so thank you thank you thank you.

Preview a song from the new album here: https://soundcloud.com/tinroofmanagement/03-jack-of-diamonds

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $2500 in presales to fund the vinyl pressing.

- $7 gets you a digital download

- $12 gets you a CD, plus special gift

- $22 gets you vinyl, plus special gift (Canada)

- $50 gets you a songwriting lesson, plus album

- $150 gets you a song commission, plus album

If we don't reach our goal, we'll still be putting what we make towards the vinyl and CD pressings. The rest will have to come from viral videos of Leah's cat. Help us end kitty exploitation.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're rolling in cash, feel free to make a donation. Otherwise, just send this to anyone you think might like to buy an album. It all adds up!

THANK YOU!

story:
Hi,

My name is Tamar Love, and playing the cello has been a passion of mine for over twenty years. The one thing I have wanted most as a musician, other than sharing and speaking to people through music, is to travel abroad. I recently auditioned to participate in the Rome Music Festival and won the assistant principal cello seat. I am really proud of this accomplishment plus the many years of training and obstacles I've overcome to get to this point. I can't begin to tell you how excited I am to have this opportunity, but I can't possibly get there without your help. I need your financial support to make this happen. Here's why:

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for a total of $4000. This will help with air fare for both myself and my cello. I have to buy a plane ticket for George (my cello) so it doesn't get damaged during flight, hotel stay for about a month, touring the city, and food, etc. I recieved a scholarship of $2000 to help with costs, and a work study scholarship of the same amount which they will award at the end of the program. The overall base cost is $5,500. This does not include the extra cargo fare, food and travel within the city. 

Here are some of the perks you will recieve for donating:

  • Everyone who donates $25 or more will be invited to a private concert in the fall (date tbd).
  • Those who donate $75 or more will recieve an autographed copy of original cello works that I will produce within the year. 
  • If you donate $350 - $500, I will treat you to a one hour private performance at the venue of your choosing (i.e. a social gathering, an intimate dinner with your special someone, a home gathering, an art opening, etc.). *In order to take advantage of this, I have to be given two weeks advance notice. This offer will expire at the new calendar year. Major holidays are excluded.
  • For a donation of $500 - $1000, you will receive an autographed copy of an original cello work which I will dedicate to you.
  • Contributors of $1000 or more will receive an autographed copy of an original cello work dedicated to you, and a two hour private perfomace at the venue of your choosing (* see the above stipulations).

If I am not able to reach my goal, Rome Music Festival holds scholarships through the next year. I could delay the trip. 

 

The Impact

Again, I can't begin to put into words how important it is for me to have this experience, and how equally important it is for me to know that you believe in me enough to help me realize this dream. I know this will be a life changing experience. Thank you for your generosity.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give financially, you can still help by telling others about this campaign. Thanks for your support.

Those who donate $75 or more will recieve an autographed copy of original cello works that I will produce within the year. 
If you donate $350 - $500, I will treat you to a one hour private performance at the venue of your choosing (i.e. a social gathering, an intimate dinner with your special someone, a home gathering, an art opening, etc.). *In order to take advantage of this, I have to be given two weeks advance notice. This offer will expire at the new calendar year. Major holidays are excluded.
For a donation of $500 - $1000, you will receive an autographed copy of an original cello work which I will dedicate to you.
Contributors of $1000 or more will receive an autographed copy of an original cello work dedicated to you, and a two hour private perfomace at the venue of your choosing (* see the above stipulations).

If I am not able to reach my goal, Rome Music Festival holds scholarships through the next year. I could delay the trip. 
 


The Impact
Again, I can't begin to put into words how important it is for me to have this experience, and how equally important it is for me to know that you believe in me enough to help me realize this dream. I know this will be a life changing experience. Thank you for your generosity.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't give financially, you can still help by telling others about this campaign. Thanks for your support.

story:
Help Send Me To Germany

Hello!  My name is Obed Floan and I am a tenor of the dramatic variety.  I have traversed a rather long and very hard path to discover that I may be the missing link to a voice type that has recently been very misunderstood by many since the days Richard Wagner was alive and composing music for it! Unlike smaller voices than mine, what I do takes a long time to develop and cultivate correctly, and there is much confusion and lack of true knowledge and mentorship in the world to help grow my voice type, rather than damage it (which is what can happen if not trained correctly).  This is why many give up before reaching the stage I have vocally, and other voice types try to sing this repertoire unsuccessfully.

I have struggled a lot over the years working with various world-renowned singers and teachers to discover and uncover what I was built to do vocally.  I am now at the precipice of putting myself directly in front of the people in my industry that will hopefully be able to recognize this, as well and help me fully realize globally, what I have been designed to do since birth in regard to my singing career.

The only problem is; I may not be able to afford to take the last steps I need to get myself in front of these casting directors, agents and artistic directors that need to hear what I have to offer the world of music.  One of those last steps that I have not taken yet, due to my lack of funds throughout the years, is a trip to Germany that anyone with my voice type must do at some point in their careers, if they truly are committed and willing to follow their path to a performing career, as I am. An explanation of what this trip is all about for those who are not familiar with the process is stated below.  But please help me make this trip a reality!

 

The REAL Reality of this Trip

For those not familiar with this Germany Audition Tour Circuit and what it means:

In order for me to take this audition tour to Germany, I would have to locate a central residency in Germany to live from the months of October through December, without employment. The reason for this is that I would have to be available on a moment's notice to jump on a plane, train, bus or taxi to various and possibly remote locations throughout the country to sing for an audition at a house or for an agent or artistic director in hopes to obtain a singing contract or two.  Therefore, because of the time-frame and flexibility demands needed for this trip, I would potentially have to let go of my teaching position I currently have in the states and would not be drawing an income at that time. In addition to that, any contracts I may potentially pick up from this trip would typically not start until the following fall (2014).  This means that I would have to come back to the US during the holidays for the spring and summer months before these contracts begin and seek employment (very undoubtedly not successfully in this economy) while I prepare the various roles in the contracts for my return to Germany the next year.

You may now be putting together the idea of the kinds of funds that this trip is going to require of me, and the need to have this money in place well before travelling to Germany. If I don’t have enough money to support this trip in it’s entirety, I will not be able to go!

 

What I Need & What You Get

As I explained above, I am in need of a great deal of funds for this audition trip.  I have set this Indiegogo.com campaign for $35,000.00 in order to secure the correct amount before making travel arrangements.  If I can make at least over 85% of this goal, I know that I will have enough funding to make the trip a reality and possibly return to the states without employment and re-assimilate into society back here in the spring.  These funds would cover everything from plane tickets to daily per diem for food, rent or hotel stays where needed when traveling.  Due to the nature of this trip, all projections are just that, projections based on my research for how much will be needed for these expenses. I have created a break down of my projections that can be available upon request.

I have created a number of perks for you to find ways to get something more out of helping me fund this trip than just the satisfaction of knowing you helped bridge the gap existing in the world of German Opera.  As you can see to the right, here is what you can receive at the various levels of contribution (just click on the perk to the right and you are on your way):

 

  • For a contribution of $10.00, you will be emailed an exclusive pre-recorded thank you message from me directly! (That is if you provide me your email address.)

 

  • For a contribution of $25.00, you will be sent special authentic limited edition homemade German candy made by me!!!

     

  • For a contribution of $35.00, you will be sent the authentic German candy listed above PLUS a recipe and ingredients to make “Gluwine” (a special traditional German Christmas Holiday drink that warms the soul) to wash it all down.

 

  • For a contribution of $50.00, you will receive a very special gift from a friend of mine who makes a remarkable product we all use: Soap!  I will send you two bars of her artisanal soap from her company, “Dirt Knees Soap Co.” (www.dirtykneessoap.com).  I can't get enough of her products...they simply are the best on the market that I have tried!  You will love them!  You will be automatically subscribed to Dirty Knees Soap, but will have the ability to unsubscribe at anytime.

 

  • For a contribution of $75.00, you will be sent a $25 gift card of your choice from these wonderful options: Apple, Google Play (Android), Amazon, Target, Walmart.  Please specify which one you would like.  Now that’s just plain fun!

 

  • For a contribution of $100.00, you will be given:

    An exclusive private one-on-one 60 minute voice lesson with me if you LIVE IN the Oklahoma City Metro Area. (Lesson time and place will be mutually agreed upon after campaign ends; contact information must be provided.)

    OR

    An exclusive private one-on-one 60 minute Skype voice lesson with me if you LIVE OUTSIDE of the OKC area. (Lessons meeting time will be agreed upon after campaign ends; Skype credentials must be provided.)

     

  • For a contribution of $250.00, you will be sent a postcard and an authentic gift item directly from a musically historic region of Germany while I am traveling on my audition tour in the fall.

 

  • For a contribution of $500.00, you will be sent postcards directly from Germany chronicling my opera auditions at each place I audition as they happen.  With any success on my trip, this could be a permanent record for you of how I got my career started.  Who knows….it COULD be very valuable some day. :-)

 

  • For a contribution of $1,000.00, you will be sent an MP3 of a VERY Special Edition of a one-of-a-time live performance debut song from a cycle written expressly for me as the inspiration by a gifted composer, Stephen Variames.  This piece was debuted on April 27th, 2012 at Oklahoma City University and, so far, this is the only public performance and/or recording of the song.  You can be the first to have your very own copy of the song before the cycle goes public.

 

  • For a contribution of $5,000.00, I will personally come to your home (in the domestic 48 united states) and perform a private mini-concert in your living room of my programming.  A tuned piano must be provided by you in the room of your choice you wish to hold the mini-concert. Date and time will be mutually agreed upon by all parties involved: you, me and my pianist based on our availabilities.

 

  • For a contribution of $10,000.00, you will receive ALL THE PERKS LISTED ABOVE, (including the concert in your living room), BUT also ADD MY WIFE, Megan Wagner.  We have been coined "The Lohengrin Dream-Team" by members of the Ohio Wagner Society.  Again, a tuned piano must be provided by you in the room of your choice you wish to hold the concert. Date and time will be mutually agreed upon by all parties involved based on our availabilities.

 

I hope you can find one of these contribution levels to your liking and will be motivated to commit to one of them!  As you can see, there are perks at every level that everyone can afford, starting from $10 on up!  But don’t feel you have to only select a perk to contribute...you can also make a customized contribution for a value you set manually starting for as little as $1.  You are completely in charge!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that in these troubling economic times, it may seem impossible to justify contributing to fundraising charities like mine, and that is when I hope you can feel inspired to get involved in other ways that can help me obtain my goal for this audition trip.  Please help me get the word out! All you need to do is just share this campaign with at least 10 other people throughout your social networks, coworkers, church groups, friends and family you may have that would be interested in philanthropically supporting my trip if they are in a position to do so…or even if they aren’t (because, they might know someone or someone who knows someone…etc. You get the idea...). Please help spread the word!

Indiegogo.com makes spreading the word simple for you with a number of social networking tools you can use…please use them!  I REALLY would appreciate it!

 

Very Sincerely and VERY Appreciatively,

Obed Floan

www.ObedFloan.com

 

UPDATE:

I am so honored to have been nominated for a teaching award from the Grammy Foundation and The Recording Academy!! Many thanks goes to Jack Swanson, a former student of mine who nominated me this past week on their website: Grammy Music Teacher Award!

So thank you Jack! And thanks to any or all of my other students who may have nominated me as well! I am so honored and flattered that you feel that I have helped you in some way with your musical dreams and feel inspired to let others know! Wish me luck with this nomination, everyone!


Grammy Music Teacher Award Nomination!

story:
Short, Sweet and to the Point


We're an unsigned rock/metal band from Reading, PA. We've shared the stage with acts like Asking Alexandria, We Came as Romans, Motionless in White, Memphis May Fire, and so on. On June 18, we released a new album, and this music video will help us with promotion and DIY aspects that most signed artists have zero control over.

We need to raise $3000 in order to make a video for our song "My Heart on Ice".

If we raise over the amount, all of the money will go straight into the band as well. We will make a lot of new merch!

The funding will strictly go to our filming crew (Boy Astronaut Film & Image), props and items used to make the video, lighting, and to pay actors.

Filming will span over 3 days: July 19, 20 & 21.

What you get


You, as a contributor, will receive some sweet incentives by donating a certain amount of money. You can donate anywhere from $1 to $500, each level has its own reward.

We love personally connecting with our fans, and this campaign will give us some interesting experiences! :)

The Impact


If we do NOT receive $3000 worth of funding, it's certain (by 100%) that the rest of the money will come out of our own pockets. Touring on our own dime and buying new merch is already expensive, as you can imagine. This will result in the project taking up another year of our time before it's released.

However, this WILL positively impact our fans/ future fans. The video will always be availible to watch online. This is something that will last forever & can rebuild our own local music scene.

If we meet our goal, the video will be released August 6, 2013! 

Other Ways to Help


If you can't afford to donate anything whatsoever, you can help share this post all over social media! SHARE ON FACEBOOK, TWITTER & INSTAGRAM for free! It helps us out more than you think. 

Thank you for your time.

Love, ASLW.

story:
Who are Drive-Thru Mystics?

Drive-Thru Mystics is the brain-child of A.a. Ron Hutto. A native of Oklahoma he came to California, like so many musicians before him, with the hope of putting together a group that would allow him to let loose his musical demons and create mind-bending art that would not only make the listeners move, but also make an impact.
After years of various projects with musicians who didn't share his passion or vision, he finally met David Adams. "The Good David" brings his high energy and ferocious bass lines to Drive-Thru Mystics that compliments the Psych/Garage/Punk sound perfectly. There is an undeniable chemistry on stage between band members that has only been solidified by adding Patrick Hennessey on drums. Pat is the most solid and experience drummer they have had the pleasure of working with. This group has never been stronger and has never needed your help more.

Why do we need your help?

We have a short North Western Tour scheduled for late August and we desperately need your help. We are also in the process of recording tracks for our upcoming 7 inch vinyl that we plan to release in late Fall.
 
-Your donations will contribute 100% to our travel expenses. Gas, food, and lodging when needed. (We are lucky enough to have friends and musicians who are willing to house us for the majority of the tour.)
-Donations will also help to pay for the pressing of our record. The cost of vinyl has gone up thanks to the recent increase in popularity. There is no denying the quality of sound and the feeling you get from heft of it in your hand. (Pressing can cost anywhere from $800-$1,500)

What happens when we reach our goal?

If we are able to raise all the funds for our tour and our record it will only be the beginning!
We'll be posting all of our dates soon so you can come out to support us and also claim your perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

In these tough economic times not everyone is able to donate. Please help us by spreading the word about our campaign.

story:
A Short Summary

  • We are Brutal Juice.  We've been destroying your ears on and off since 1990 but when we broke up, a hole was left in hearts across the land.  We have unfinished business and this album will go a long way toward completing our mission.  
  • To revive the beast we need money.
  • You can be part of this work.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $10,000 to fully complete this project.  This money will pay for recording,mastering,equipment,travel, album pressing, and other miscellaneous things that go into making an album.
  • We have some great perks for contributors: shirts, albums, downloads, etc

The impact of your contribution

  • This album will bend minds and open eyes. It will leave bodies broken and shaken.  It will cause you to question your entire existence.  It will make your mom yell at you to turn it down.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, you can still help by getting the word out!  Tell everyone you know even if you don't think they've heard of Brutal Juice.

story:
Bay Area Singer-Songwriter Chris Reed is not your typical artist.  Yes, he sings and plays an instrument, yes, he writes his own songs. But Chris takes it one step further and does all this while connecting and inspiring our community.

  Chris starts various performing arts programs in South Bay Schools, ranging from Band to Choir to Theater Departments.  These programs are based around the schools’ personal needs and budgets. Reed even helps to teach them how to keep these programs self-sustaining so they can continue enriching lives in their local community for years to come.

    In 2013 Chris was awarded a grant given out by GENARTS Silicon Valley and labeled an “Emerging Artist of Silicon Valley”.  He took the grant money and wrote a song inspired by his students at Willow Glen Elementary and brought a handful of them into a professional recording studio.  The students sang on this empowering song so elegantly titled “Because of you”.  As seen here: https://www.youtube.com/cristoreed

  The song expressed gratitude to all the people who had helped shaped them into who they have and are becoming , while giving his students an enriching experience which they will carry with them forever. 

  Now, nine months later, Chris is at it again. But this time he hasn’t won any grant money and is trying to fund the project on his own.  Feeling grateful for the opportunity to work with over 500+ students a week from varying populations, Chris felt it his duty to bring them all together and remind the Silicon Valley how we are all ”One”.  From Jr. High to Kindergarten to preschoolers with visual and orthopedic impairments, Chris wants to bring them all together to record his newest composition appropriately titled ”We are One”.  But this time he is upping the stakes from his last song and video.  Instead of just using a handful of his students, he wants to incorporate hundreds into the recording and filming process from schools in 5 different school districts.

Reed is even uniting the local music scene and asking singers, musicians and bands of all genres to join in this journey to create a song made to reflect the diversities and strengths of the Silicon Valley.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Renting an HD camera, camera man for multiple days, microphone, cables, stands, interface, studio time, engineers, editing, mixing, mastering services.
  • For your donation you will receive a free download of the song and first peek at the finished product.  You will also recieve a link to download some of Chris' previous works.
  • If the target goal is not raised Chris Reed will pay for the remainder out of his own pocket. 

The Impact

  • "We are one" will unify all of our different communities and show how no matter who we are...  We are all beautiful and have something wonderful to offer each other, no matter our age, ethnicity or economic background.
  • Chris' last project "Because of You" can be seen on his youtube page: https://www.youtube.com/user/cristoreed
  • Chris is so passionate about this project that he is taking on all the initial cost and has already begun recording.  If you would like to help inspire and empower your local community then donate what you can.  Every little bit helps make it happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, and that is totally understandable.  This  doesn’t mean you can’t help though:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Bay
Area Singer-Songwriter Chris Reed is not your typical artist.  Yes, he sings and plays an instrument, yes,
he writes his own songs. But Chris takes it one step further and does all this
while connecting and inspiring our community.

  Chris
starts various performing arts programs in South Bay Schools, ranging from Band
to Choir to Theater Departments.  These
programs are based around the schools’ personal needs and budgets. Reed even
helps to teach them how to keep these programs self-sustaining so they can
continue enriching lives in their local community for years to come. 
    In 2013 Chris was awarded a grant
given out by GENARTS Silicon Valley and labeled an “Emerging Artist of Silicon
Valley”.  He took the grant money and
wrote a song inspired by his students at Willow Glen Elementary and brought a
handful of them into a professional recording studio.  The
students sang on this empowering song so elegantly titled “Because of you”.  As seen here: https://www.youtube.com/cristoreed
  The song expressed gratitude to all the
people who had helped shaped them into who they have and are becoming , while
giving his students an enriching experience which they will carry with them
forever.  
  Now, nine months later, Chris is at it again. But this time he hasn’t won any grant
money and is trying to fund the project on his own.  Feeling grateful for the opportunity to work
with over 500+ students a week from varying populations, Chris felt it his duty
to bring them all together and remind the Silicon Valley how we are all
”One”.  From Jr. High to Kindergarten to
preschoolers with visual and orthopedic impairments, Chris wants to bring them
all together to record his newest composition appropriately titled ”We are
One”.  But this time he is upping the
stakes from his last song and video. 
Instead of just using a handful of his students, he wants to incorporate
hundreds into the recording and filming process from schools in 5 different
school districts. 
Reed
is even uniting the local music scene and asking singers, musicians and bands
of all genres to join in this journey to create a song made to reflect the
diversities and strengths of the Silicon Valley.What We Need & What You Get
Renting an HD camera, camera man for multiple days, microphone, cables, stands, interface, studio time, engineers, editing, mixing, mastering services.
For your donation you will receive a free download of the song and first peek at the finished product.  You will also recieve a link to download some of Chris' previous works.
If the target goal is not raised Chris Reed will pay for the remainder out of his own pocket. 
The Impact
"We are one" will unify all of our different communities and show how no matter who we are...  We are all beautiful and have something wonderful to offer each other, no matter our age, ethnicity or economic background.
Chris' last project "Because of You" can be seen on his youtube page: https://www.youtube.com/user/cristoreed

Chris is so passionate about this project that he is taking
on all the initial cost and has already begun recording.  If you would
like to help inspire and empower
your local community then donate what you can.  Every little bit helps make it happen. 
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, and that is totally understandable.  This  doesn’t mean you can’t help though:Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My upcoming album POLARITY is born of friendship and the freedom of making my own choices.  

Short summary

Hello, I’m Andrea Bučko from Slovakia. I compose my own music, write lyrics, play the piano and sing. I created my first big project two years ago with a very talented harpist Maria Kmetkova. We have already launched my first CD „In the Middle of...“ The unusual combination of piano music, singing and the harp was critically acclaimed in Slovakia. However, my music is not considered mainstream here. In our country it´s difficult to promote alternative music projects, especially when you are an independent artist. Therefore, my CD is known mostly among artists.

At the moment I´m finishing my second CD which I named POLARITY (here you can listen to my music) It has two sides – a soft, emotional, acoustic side, and the second one, more rhythmic, with electronic sounds, very modern. 

My music is really personal. I sing about people’s deepest doubts and emotions. I’m trying to find answers in the matters of love, friendship and the world in general, mixing genres of jazz, slovak folk, rock and pop. 

Since this second CD is mostly sung in English I would like for the foreign public to hear it as well. I decided to contact Indiegogo to catch your attention. I want to keep the freedom in my choices, but this means that I need financial support to keep my individuality. This is my dream and the only way to achieve this dream is with your support.
I would like to be able to give you the gift of music as I believe that my music will inspire you and your investment will be worth it. 

Below you can find samples and videos from my upcoming CD, I hope you enjoy it. It's the best way to find out who I am and what I do.


What I need & What You Get

What I need the finance for is (physical) pressing of the album and costs related to the CD manufacture. It´s 2000 euros. In return, I am offering my art that can be seen on the right (the perks). You can receive a new signed album "Polarity", an old signed album "In the middle of...", limited addition dedicated postcard with an invitation to the Polarity album release ceremony, live performance via Skype or in your country etc.

I've set up a goal of 2500 USD which is a minimal amount of money needed to make my album. If I manage to exceed this amount, the money would be invested in other activities connected to album production - i would pay the photographers, graphics, the preparation of the concert tour etc...

I thank you all very much for paying attention and your time to my campaign and for your decision to help. Thanks to all of you I'll be able to create my music and bring happiness to all the people who like it...


...and in The End:

Here you can see some examples of my work

This is my first official video - I collaborated with many artists (things I wear are originals, pictures of naked bodies were arranged by very talented photographer Evelyn Bencicova) - BE MY LOVER


The other side of my work - soft, emotional song that was created as a birthday present for my friend - HAPPY BIRTHDAY


This song is one of my favorites - SAY SORRY


This is my first slovak single from "Polarity" - PÚPAVA (DANDELION)


Live performance on Adela Banášová´s TV talkshow in Slovak National Theatre


Me and Mária Kmeťková (the harpist) at TEDx Bratislava 2013 - live performance



You can also listen to my music on SOUNDCLOUD

https://soundcloud.com/andreabuckoofficial

And this is my FB fan page 

https://www.facebook.com/AndreaBuckoOfficial
