story:
In Search of Adam

“One’s Personal Legend is what you have always wanted to accomplish. Everyone, when they are young, knows what their Personal Legend is. At that point in their lives, everything is clear and everything is possible. They are not afraid to dream, and to yearn for everything they would like to see happen to them in their lives. But, as time passes, a mysterious force begins to convince them that it will be impossible for them to realize their Personal Legend….whoever you are, or whatever it is that you do, when you really want something, it’s because that desire originated in the soul of the universe. It’s your mission on earth” -The Alchemist

Fate is only understood in hindsight. Even after time passes and we see the story unfold we can just barely understand it.. like trying to put together the vestige of a dream as you wake up. 

This is our dream. 

It starts with Travis Baker and a change of scenery. After growing up in the Los Angeles, Travis and his family relocated to the little town called Temecula, California. Music was everything to Travis; it was his entertainment, his role models, his expression and his escape. You can't conceptualize these needs as a preteen, it’s purely visceral but he needed friends to help him express himself.  At the same time Beau Trembly was also experiencing a change of scenery. After spending 6 years outside of Cairo, Egypt, Beau found himself in the quiet suburbs of Temecula as well. Beau ran into Travis at youth group and the two bonded over music. Travis then created the first incarnation of what would become “On Being Human” in the form of a punk band called Gusto while Beau started his own band. 

Greg Johnson picked up his first guitar after seeing his sisters’ boyfriend at the time play. He became obsessed with playing loud and fast in the styles of his idols like Metallica and Megadeth. After arriving at a new high school in Ontario, California, he sought out friends with similar interests and guitar was what connected them. Everyone knew that Greg was obsessed with guitar, but there was another Greg, one year older who was also obsessed with guitar. Greg Johnson and Greg Lesondak didn’t quite bond at first as their relationship was much more competitive in nature. Greg Johnson’s band lost to Greg Lesondak’s band at the freshman talent show and Greg Johnson vowed to come back the next year and win. Greg Johnson started his new metal band called Torrent but the showdown between Greg Lesondak’s Nothing to Lose and Torrent would never come to pass. 

Back in Temecula, Travis was looking to shake up Gusto’s musical stylings. A member switch up and a genre change later, Gusto became Ocean Daybreak and the search was on for more members. It was then that Travis looked back to his first Temeculan friend and asked him to join. He agreed and the newly reformed band wrote the “At the End of the World” EP which grew in popularity thanks to a song called “The Prophecy”. That song was the first time Greg Johnson had ever heard of the band. Upon arriving at college, a roommate showed “Ocean Daybreak” to Greg and told him that the singer of that band lived in the same dorm. Travis Baker wasn’t the singer then, but through mutual friends, Greg and Travis finally met. Around that time though Ocean Daybreak decided they wanted a change again, of tone and of name. “On Being Human” is a poem written by C.S. Lewis that Travis and band decided to lovingly adopt as their own. They would go on to play a few shows with Torrent while Greg and Travis bonded over their love of video-game soundtracks. It was a video-game soundtrack that also brought Greg Lesondak and Greg Johnson together. Greg Johnson was scoring the Wii game “Alien Monster Bowling League” and asked Greg Lesondak for help on a track. Greg Lesondak had been gigging heavily every since high school and thought it would be a nice change of pace to help record a track for a video game. Greg Johnson would then send those tracks to Travis to see what he thought of them since Travis was also working at a small online video game company scoring music for them. Travis had just moved to Murrieta, California at this time and would spend his days talking to Greg about music and his nights would be spent with the band in his neighbor Robert’s garage. Robert Pearson saw something in the group and offered his garage as a space for the band to be creative and more importantly.. to be loud. Robert even showed the group to his brother-in-law, Chris Adams, who had been busy in Hamburg, Germany inventing automatic tuning “Robot Guitar”. 

This is where fate through a curve ball… Beau quit On Being Human. Beau had grown anxious and needed a change. He enrolled at Biola University for Music and him and a couple other members also left the group. Travis was devastated, he had just recently decided to pick up the singing duties on the groups new “8 bit EP” and the EP was doing well enough that a young drummer named Gustin Flaig had heard about it all the way down in south Orange County through a friend of a friend and thought it was unique.. but Travis was left with just half a band. It was then that his old-video-game-soundtrack-loving friend Greg Johnson was looking for a change too. After Torrent called it a day and Greg graduated college, he was left with no direction and a lot of time on his hands. He sent a simple message to Travis on Myspace asking if he needed a guitar player and Travis said yes. Greg joined the band, replacing Beau on guitar, and started rehearsing in Robert’s garage. It was only two weeks later that Travis got a call that would change everyone’s lives. After much lobbying by Robert, Chris Adams wanted to bring the band to Germany to record an album. Three months after graduating college and a little over a month in the band, Greg Johnson got on a plane with Travis and the other members of the band and flew to Hamburg, Germany. The news got back to Beau and it shook him. He wanted a change of scenery but little did he know that by leaving On Being Human he had just given that opportunity to Greg… but fate wasn’t done yet. 

On Being Human was hard at work on their first album, “To Light the Coals of Hearts”, in Hamburg. They were recording in a fantastic studio with all the support they could ever want. Things aren’t always as they seem though, the bass player at the time wasn’t happy in the new situation and decided to return home. Travis and Greg were distraught as they thought they might lose this huge opportunity. How were they suppose to find a new member while they were 6,000 miles away from home? They had one option.. They called Beau and asked him to rejoin the band on the bass. Fast forward to January of 2010 and the release of On Being Human’s first full length album. “To Light the Coals of Hearts” was both the debut of the band and the culmination of the history of where they had been. They threw a release party and Greg Johnson picked a new brand new band that he had produced to open for them. I Am Cassettes was new rock group that consisted of close friends, including the lead guitarist Greg Lesondak. Like Beau and Greg Johnson before him, Greg Lesondak would share the stage with On Being Human with his previous group. 

Two years later, On Being Human had gone through another member change and was left needing a guitarist for a music video they were about to shoot for a song called “Unforgiving Sea”. The song was written for a film produced by Innovation Films in Qatar and that On Being Human had been scoring. Greg Johnson called his old friend and asked Greg Lesondak and Matthew Marquez, of Heartist, to come out to a dairy farm in the middle of the night and shoot a music video. It was then that everything started to click, Greg Lesondak wanted a change of pace and On Being Human was his way of doing just that. After Greg Lesondak joined the group they went out to track a new EP that Innovation Films executive produced. The band was going to do it all themselves but they needed a studio to record at. Greg Johnson remembered “Alchemy Studios” in Murrieta, California from back in the “To Light the Coals of Hearts” days as they had overdubbed the vocal for “Tidal Wave” there. Greg got the number of the owner from Robert Pearson and left a voicemail for a man named Arnold.

Arnold Lanni was a Canadian producer famous for producing bands such as Simple Plan, Our Lady Peace and King’s X. He also wrote the number 1 track “When I’m With You” back in the early 80’s for his old band Sheriff. The same year that On Being Human was born, Arnold decided that he needed a change of scenery and moved to Temecula. He set up shop and began working away at  Alchemy Studios. A few years later a group of local musicians called him. He returned Greg’s call and the two began to talk about what On Being Human needed and what Arnold could do for them. Arnold let the band book studio time and they went in to track the self-produced EP “eVe”. The band release “eVe” in January of 2012 and built a name for themselves earning Band of the Month recognitions from Hot Topic, Musicians Friend and Infectious Magazine as well as being labeled one of the best bands from Temecula from CBS Los Angeles. They needed to play more shows in support of “eVe” but they were still in need of a full time drummer. Kevin Garcia of I Am Cassettes had been jamming with Gustin Flaig in his Orange County based group Rebel Revive and decided that Gustin would be a perfect fit for On Being Human. Kevin started to slowly put the idea in Gustin’s head until Gustin decided it needed to happen. After joining On Being Human, Gustin and crew played all around Southern California and even made a trek out to Washington D.C. to play MainStage at Magfest 13 in support of their video game music based cover album “The Humans are Coming Vol.1”. The group built up their own new songs it preparation to release their next full length album “In Search of Adam”. Greg Johnson had been working with Arnold Lanni on his projects at Alchemy Studios and Greg would often joke that Arnold should produce the group’s next LP. It was only a joke as the thought was an impossibility. Then the idea became a plausibility, then a possibility and finally a reality. 

That brings us to today. We are in the preproduction phase of our new LP "In Search of Adam" and we are wanting to make the best possible record that we can. We want to avoid some of the pitfalls that happen to musicians nowadays so we hired Arnold and his studio in order to make this record the way we believe records are supposed to be made. It would seem that the events that brought us together over the last 10 years were coincidence, but we want believe that they were fate. We don’t know what the next chapter will be but we would love to have each and everyone of our fans be a part of our story. 

-On Being Human


Our goals

To be clear, we are going to make this record happen no matter what! The burden of that is pretty large to bare on just the five of us, so we are simply asking for a little help.  

  • The amount that we are asking for isn't the full amount of what a record on this scale costs, but we don't necessarily believe we should ask for that much. This record is our responsibility and we take it very seriously. That being said, it costs a lot to do a record with a Diamond selling Producer at a high quality studio with analog gear and a large console! The funds raised will all go to partially paying back the studio costs incurred. 
  • Obviously we are going to hook up our pledgers with new music; but we also have some other things. We are going to be giving away an unreleased recording of an EP that was secret until now! Want us to record your favorite video game track?? Want to come hang in the studio or better yet; want us to produce a song for you in the same studio? Check out the perks below to see what we have to offer! 
  • If we don't reach our go, that will not stop this process! We are already all in and will bare the burden ourselves if need be because we believe that investing in ourselves is the best thing to invest in. 

The Impact

We are going to make "In Search of Adam" and take it everywhere we can. This is the all-in moment for us and we believe that these songs with the help of Arnold Lanni will help us turn On Being Human into a career for all of us. Every record we've made has pushed us further up and further out, so with the friends and fans we've made over the years we believe that gravity will take it's course. 

The Humans are Coming Vol. 2

Some of you may only know us from our video-game based cover album "The Humans are Coming" on Retrowaretv.com. We want to know that part of this campaign will directly help in the creation of the 2nd album of covers. Some of the perks will lead to the direct involvement of what songs we will pick for the next album. It can be your favorite track from your favorite game or a medley of your choosing! We see it all as part and parcel to what On Being Human is trying to achieve.

The band release “eVe” in January of 2012 and built a name for themselves earning Band of the Month recognitions from Hot Topic, Musicians Friend and Infectious Magazine as well as being labeled one of the best bands from Temecula from CBS Los Angeles. They needed to play more shows in support of “eVe” but they were still in need of a full time drummer. Kevin Garcia of I Am Cassettes had been jamming with Gustin Flaig in his Orange County based group Rebel Revive and decided that Gustin would be a perfect fit for On Being Human. Kevin started to slowly put the idea in Gustin’s head until Gustin decided it needed to happen. After joining On Being Human, Gustin and crew played all around Southern California and even made a trek out to Washington D.C. to play MainStage at Magfest 13 in support of their video game music based cover album “The Humans are Coming Vol.1”. The group built up their own new songs it preparation to release their next full length album “In Search of Adam”. Greg Johnson had been working with Arnold Lanni on his projects at Alchemy Studios and Greg would often joke that Arnold should produce the group’s next LP. It was only a joke as the thought was an impossibility. Then the idea became a plausibility, then a possibility and finally a reality. 
That brings us to today. We are in the preproduction phase of our new LP "In Search of Adam" and we are wanting to make the best possible record that we can. We want to avoid some of the pitfalls that happen to musicians nowadays so we hired Arnold and his studio in order to make this record the way we believe records are supposed to be made. It would seem that the events that brought us together over the last 10 years were coincidence, but we want believe that they were fate. We don’t know what the next chapter will be but we would love to have each and everyone of our fans be a part of our story. 
-On Being HumanOur goalsTo be clear, we are going to make this record happen no matter what! The burden of that is pretty large to bare on just the five of us, so we are simply asking for a little help.  
The amount that we are asking for isn't the full amount of what a record on this scale costs, but we don't necessarily believe we should ask for that much. This record is our responsibility and we take it very seriously. That being said, it costs a lot to do a record with a Diamond selling Producer at a high quality studio with analog gear and a large console! The funds raised will all go to partially paying back the studio costs incurred. 
Obviously we are going to hook up our pledgers with new music; but we also have some other things. We are going to be giving away an unreleased recording of an EP that was secret until now! Want us to record your favorite video game track?? Want to come hang in the studio or better yet; want us to produce a song for you in the same studio? Check out the perks below to see what we have to offer! 
If we don't reach our go, that will not stop this process! We are already all in and will bare the burden ourselves if need be because we believe that investing in ourselves is the best thing to invest in. 
The ImpactWe are going to make "In Search of Adam" and take it everywhere we can. This is the all-in moment for us and we believe that these songs with the help of Arnold Lanni will help us turn On Being Human into a career for all of us. Every record we've made has pushed us further up and further out, so with the friends and fans we've made over the years we believe that gravity will take it's course. The Humans are Coming Vol. 2Some of you may only know us from our video-game based cover album "The Humans are Coming" on Retrowaretv.com. We want to know that part of this campaign will directly help in the creation of the 2nd album of covers. Some of the perks will lead to the direct involvement of what songs we will pick for the next album. It can be your favorite track from your favorite game or a medley of your choosing! We see it all as part and parcel to what On Being Human is trying to achieve.

story:
Short Summary

We are A Feast for Kings, a metal band from the Kentucky area. For those of you who aren't familiar with us, we recently lost our brother and frontman Eric Gentry. He went to be with the Lord on May 17th, 2014. We are currently in the process of raising money for the family. This campaign's purpose is to create memorial shirts to remember Eric. All proceeds will go to the Gentry family. Your donations will help keep Eric's memory alive and will help the Gentry family immensely.

What We Need & What You Get

We set the goal at $800 but would love to show the Gentry family as much love and support as possible. Help us surpass this by as much as possible! 

If you donate $15.00 dollars or more you will receive one of the memorial shirts that we are making. Donations of any amount are appreciated and accepted, but $15.00 is the minimum amount to receive a shirt. If you feel it in your heart to donate over $15.00, feel free to do so. All donations are appreciated and we can not thank you enough for your support.

The Impact

The impact you all make means the world to us and the Gentry family.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to check out our Indie Go-Go campaign. 

Julius Seizure is a five piece DIY(Do It Yourself) band from Northern New Jersey.
As a DIY band we've been able to overcome many obstacles that most artists struggle with. 
 
Without the support of a label or management Julius Seizure have been able to release a debut record, tour the east coast, and get national/international air play for our single "TMSNEV" on stations such as SiriusXM Satellite Radio and Sweden based Bandit Rock.
 
This Campaign has been designed to help us get to the next level and we need your help.
While being a self sustaining band many times we are faced with some harsh realities. Many of such are issues caused due to lack of proper monetary funding.
Many times when trying to get our music out to a larger audience  we have to all personally endure debt to further push the band forward.
This debt at times leaves the band struggling to find a way to produce more records, new merchandise, or simply have enough in the gas tank to get to the next gig.
Julius Seizure is on the verge of breaking new ground by bringing new music to new territories and larger Audiences. With your help we can all make it to the level we've been working so hard to get to.
 
By contributing to our campaign you are not only helping a band of brothers make it to a nationally and internationally recognizable level. You are making a statement to the current music industry by showing them that a DIY band along with their friends and community can forge ahead in a professional manor without owing their very existence and every penny to an industry only out to exploit them. Lets show the world that with a sense of compassion, community, and comradery, we can change the status quo and prove once and for all that the power of many is greater than the control of the few who try to manipulate the culture of art, expression and free spirit.
We wish that it didn't cost money to create and bring our love and passion to the masses. Unfortunately this is an expensive reality.
 
Although our budget for the release and distribution of our new record "Trials" is around $4,000, we are only looking to raise a modest $1,000. We are hard working band and do not expect the world do pay our way. However this goal of $1000 would help tremendously in so many ways.
 
The money you donate will help off set the costs of production for our new record "Trials" as well contribute to the creation of new merchandise for the release. Every dollar donated will go to the following; 
1). Studio rental
2). Recording sessions for "Trials"
3). Mixing and mastering of the record 
4). Art work and t-shirt designs
5). Cd duplication and registration with iTunes.
6). Creation of new merchandise to help promote Julius Seizure and the new record.
7). Print and digital advertising to promote "Trials."
8). Production and video shoots in Las Vegas of two brand new music videos to coincide with the release of Trials
 
We have created some special "donor incentives" and "perks" for those willing to contribute. These perks include receiving digital/physical copies of the new record, merch bundles including new shirt designs, and even a private party and performance from Julius Seizure!
 
We understand that in these tough times we are not the only ones suffering financially and not every might be able to contribute on a monetary level. 
In the event that you can't donate We ask that you show your love and support by sharing our campaign with your friends, family and community.
Help get Julius Seizure back on the road with this new record "Trials" and we promise to continue to forge forward with ultimate determination and hard work.
Thank you for believing in us and DIY artists. 
You are the foundation of our very existence.
 
Cheers,
-Charlie, Steve, Anthony, Brian, & Kyle(Julius Seizure)

story:
** 4 MORE VIDEOS POSTED UNDER THE UPDATES TAB!!!**

CLICK ON UPDATES TO HEAR ME SING SOMEONE LIKE YOU BY ADELE, DARK WALTZ BY HAYLEY WESTENRA, THE REAL ME BY NATALIE GRANT, AND STRONGER BY MANDISA! :)

HELP NEEDED and only a WEEK to pull it off!! *WE ARE HALFWAY TO OUR GOAL!! THANKS FOR THE SUPPORT! 

My name is Angel Cheney. I am 34 years old and am a mom of four, wife of 15 years to the love of my life, singer/songwriter, artist, author, poet, and I love to sing!! More importantly I LOVE TO SING FOR JESUS! He is the reason behind everything I do.

I can remember being six years old, barefoot in my backyard with the pristine backdrop of the Pacific Northwest, cassette player in hand, singing songs that I made up at the top of my voice. Then I would eagerly rewind the cassette tape and listen to my creation, knowing in my heart that one day I would have to do that for real. :)

Unfortunately my dad passed away from cancer last year before he got to see that become a reality. However, before he passed he made me promise not to give up and to make it happen. So, that is what I must do. Daddy, this first cd is dedicated to you.

I have been working with the amazing, award-winning songwriter/singer/producer Kim McLean (www.kimmclean.com) on my first album of original music and am happy to say that studio time is waiting for me in Nashville this summer.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Thank you to those that have already contributed to this project!! The funds in hand are a bit short to finish within the timeline established for this project so we NEED YOUR HELP!  I am believing that God has a plan and that this really can be pulled off in the next week. Believe with me! 

The money from this campaign will be used to fully fund our budget and pay the professional musicians, studio, engineer, and producer. It will also allow for the manufacture of cds, graphics, and a small promotions budget.

Any extra money will go toward the purchase of a macbook pro so that I can utilize it for songwriting purposes. Any money after that will be held in an account for the expenses of the next full length cd.

AND THERE ARE PERKS!!!!

Check out the awesome perks you can claim for contributing to this campaign! Free stuff! Original art!!! Check out my shop ArtAwakening on Etsy to view some of my art. Trust me, you want to get in on this!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • PRAY! Please pray that God will be glorified and that the Holy Spirit will be present in every aspect of this process, in the studio; that He will sing through every note.
  • Spread the news! PLEASE let people know about this campaign. This can't happen without you!

Thank you!!! You are all loved!

story:
Who We Are:

The Chattanooga Girls Choir, established in 1987, provides exceptional choral music training and performance experiences for girls in grades 1-12  in the Chattanooga and surrounding areas.


What We Do:

Through the rehearsal, study and performance of a balanced and varied repertoire of choral literature, the singers develop skills in healthy vocal technique, music reading, and performance. Each year they are also given performance opportunities around our region and throughout the world. They have sung in places such as St. Peter’s Basilica in Vatican City, Rome, Italy; the White House for the President of the United States and in concert at Carnegie Hall. 

Through participation in our organization these girls not only bloom into beautiful singers, but they also grow in poise, dignity, and professionalism.


What We Need:

Our organization exists on the support of grants and donations from those who strongly believe that the arts are an essential part of every community. Your support will help make it possible for this type of community choral program to thrive.

As our 2014-2015 season begins our goal is a minimum of $4,000 during the Fall Semester to help us with need-based scholarships, operating expenses, upgrading equipment, replacing wardrobe, purchasing new music and facilitating performance opportunities.

The Chattanooga Girls Choir is a 501c3 organization and all donations are tax deductible.


What You Get:

To show our appreciation we are offering the following perks to those who contribute at each of these levels.
  • $50    Girls Choir Edelweiss Logo Tote Bag
  • $100  2 Reserved Seat (center section) Winter Concert
  • $200  2 Passes to hear the girls at Rock City
  • $400   Everything above plus a ½ page ad in the Winter Concert Program

Please consider supporting the arts in our area and making girls dreams come true.


Other Ways You Can Help:

Can't make a donation at the present time? Here are other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with others. Use Indiegogo share tools!
  • Check with your employer about helping support us through corporate donations.
  • Locate and donate items for our spring silent auction.
  • Encourage friends and family who have girls that enjoy singing to explore our organization.

story:
Our Story

Coastal Rise is made up of friends who found each other (not 
intentionally) through mutual passions for our art, and our common interests and goals 
- creating an amazing sound that is uniquely our own.  We are a very passionate, Soul-driven musical arrangement. Inspired through reverberations from the Surf & Skate Culture, we've acquired a Dual-Dimensional musical outreach, touching the lives of both younger and older generations. With the balance of crescendo & decrescendo, our music arrangements inspire the hearts of all. Coastal Rise is committed to delivering organic grooves with deliberate sensitivity, for many years to come.


The Impact

Our goal is to reach young and older generations alike, lifting spirits and giving pause to what really matters in life. Our life and faith are our inspirations.  Music is our expression. We hope to express and share this inspiration as widely and with as many as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

We see our music first as a ministry.  We play with as much joy for a "crowd" of 20 as we do for 200 or 2000!  


Smaller venues often cannot always provide the band with love donations even though it might be there wish.  This means we often pay our own traveling expenses - sometimes traveling for as much as 16 hours one way.  Money we bring in from "paid gigs" goes right back into the bank to help with "free gigs."  


What we need:  Money raised would help us purchase an enclosed trailer for our gear (allowing us to travel in just one vehicle!) and sound equipment (since we have to rent equipment for venues that don't have their own!).


The short story:  WE WANT TO BE ABLE TO SAY "YES!" TO EVERY REQUEST FOR COASTAL RISE!


What you get:  Donation of $10 or more = CR sticker

                          Donation of $30 or more = CR sunglasses 

                          Donation of $100 or more = Signed CR CD

                          Donation of $1000 or more = Signed CD, t-shirt, sunglasses, stickers, & a Surfers Bible


Other Ways You Can Help

1. Prayer.

2. Like us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/pages/CoastalRise/18296...

3. MAKE SOME NOISE ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN!

4. More Prayer ;)
